Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: ddforbes30
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Boardwalk and it didn't disappoint us. The hotel was spotless and the room was spacious. We love the fact that it is a mere 10 minute walk to Epcot and you can take the water shuttle or walk to Hollywood Studios in about 20 minutes. We are pretty picky about where we stay but I can tell you that we highly recommend it for it's cleanliness and location.

Reviews.Title: “Flower Festival time at Disney, FL”
Reviews.Author: VegasVet53
Reviews.Content: Four of us travelled to DisneyWorld Florida for the Spring Garden Festival and concert series. We stayed at the Boardwalk Villas since you can easily walk to the Epcot entrance and the HollyWood Studios Park entrances. We shared a two bedroom unit with a full kitchen, multliple bathrooms (3) two porches/lanais. The room was very clean; the hotel was quiet and clean and offered several types of opportunities to enjoy your vacation: you could walk to the parks, swim in the pools, take a shuttle to the Marketplace, play miniature golf, dine in restaurants ranging from a hot dog at the booth to excellent table service at Kat Kora's restaurant or the noise and excitement at the ESPN Club. We enjoyed visits to the Yacht Club and Beach Club across the lake from the Boardwalk. I would encourage any reader who is thinking of visiting WDW to stay at this fine hotel. Note: There are two sides to the hotel - one has hotel rooms and no kitchens and the other, the Villas, has studios, one bedroom units, two bedroom units and a grand vacation home with 3 bedrooms. I would definitely recommend the Villas.

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy!”
Reviews.Author: Familywilltravel5
Reviews.Content: We got to stay here a couple of nights of our trip. The little kitchen and huge bathroom were great for families. Plenty of thunderstorms so the washer and dryer were well used. The mattresses were too hard, considering it is a deluxe resort. Two huge balconies with a view of the waterway and the dolphin swan resort. Hallways are long but didn't bothers us. If you have an older relative traveling(or little ones), you might want to make sure you are closer to lobby. The clown slide and pool were a lot of fun. There was no lifeguard at the top to supervise people getting on the slide. A potentially dangerous situation. A lot of restaurants to choose from on boardwalk. Even some quick service choices. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Near Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: bmp68
Reviews.Content: My family of four and I spent a week in a 1 bedroom villa overlooking the small pool at the resort. The room was very nice. We enjoyed the beach cottage theme and the layout of the villa was interesting and functional. The room featured a small kitchen, living room, bedroom and a large bathroom with a shower, toilet and sink in one room and a separate whirlpool bath, walk-in closet and vanity in another. You could even open some shutters and watch the bedroom TV while soaking, something my kids thought was a great novelty. We also found the room to be clean and well kept. The only exception was the two pretzel sticks we found when we pulled out the couch to recover an item that fell behind. The resort itself was great. The main pool had a circus theme with a huge water slide shaped like an old roller coaster and poolside bar that looked like a carousel. There was also a "community center" with games for the kids. On the Boardwalk you find a variety of restaurants, shops and activities. One of my main complaints about Walt Disney World is the sheer size of the place. This makes transportation around the various parks and attractions an important consideration. The Epcot resorts (including the Boardwalk, Beach Club, Yacht Club, Swan and Dolphin) all share a great central location. Epcot was a short walk, Hollywood a short boat ride and it was only a quick bus trip to most everywhere else with the exception of the Magic Kingdom which was best reached by catching the Monorail from Epcot (on the opposite side of the park). Service at the hotel was as excellent. Help was there whenever you needed it without being under foot. To be fair however, our trip went so smoothly we never really put them to the test. If I was disappointed with any aspect of our stay it was the food. We had hoped that with all of the choices around the resort we could find something better than mass produced theme park dining. Perhaps, if we had been on the ball enough to book reservations weeks in advance (and spent upwards of $70 a plate), we could have, but by the time we were there our choices were limited. And don't even get me started about the coffee (ick), just bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “One of Disneys best resorts”
Reviews.Author: SCTravelgal
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Boardwalk villas for our first part of our Disney trip. We stayed here back in 1996 right after it opened. Everything is still as amazing as it was back then. We enjoyed our 1 bedroom villa overlooking the main themed pool. It was definitely enough room for the 5 of us with the kids sleeping on the pull-out couch in the living room giving us much needed time together after long days at the park. Having the separate access to the bathroom/tub area was also helpful. Everyone was eager to help from the front desk to the valet to everyone in the restaurants. My children loved ESPN so much that we ate there several nights. It was a nice treat to be able to come back after a day in the parks and relax on the boardwalk and watch the "street entertainment" that was available. We will definitely return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: lswoods74
Reviews.Content: We did online check-in about a week before arriving. When we got to the hotel, we did not have to wait in line and our room was ready (it was 2pm). We had requested an upper floor (got 3rd floor) and close to elevators (it wasn't close, but was near stairs and turned out to be a nice quiet location). The room overlooked the boardwalk which was nice for sitting out at night. We could also see the fireworks from Epcot. It was a little noisy at night, but once the balcony door was closed, it was quiet. We were in a studio room. The room itself was clean and spacious. Enough room for the 4 of us and all our stuff. We were staying on points so we had trash & towel service on day 4 and full cleaning day 8. We loved the location (15minute walk to Hollywood Studios and less than 10 minute walk to Epcot). We also took the boat to both those parks on occasion and found they were a nice break from walking. We never waited long for a boat. The buses were also pretty good, but at the end of the night stops at Swan & Dolphin and then Beach Club before Boardwalk happened often. This made for quite a long ride when you just wanted to get back to your room. The kids liked the pool and especially the clown slide. We didn't go to the quiet pool. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We also found the Screen Door store to be very convenient for snacks, or items you needed. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: jj435Rye
Reviews.Content: We have a Disney Vacation Club ownership at the Boardwalk Villas and thoroughly enjoy our stay every time we come. The hotel is within walking distance of both Hollywood Studios and EPCOT, although there is also boat transportation to both parks. Buses go directly to all other Disney attractions. We're so close that we can just walk over to EPCOT for the fireworks in about 10 minutes. There are several eating places on the Boardwalk, ranging from fast-food stands, a bakery, an ice cream shop and a pizza window to more elaborate restaurants. And at night the Boardwalk comes alive with free (yes, free) entertainment. It's great fun. There are also two pools and bike rentals. And, if you don't get enough exercise during the busy days, there's a well-equipped fitness room, and the area is great for walking or running. You don't have to own a time share to stay here; our first visit was over 10 years ago when we booked last minute and were only able to get rooms here. We're very happy that happened.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Boardwalk has a Lot to Offer!”
Reviews.Author: seattle_ali
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a one-bedroom suite at the Boardwalk Villas with my mother and sister. It was Mom's first trip to Disney, and for my sister and I it was our 5th time traveling there. None of us had seen or been to the Boardwalk Villas before. As the Magic Express bus drives you up to the property the Boardwalk opens up before you. They did a wonderful job of creating the feel of a turn-of-the-century Atlantic City or Coney Island. The entrance and lobby are gorgeous - be sure to look up when you enter the hotel lobby and check out the amazing carousel-themed lighting fixture. We were all incredibly pleased with our room. Having a kitchen and washer and dryer was a great benefit. We have stayed at the budget Disney properties in the past and weren't used to having these amenities. Now that we've experienced the joys of in-room laundry and being able to prepare quick meals in our room, as well as to make a morning pot of coffee before you even jump in the shower I don't know if we will be able to go back to staying at the budget hotels again! We loved all of the evening entertainment on the Boardwalk, as well as having the option of having a quiet pool in addition to the main pool. But our favorite feature was how quickly we could walk to Epcot from the Boardwalk. As other reviews stated, Epcot is about a 5 minute walk away, and Hollywood Studios is about a 10-15 minute walk. You can also hop on a boat to get to either park, which will take more time but comes in handy for tired feet. We had a wonderful visit to Disney World, and will definitely consider staying at the Boardwalk again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Resort! One of our Disney Favorites!”
Reviews.Author: gagirl47
Reviews.Content: We love this resort so much that we decided to join the Disney Vacation Club with this as our home resort. We come here several times a year and usually get a 1 BR Boardwalk View. The rooms theme is great and the colors pleasant and tasteful. The close proximity to Disney Hollywood Studio's and Epcot is the best! You can easily walk to either park or take the boats which is a pleasant ride. The Villa's provide a great "home away from home" with a full kitchen (1BR), King bed, family room and balcony. The Boardwalk view rooms offer a great view of the Boardwalk, the Beach Club and the "high" fireworks at Epcot. There are several rooms with mostly enclosed balconies which we try to stay away from because they make the rooms dark (less sunlight coming in) and you have to stand to watch anything from the balcony. The restaurants and shops on the Boardwalk are good and between the Boardwalk area, the Yacht and Beach Club and the Swan and Dolphin, you have plenty of places to eat within easy walking distance. The Clown pool was a big hit with our kids with their waterslide and the carousel pool bar is a favorite for the adults! Try the Captains Mai Tai! It is so tasty! :)All in all, due to location, room size and quality and convenient walk or boat ride to Epcot which is highly desired during the Flower and Garden festival in the spring and the Food and Wine festival in the fall, this is one of our favorite resorts anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Either this....or that....”
Reviews.Author: GC967
Reviews.Content: We checked into two rooms, had asked for connecting due to the fact that my grandson is in a wheelchair and on oxygen at night and it makes it much easier for him to go from room to room. We made the request when making the reservation, I called the week before and explained again that it wasn't an idle request, my travel agent called and I called the Boardwalk directly the morning of check-in and was told for the FOURTH time that it isn't guaranteed but for a special reason like this they would see to it, no worries. When we check in our rooms were side by side, not connecting. Couldn't do anything for me, so sorry. We went to my daughter's villa first, it was fine. My husband and I walked into our room and the odor of mildew was overwhelming, it was late, we were tired, we went to bed. Next morning I left the maid a note about the odor and we left. Got back to the rooms at 6 and my daughters room was fine, the maid had missed ours, hadn't even been in the door. Called and had clean towels brought to us for the next morning and we went left to go swimming. Next day left another note, when we came back the maind had been there and the dishwasher was running, it ran for another hour before I finally turned it off and called maintenance to report it. My husband got in the shower and cold water was pouring out of the light above him, the clothes in the dryer had to be put through 4 times to get dry, called maintenance again and was told they would be fixed. My duaghter's room was fine, I am so glad that the children were not in our room and we had a wonderful time despite all of this. When my husband was agin doused with cold water during his shower he went to the desk and complained. They were not very helpful, he finally spoke to a manager and they gave him a $200 credit. For what we were paying for the room I don't really think that was enought but "it is what it is". So, beware, your room can be perfectly fine....or not. Please know that we have been to Disney and stayed on the property over a dozen times and we will be returning. The property is getting a little old and it was our first times at the Boardwalk, we love the Beach Club and it actually has a better pool for older children, Boardwalk pool is clown theamed and a bit young for us but both are very nice. The grandchildren are at an age that they love Epcot the most and this is a perfect location. When younger we always stayed at the Contemporary Resort and have stayed at Port Orleans and the Wilderness Lodge also but find the constant busses difficult. Had our room not had so many glitches we wouldn't have had a problem with staying here, just be aware that while most of the rooms are fine there are some that are feeling their age and you may be getting one of them. During a busy week or if you are traveling with a group you want to be near there may be no way to move out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location was amazing”
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl2010
Reviews.Content: Can't imagine that any of the better rated resorts can beat this! Everything was perfect. Service, as throughouyt the whole of Disney, was amazing. Rooms were big and comfortable. The location is incredible. Quick walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. So many great places to eat on the Boardwalk, including the Boardwalk Bakery. Yummy breakfasts! Can't say enough great stuff about it - wish I could afford to go there every year!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: Went 2nd week in January. A great time to visit WDW, it's the off-season and crowds were low. Weather was intermittent, with some days on the 70's and others in the 50's. Dress in layers. The Boardwalk was not our first choice, so I was a little hesitant, but it turned out great. We rented a one-bedroom villa. My wife and I stayed in the king bedroom and our two daughters (age 5 and 8) shared the pull-out sofa in the living room. The room was clean and in good condition. The bathroom was large, with toilet, sink, and shower and there's a separate room w/ whirlpool tub, sink and closet. The kitchen is compact, but had a full-size fridge, stove, microwave and dishwasher. There's a washer/dryer in the room. Because we were not timeshare owners, you get daily maid service. All utensils were provided, plus dishwasher soap, dish soap, and laundry detergent. There's also a safe in the room (free). Didn't use wifi. We used Garden Grocer to deliver groceries for breakfast, and the delivery was waiting for us when we arrived. The room has a small balcony and overlooked the pool area. Even though the pool is open at night, we didn't have any noise issues - probably due to the cold weather. On those days when it was warm enough we used the pool. My kids loved it; just the right size for them. There's both a regular pool and a kiddie pool, plus a large slide. If you are looking for more, stay at another resort or hit the water parks. There's also a snack bar and family restroom. Towels were plentiful. The decor of the resort is lovely, I felt like I was walking onto the set of "Boardwalk Empire". We ate at two of the restaurants, Big River Grill and Kouzzina. Both had good food, prices were typical for Disney. Tip: Don't sit outside at Big River - lots of seagulls who don't have any fear of tourists. The location was the best part - it's part of the "Epcot Resorts" - you can walk to Epcot (a bit long for little kids) and Hollywood Studios (even longer), but the best way to both is by boat. A very quick and leisurely trip. You arrive at the back entrance of Epcot, close to the World Showcase, which is perfect for dinner. Transport to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom is by bus - about 30 and 45 minutes, respectively. Not as nice, but it gets you there. If you are worried about staying at a timeshare, don't. There's no high-pressure sales. In fact, except for the timeshare sales desk in the lobby, you wouldn't know you were in the timeshare section. Disney has a good reputation for being very low-key about timeshare sales. I would definitely stay there again and have no hesitancy about recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...”
Reviews.Author: fstkst
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late, we stayed in November (got busy, what can I say). Perfect location for EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. Since my husband and I tend to spend most of our time at EPCOT (especially during the food and wine festival) - this location is ideal as we walked to the park in about 5 minutes. Short ferry ride to Hollywood. (You can also walk to Hollywood, but we took the ferry each time -it was a nice change from taking a bus). We had a small efficiency which was perfect for the two of us - coffee maker, microwave, fridge in the room. I can't speak to the Boardwalk itself as we spent most of our time in the parks. I would return to Boardwalk in a second!!! I have been to Disney 5 times - this and Animal Kingdom lodge are by far my favorites but this does beat AK for its location. Staff at Boardwalk were extremely helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location with great amenities!”
Reviews.Author: cassie3375
Reviews.Content: Last week was my 2nd stay at the Boardwalk Villas and we had a blast (previous trip was February 2011)! This is an absolutely fantastic place to stay when visiting Disney with young ones. My youngest is 3 years old, so the separate bedroom was perfect for his naps. Plus, there is a full (small) kitchen and washer/dryer in the room. You can stock up on snacks/water at the general store that is on the boardwalk...gallons of water for $3 instead of $2.50 per bottle everywhere else. Not only are the amenities great, but you can comfortably walk to and from Epcot (great for after the 9 pm fireworks show), Hollywood Studios is a short boat ride away (walk to the Dolphin/Swan hotel stop to cut off 10-15 minutes from your boat ride), there are great restraurants (particularly Kouzzina by Cat Cora), and there is nightly entertainment on the boardwalk itself!!! The downside is that the property itself is starting to show its age, so the rooms are not quite as posh as you would expect for the price you are paying. All in all, love this hotel for the location and amenities, and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dinahgail
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I go to Disney for "Spa Weekend" every year. We usually stay at Saratoga where the spa is, but decided to stay at Boardwalk because of the location. That was the only good thing. Checking in was fine. We were in a one bedroom. It had the door connecting to the next room, which was occupied. It was as though the people next door were in the room with us. My daughter was up until they decided to call go to bed. The cups in the cabinet weren't clean. A housekeeping cart stayed outside our room the entire stay. I realize we were two doors down from their room, but it was annoying. Also the custodial carts stayed outside the room so our room, which was supposed to be garden view was custodial cart view. We stayed 3 nights and when we got up this morning to leave, I wasn't feeling well. I called to see if there was a way to delay check-out until I was sure I could make it out to the car and was told we could have a 30 minute extension. If we were not timeshare, they would accommodate a 2 hour extension, but we were time share so we had to leave by 11:30 or stay an extra day. We started taking things to the car at 10:55(it's quite the hike to the parking lot-- valet is $12 per day). When we got back to the room to get the rest of the stuff at 11:10, housekeeping had already thrown stuff away and started cleaning. It was disappointing since the points for Boardwalk are more. The guy who checked us in was great, but after that...

Reviews.Title: “Like Going Home”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Boardwalk 3 times since August. It has the best location on the Disney property for adults, but was always great for our kids when they were young too. The staff is always friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean. I love that we can prepare food and snacks, not only because is saves money but saves time too. I went twice with my husband who loves to do his daily run around the lake, last week I met my adult daughter who had not been for a while and she loved the feeling of home that it had. Having the Boardwalk Villa's as our home resort is one of the best investments we made for family fun. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: misshall02
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the other recent reviews, it's hard to believe we stayed in the same place! Yes, the location is stellar, but I have nothing else positive to say. We had a one bedroom villa. My first impression was that it smelled musty as we entered. And then it all went downhill. The room was extremely dated, but that could be overlooked. What couldn't was the fact that the room was filthy! The couch was terribly stained. There were crumbs on the kitchen counter and toothpaste with hair stuck in it in the bathrooms. When we pulled out the bed in the couch for our daughters, there were pieces of chocolate (I hope) ground into the blanket. Not stained, because they came up when we scratched at them with our nails--they just never changed the bedding. We had to call down for new bedding and 45 minutes later they still weren't there. Our little girls fell asleep on makeshift beds of their own blankets! The next day we demanded a new room and they did give us half off the first night. BUT, the next room was worse (you'd think if a customer complained of a dirty room, you'd check the next one first)! Stained couch, crumbs and coffee grounds on the counters, food on the floor, and an obviously used sponge for dishes were not the worst of it. The bathrooms were DISGUSTING! Little hairs on the floor and in the tub and DRIED URINE on the toilet seat! No joke! I was beyond shocked and disappointed after having gone on the Disney Dream less than a year before with immaculate conditions and service! This time we demanded to switch properties. We were moved to Bay Lake Towers which was clean, beautiful, and everything we expected from Disney! I just wish we hadn't missed an entire day of tickets to take of a problem we shouldn't have had in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: brandi2409
Reviews.Content: Typically, we stay at Disney's Saratoga Springs for our yearly visit to Disney World because of it's convenient location to Downtown Disney. This year, we decided to stay at The Boardwalk instead and it was awesome! I personally don't think you can go wrong with any Disney hotel, but the Boardwalk was extremely convenient. We enjoy an "adult" Disney and do not have kids, so we loved the location near Jellyrolls and other night time spots. There are plenty of family-friendly options also, including the "street" performers. Also, Epcot and Hollywood Studio's are a short walk away, and since those are the parks that we visit most, it couldn't have worked out better!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED our stay at Boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: crazyzeus1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time at Disney's Boardwalk Resort and boy, what a great hotel! We were in a 1 room villa and it had everything we could have ever wanted. The kitchen was well appointed and the appliances were all very clean. The oven worked great. It was nice to have a dishwasher so we could run our water bottles through at the end of the day, along with all the dishes we used at meals. The bathroom was split into two parts. One room had a large jacuzzi tub & sink/vanity, and the other room had a pedestal sink, toilet, & large shower with a wonderful shower head. We found this split worked great...someone could have privacy while showering and everyone else could still get ready in the other bathroom! There was a fold-out couch in the living room that was very comfortable. Our room was on the 1st floor and we had a group of ducks that visited our patio every morning, looking in the window to see if we could feed them any bread :) The BEST part about the hotel though is the proximity to EPCOT. You literally walk 5 minutes and are at a back entrance to EPCOT (near France in the World Showcase). I think the most folks we ever saw coming through this entrance was about 5. No wait in long lines...the bag security check point was quick and then you're in! The walk to EPCOT is beautiful and you feel like you're "in the park" the entire time you're staying at Boardwalk...the Disney magic is never gone. I also loved that you didn't have to deal with parking to go to EPCOT. You just took a quick beautiful stroll down the boardwalk & over a small bridge. There is also a boat that will take you to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios which was fun (and if you're paying for parking at the parks, it will save you money!) We didn't do any of the on-site entertainment, but we saw an outdoor movie on the lawn shown a few nights, lots of cast-let games in the pool, and a really cute pool slide. I can't wait until we can come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!”
Reviews.Author: bobbie72
Reviews.Content: I own the Disney Vacation Club and the Disney's Boardwalk Villas have by far the best location of any of the resorts that we can stay at. The hotel sits between Epcot and Hollywood Studios so you can easily walk or boat to both theme parks. I love the boardwalk theme so you can see magician shows outside at night, play amusement games, go dancing at the dance hall, hit up the ESPN Bar, shop, and they also have several restaurants including my favorite the Big River Grille and Brewing Works. I usually stay in a studio which has plenty of place for two people, the rooms could use alittle facelift compared to some of the newer hotels but they are still very nice and include a sitting area with a table/chairs, a coach that opens to another bed, kitchenette area with microwave/sink, and frig. The closet has a safe, and of course a nice patio deck so you can take in the sights depending on the view usually I get a boardwalk or pool view. The concierge is always very nice and accomidating, the entrance to the hotel is beautiful and I love the main and quiet pool which always have plenty of towels and chairs. I would definitely would recommend staying at The Boardwalk, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Finally, they have wireless!”
Reviews.Author: strider64NewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk villas in early January. One of the drawbacks of all the WDW resorts is the fact that they have no wireless (just an ethernet port that costs $10 a day to use). But for the deluxe resorts at least, they now have free wireless and it's about time. It's relatively fast, although not as fast as at the Swan and Dolphin. We had a nice one bedroom that overlooked the path to Hollywood Studios. Our bathroom had a maintenance issue; the shower stalls have a light fixture in the ceiling and when the people upstairs took a shower, the water leaked through it into our bathroom. I left the light off in the shower for the rest of our visit and notified housekeeping. I suspect some corners were cut when the resort was built. Other than that, the villa was extremely pleasant with the usual friendly Disney service. My past gripes had to do with the lack of wireless, and I'm glad that's taken care of, but it would also be nice to have a wider selection of TV stations and less of the endless Disney infomercials on channel after channel. The Swan and Dolphin is a better deal in that regard. It's hard for me to understand why the DisneyWorld resort nickel and dimes' its customers on relatively small matters like this.

Reviews.Title: “Service Still Top Notch but Rooms Could Use a Facelift”
Reviews.Author: gregoryd38
Reviews.Content: Boardwalk Villas remain one of the best hotel options at Disney, particularly for families. The location is ideal, allowing guests to walk (or boat) to Hollywood Studios, Epcot, and the Fantasia Fairways mini-golf attraction. The service remains quite good, with ample bell, desk, and concierge staff to address most needs quickly and completely. And the common areas are impressive and meticulously maintained. Only drawback to this hotel is that it has reached the age at which (or beyond which) the rooms should have been renovated. The carpets and furniture look worn and a bit dingy. And the rooms could stand a fresh coat of paint. Still a good hotel choice, but this hotel's premium pricing really does demand better from the rooms. Will be an excellent hotel choice if the rooms are renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: americaninparis08
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the Boardwalk (on the villas side) after our Disney cruise, and really enjoyed our stay. The location is really the number one best feature of this hotel! The easy walk to Epcot and the boat to Hollywood Studios are so convenient. If you're up for a bit of a scenic walk, you can even make it to Hollywood Studios on foot in about 15 minutes. We stayed in a studio villa and bought groceries for our breakfasts, because the one downfall of this hotel is the lack of quick dining options (the breakfast options are definitely lacking). Having the kitchenette was very handy and saved money in the long run anyway, because we just ate bagels and cereal in our room every morning and then headed out! The hallways are very long on the villas side, but it didn't bother us. Definitely ask for a high floor - the views are wonderful. Our boys loved the pool - especially the waterside! The giant clown head is a little odd, but they gave the slide very high marks in spite of it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and convenient!”
Reviews.Author: deana68
Reviews.Content: We went to WDW 2 days before my sister and her family met us. For those 2 days we stayed at BWV. We LOVED the location- walked to EPCOT and to Disney Studios. The studio is smaller than OKW,but we had view of boardwalk and EPCOT. We could see fireworks from illumination and Spaceship Earth. Great place to jog in AM- around the water over to Beach Club side. Wish we had points here so we could stay during busier times! Enjoyed this more than Animal Kingdom Lodge b/c of location and the Victorian feel. We did have bad experience with VERY long wait with concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, adult place to stay. Had a great time, nice walk to Epcot.”
Reviews.Author: Aaron F
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with how not over the top with Disney this place was. I was affraid of a week of Disney overload but instead I got a good service and a great room. I'm not a "Disney Person" and I went with friends for a week. We visited Magic Kingdom, Hollywood Studios, Animal Kingdom and of course Epcot. Epcot was a very short walk and was the best place to be anyhow. Hollywood Studios was a long walk or you can ride a boat from the Boardwalk. The rest of the parks required the shuttle buses. If you are patient and don't let the wait or bus route bother you the busses are fine (you're on vacation, just relax and be patient). Downtown Disney is also a shuttle ride away. The Boardwalk is nice and you could walk a lap in about 20 minutes, my suggestions are the Japanese Resturant in the Swan Hotel (5 minute walk), Fuego for Drinks in Downtown Disney (cigar bar) and most of the food in Epcot. Avoid the smelly Big River Grille and the ESPN Zone. Hope you enjoy whatever you decide, have a magical day:).

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Disney 2011”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: We have been DVC members since 2006 and have loved every minute of it. Our primary reason for becoming DVC members were the accomodations at the Boardwalk Villas....even though our points are split between Saratoga Springs and Animal Kingdom Lodge (both great resorts too). However, at this point of our lives you cannot beat the location of the Boardwalk Villas. We have 2 girls and it allows them greater flexibility to "come and go" given the immediate access to both EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. At the same time it allows Mom and Dad to sometimes lag behind and enjoy the Boardwalk area. Christmas is an all-time family favorite given the decorations in both the parks and as well in the hotel lobby. They truly do an amazing job that is guaranteed not to disappoint. Regarding the hotel, highly recommend a 1 BR given the added privacy and the W&D in the room. This makes for an easier trip when flying and eliminating the need to check bags at the airport. Recommend doing the on-line check and requesting close to transportation to allow for quicker access to bus transportation when going to Animal or Magic Kingdom. The fitness center and the pool on the property are great. We love Disney and what it represents. Hope you find this review to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Disney Property!”
Reviews.Author: FreyaB
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this Disney Property. I absolutely loved the location, you can walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. One of the down sides for me was there wasn't a counter service breakfast restaurant in the hotel, although you can get coffee and muffins in their bar area in the morning. Overall I loved the theme of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: danielleybelle
Reviews.Content: Staying at the boardwalk really is like going back to a simpler time. It's so much fun to wander around, watch the performers, and relax. The rooms are nice, I think it's worth it to get a Boardwalk View.

Reviews.Title: “One of Disney's best!”
Reviews.Author: disneyfairy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many of Disney hotels - I think this is one of the best places to stay. Great ambiance, location and decor. Our room was over the lobby and close to the Boardwalk and it was wonderful to open our balcony doors and listen to the old fashioned Christmas music playing on the Boardwalk. Our room and bed were very comfortable and spacious and I loved the decor. The Christmas decorations were beautiful (except for Stitch) and my favorite of all of the resorts. The location was close enough to World Showcase so you could almost consider it part of your resort if you have a park hopper or annual pass. The staff and service outstanding. This resort is lovely for couples, as it can be very romantic walking the Boardwalk at night. The path to Hollywood Studios is beautiful. The problems were the hot tub was never above lukewarm nor was the pool heated. The room also had a few minor problems, especially with the door knobs. The boat service is extremely slow. After visiting Universal - I don't understand why Disney can't invest in some new technology like they have for parking the boats - it would cut the time it takes them now in half. This area really needs a restaurant re-do many of the least popular restaurants are all right here on the Boardwalk but at least you have Epcot right around the corner :) There is a pizza window with okay pizza and the bakery has a few croissants but other than that there is no counter service restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!! Great stay at Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: lovinsj
Reviews.Content: Got a GREAT deal online for a week at the boardwalk villas in a studio... Check in was easy and fast (used disney's online check-in a few days in advance). We stayed in a studio at saratoga springs, so the room here was pretty much a duplicate. Couch, table, bed, small kitchen area, bathroom, but let's be honest; you're not in the room much at disney except to sleep. â€¨â€¨Room was decent, nothing spectacular so we changed and walked to hollywood studios.. Approx 15 min walk to the front gate; walked back then headed to epcot.. 5 min walk!!! 5 min from the boardwalk area to the side entrance to the epcot in between the UK and France. â€¨â€¨ First time for us being at Disney with all of the Christmas decorations up... Giant gingerbread house inside the lobby, as well as a large tree by the fireplace. The boardwalk area was fun and always entertaining.. â€¨â€¨I used the gym just about every day while my daughter/wife napped and it was well equipped and clean. I coach CrossFit and they had plenty to do and make up my own workouts. â€¨â€¨My wife was 29 weeks pregnant and got a massage at the health club... she said it was decent but nothing spectacular. There is a side room off the workout area they do massages in, and could hear the gym area while trying to relax during tÃ¥he massage.â€¨â€¨ Didn't use the pool but sat at the pool bar for drinks.. Had seasonal beer on tap.â€¨â€¨ Tried the beer sampler at the brewery, which was great. The only places we ate at the boardwalk were the ESPN zone which was good and our last night we got room service; the food was fantastic. â€¨â€¨â€¨The negatives - I know my title states location... but having a 2 and a half year old daughter, we like taking her to the magic kingdom more than the other parks. That was one drawback, it was a 30 minute bus ride to the magic kingdom. To and From.. Most days, we would just start at the epcot spend a few hours there then monorail it over to the MK, then take the bus ride home.â€¨â€¨ Same thing with the Animal kingdom.. the boardwalk would be the last stop on the loop (swan/dolphin/yacht club/beach club then boardwalk. â€¨â€¨Another negative was the bed... must be a disney thing since the past 3 trips we've been on, the beds sink in the middle.â€¨â€¨â€¨ (Polynesian, saratoga, now boardwalk) So a recap.. awesome location since 2 parks are within walking distance... the other 2 parks are a 30 min bus ride.. awesome hotel with a lot of amenities. We'd definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Miandrea
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a one-bedroom villa at Disney's Boardwalk Villas. The room was spacious and clean. We had a huge patio (room 3051) that overlooked the Boardwalk. The staff was friendly and helpful! Another magical holiday at Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: hipmomfromChiTown
Reviews.Content: Disney has something for everyone! And travelling with teenagers proved no exception. The BoardWalk is fabulous for all ages! BoardWalk location is the best of any Disney property. We were spoiled by not having to spend time riding buses to the Studios and Epcot. Great to be able to come and go to the nearby parks. Try the Flying Fish restaurant right on the BoardWalk. Delicious! Pool was lots of fun too! Getting to the golf courses was also convenient, as you can arrange to have a taxi pick you up and provide transportation. We recommend this resort over any other Disney properties! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat at this fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: JellyrollsKaren
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Boardwalk Villas almost 20 times (most recently in December, 2011), and the room has always been clean, comfortable, and in good repair. I usually get a Boardwalk view room, and it's great to sit out on the balcony and look out at the view of the Yacht & Beach Club, Epcot, and the activity on the Boardwalk below. You can even see the Epcot and Magic Kingdom fireworks from the Boardwalk view rooms. The staff at the resort is fantastic, especially Mary in the Belle Vue Lounge in the mornings and the bellstaff. Many of these cast members have been working at the resort for as long as I've been staying there, and it's great to see familiar faces on my trips. There is an excellent dueling pianos bar called Jellyrolls on the Boardwalk. It's a great place to spend a few hours after a long day in the park. The piano players are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Walt Disney Boardwalk Villa”
Reviews.Author: christines2060
Reviews.Content: Wonderful resort close to EPCOT. We chose the Boardwalk because it is close to EPCOT and dining. The resort was decorated for Christmas, with Santa sitting in front of the fire place and a Gingerbread house in the lobby. There were free cookies and lemonade for all. You feel like you are home when you walk into this resort. Everyone is very friendly and the decor is welcoming. We stayed in a studio room overlooking the pool. The room was spacious and had a microwave, mini fridge, toaster, and utensils. We brought some of our own food to stay within budget. The mini- fridge came in handy- especially with a family. There seemed to be plenty of rooms available. We made our reservations on December 21st for Christmas eve arrival. Wonderful hotel and very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk was a Blast”
Reviews.Author: armchair
Reviews.Content: This was our third and best stay at this resort. A cast member met us as we were disembarking the Magic Express bus, greeted us by name, had our check-in done, and gave us our information packet and room cards. Also included was a "first trip" button for our 16 month old granddaughter. Later that evening, we arrived back to our room to find beautiful cupcakes awaiting us! I love the location of this resort and the customer service can't be beat. We chose a standard view, but received a nice pool view on the fourth floor. We were also able to check our luggage and receive boarding passes there at the resort the day of departure. My only complaint is the long distances to the elevator, but our granddaughter loved toddling down the broad hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Lot's of fun on the Boardwalk. Perfect for anyone in a wheelchair.”
Reviews.Author: hanskitchens
Reviews.Content: We had another wonderful vacation at The Boardwalk Villas. We stayed for 7 nights in a 1 bedroom accessible villa. Everything about the room was very nice. Plenty of room to maneuver the wheelchair, large bathroom with a very comfortable roll in shower, 2 decent sized balconies overlooking the main pool, easy access to the elevators. There are many advantages to staying here. 5 minute walk to Epcot, 15 minute walk to MGM, lots of live entertainment on the boardwalk at night and plenty of restaurants to choose from. We did notice the staff here was not quite as nice as some of the other Disney resorts we have stayed at. It may just be a sign of the times as we are beginning to see cast members who are not as committed to their jobs as in the past, but for the most part they were wonderful and couldnâ€™t do enough for us. We are DVC members with many many trips under our belts, all with our multipli-challenged son. We enjoy walking to the parks which makes this a perfect location. The only time you need transportation is if you are going to Downtown Disney or the Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas trip”
Reviews.Author: soccer07
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Boardwalk and as always it is our favorite of the Disney resorts. It is an easy walk to either EPCOT or Hollywood Studios so no buses to deal with like at most of their hotels. I was greeted at the entrance and directed to check in where everything was all ready and I was in my room in less than 5 minutes. My only complaint is in the last few years ( I visit every Christmas for the last 20 years)their Christmas decoration over the hotels and parks have decreased drastically. The WOW factor is gone as you walk and look at the lights and decorations except for Cinderellas' castle which is still amazing. The entertainers and restaurants around the boardwalk are excellent and there is always more to do than you can possible do in a week. The pool and the slide are a family favorite and even in Dec you can swim. If you are planning a trip this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, and quieter than you may think!”
Reviews.Author: bostonterrier
Reviews.Content: As DVC members, we have stayed here once in the past. At the time, I remember thinking that it was fine, but somewhat noisy. This time (12/17--12/22), we just haven't noticed the noise at all. We have the wonderful space we need (2 br villa), a super location (walk to Epcot and the Studios) and the convenience of restaurants and activities on the boardwalk, plus the peace you (or at least I) need after a day at the parks. Plus, you can walk over to the Yacht Club (do NOT miss the Yachtsman Steakhouse if you like steak!!!) and the Periwig salon for a mani/pedi. Everything was modern, clean and updated in our villa, and plenty of bathroom/bedroom space plus kitchen and washer/dryer. We did not use room service, but the prices did not look crazy. VERY comfortable beds and love the jacuzzi!!! Overall service was very good, too. Big River Brewing was great for a good meal and some craft beer--my family had burgers (yum!) but I had the salmon (delish!)

Reviews.Title: “Magical family experience!”
Reviews.Author: dorrei
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 8 night stay in a 2 bedroom suite at the boardwalk villas. There were 5 adults and 3 kids under the age of 5 and we had plenty of room! I was very pleased with the room, the amenities, the kitchen, the whirl tub, closets space, 3 balconies. The gym, the arcade, pool, hot tub, playground were all at out fingertips. We also walked a 5 minute walk into Epcot or took the ferry service directly in front of the hotel. Everything was just so convenient, you cannot beat the location! A few misc. notes.... Garden grocer worked out fantastic. Ordered online and everything was delivered upon arrival to our room. Wound up ordered twice to get additional things mid week. Room service: stay away. Wound up ordering breakfast. Spent over 40 for rubbery pancakes. Food on boardwalk...Espn is a great choice. Large portions and delicious. River grille also good. I did not care for boardwalk coffee. Over $ 3 for burnt coffee. Decided was better off making it in room. As for hotel though, I loved the boardwalk. Service was exceptional and room was above standards. I'll be back. Btw, Christmas at Disney is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “No better place”
Reviews.Author: dansyr2514
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Boardwalk Villas but our 15th time at a Disney resort. This is absolutely one of my favorite resorts. We had a studio in the Village Green area of the Villas and the locations was amazing. We were on the 5th floor close to the elevators and main entrance facing the boardwalk side. The main pool was straight below us. The rooms were spacious and well furnished. We could see the high fireworks from our balcony. We were a 10 min walk to Epcot and maybe a 12 min walk to Hollywood studios. This was the perfect location since most of our time was spent at the food and wine festival in Epcot. One con for us was it was not easy to refill your refillable mug since their is no quick service location in the resort. You have to bring your mug to the pool bar or various locations on the boardwalk or a lounge in the resort. However, they cannot fill your mug for sanitary reasons so they fill a paper cup and you can pour it into your mug. Location can also be a key element. Our room was super convenient to everything but if you are at the far end of one of the halls, it can be a walk. There are no restaurants in the resort but many right down on the boardwalk itself. The resort is beautiful and the quiet pools are soooo quiet. Our room was very quiet but if you have a room right on the boardwalk, I imagine it could be noisy at times. We did not use the bus transportation because we had a rental car but we did use the boat a few times. The boats are very convenient if you are not in a hurry as both the boats and busses make several stops. We beat the boat to Hollywood studios a couple times walking. However, when you're feet are tired they are a welcome convenience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I did not have one serious complaint. The only thing I would change would be the ease of use of the refillable mugs. There is no spa but a pretty good fitness room is on the boardwalk level. I believe you can also have massages there. However there is a great spa just a short walk away at the dolphin hotel. If you are planning alot of time at Epcot, the Beach Club or Boardwalk can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “a perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: nvcorp
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 9 day suite at the board walk villas, for our disney vacations_ starting in the last week of October, till the 3rd NOv. '11 The disney feeling, took us over, right from the arrival at the Orlando airport, and the excitement for this disney vacations had already begun, even before we stepped up the receptionist desk at the board walk villas. on arrival, i had requested the receptionist, to give us the best possible location, and that, if by any chance, an upgrade to the one bedroom villa was possible ( it was going to be my son's eighth birthday celebration ). My son was already on a roll, as he was given the first time at disney badge, and a happy birthday badge. AND following which, wow!!! .we got the upgrade, almost in an instant...and that too, with a very very warm smile. The location of the room, was fabulous_ with the corner of the balcony, facing the board walkway on one side, and the riverway on the other. This, no doubt a most generous gesture by the hotel management, pumped up our adrenalin, and i was sure my family would have a time of life, this vacation. starting with the location of the hotel, i would say, this is in the most lively neighborhood in disney world. Everything so convenient!!! The hotel services _ the room services, the concierge, and almost all the departments, were efficient and warm. The one bedroom Villa, itself was so well equipped, with practically all the gadgets for washing laundry or cooking food, if required, for a longer stay. The dining plan was a convenient blessing in itself, which was already on the special offer, for our trip timings. The fastpass is also a most required thing, which comes in free, with the disney guests. I was not sure of the free wifi in the rooms, as i had tried to look up the possibility, before our arrival, but there again !!! complimentary wifi was on the house, for our entire stay. nearly everything was perfect...I suppose a very rare piece of luck for sure, And the memories, surely unforgettable, will stay for a long long time to come. AND before we realized, the end of our stay was near. Indeed, we were a little heart broken that everything good has to end sometime. Infact the standard of hospitality and the guest relationship was so high, that i am sure, it would be difficult for us, to find the same level of disney hospitality, ever again in any non disney vacations in the future. My son, looks forward to a similar vacation at disney world, once again, and i don't blame him. AND probably, with luck, we might repeat the same experience, on our next trip, and will surely be with the same hotel, for sure. The Javeri family. [---]

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Value for the money in question.”
Reviews.Author: trvlbear
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Boardwalk Villas many times and its a fairly consistant place to stay. You can't beat the location for an Epcot visit, being just a short walk from the back entrance of World Showcase. There also plenty of activities for kids and a few for adults. The eateries on the boardwalk range from burgers and pizza to somewhat upscale with The Flying Fish and The Cuzina. We've never stayed in the hotel section since we're DVC members, but since the late 90's, when we became members, any special recognition for buying into DVC has become non-existent. Any little perks that were offered in the early years of our membership have went the the way of the Doe Doe bird. Funny that none of the monthly fees or my tax bill for ownership has gone down, but has increased and more than doubled! How regular families afford a Disney vacation is beyond comprehension!

Reviews.Title: “Disney trip to celebrate my birthday”
Reviews.Author: julierik
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we have stayed at Disney's Boardwalk in the villas. It's by far the best choice for families with kids. You can walk to Epcot and Hollywood studios or take a short boat ride. You can elminate the bus to Magic Kingdom too by going through Epcot and taking the monorail. This is really important when you have kids in strollers. The hotel is gorgeous, so much to do at night right on the property and the atmosphere is great from the minute you walk in. The villas are perfect with a kitchen and washer and dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully themed, Disney quality”
Reviews.Author: dohligee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1BR with a pool view - it was like looking out over an amusement park. The slide looks like a roller coaster, and the pool bar area looks like a carousel. Very cool! The public areas, including the boardwalk itself, fit perfectly with the turn-of-the-century Atlantic City theme. It is so much fun to walk the Boardwalk area, especially in the evening, and see the street side magician, hear the latest sports event from the ESPN club, take in the carnival boardwalk atmosphere. Our room also fit in perfectly with the seaside theme, and was much more spacious than I expected. We had plenty of room for our things, with storage space left over. The balcony is a little small, but for just 2 of us was the perfect size to sit and relax. The best part of staying at this resort is being able to walk so easily to Epcot and Studios. It sure beats waiting for a bus. The bus system, if you go to Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom, is not the most efficient, as it stops at several other resorts, but it's not horrendous. I've stayed at most of the moderate & up Disney properties, and Boardwalk is definitely one of my favorites. We'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Vacation @ Walt Disney World Florida”
Reviews.Author: sueqz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay in a studio room @ Boardwalk villas. The room size was great for 2 people but could accomodate 2 more on a sleep sofa. We had a small kitchenette, microwave & mini fridge & toaster so that was very convenient. We were able to have breakfast in our room most days. We love the location of this resort as we can walk to Epcot & Hollywood Studios. We had a boardwalk view which allowed us to see the fireworks from Illuminations @ Epcot right from our balcony ! We did have to change rooms early in our stay though because there was a vibration in our walls we think from the exhaust fan from the restaurant below. There was no issue with changing rooms & the next one was very quiet. Try to avoid room #5031 because of the vibration. Otherwise this resort was lovely !

Reviews.Title: “Premium location, almost premium rooms”
Reviews.Author: Roberto M
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located walking distance from Epcot and MGM, and if you get a good deal is totally worth it. We saw Illuminations 4 times and my daugher loved each one of them. Expending the late afternoon at the boardwalk is simply fun. Some of the common complaints are true: Only one elevator shaft, that can be very far away, parking is really far away, and while accomodations are not 5 star, the charge for valet parking is. The room itself is spacious, and for the 1 bedrooms/2bedrooms are like a larger residence inn. The studio is a regular hotel room. I had several service problems, housekepping is designed for DVC members, meaning is almost non-existant: - Kitchen did not have all the pans and equipments listed on the cupboard (only one pan) missing basic things - The maid could come almost anytime during the day, and since I had to take my daugher to sleep in the middle of the day, that would mean trouble sometimes - The sleepware was just OK, 3 star hotel stuff - In the last day I had a problem with a disney merchandise and the hotel did not manage to solve it properly, took me 40 minutes to get to no-where To be plain, If I was paying full fare, I would leave that hotel second day, not worth the US$ 400 tag + a lot of hidden taxes.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Location for Staying in Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm S
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights in a one bedroom villa at the BoardWalk Villas in late October. It is perfectly located within Disney World and access to Epcot and the various parks is easy via bus or boat. Our villa (5094) overlooked the pool and was at the western end of the main building. It was a fair way from the elevators but it was an easy walk. The villa itself was perfect; we had our own bedroom with a king-size bed whilst our 3 year old daughter slept on the sofa bed. The villa was fully equiped with dishwasher, washer/dryer combo, twos TVs, DVD player, spa bath,etc. Everything worked and was well maintained. The staff were all very friendly. We were there for Halloween and there were a wide range of activities put on for children around the BoardWalk. The normal nightly entertainment of magicians, etc was also very good. The only minor complaint that we would have is that the general store on the BoardWalk doesn't have much in the way of decent foodstuffs to choose from. Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “disney at its best”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: great location, and disney... enough said. i would go here every year if i could.

Reviews.Title: “Better the second time around!”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelbug05
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio room in December and I was a little disappointed, but was willing to give it another try. This time we stayed in a one bedroom villa with a boardwalk view and it was great! The room is very spacious and the view over the boardwalk was great. The bathroom is large (divided into two rooms, each with a sink, which is nice when getting ready.) The one bedroom comes equipped with a refrigerator, stove and stackable washer and dryer. I was more impressed with staff this visit as well. Easy walk to Epcot with entrance into the back side of the world showcase; therefore lines to get into the gate are shorter than at park's main entrance. Hollywood studios is easily walkable as well, but further than Epcot. Boat service is also right at the back door of Boardwalk and will take you to either park. Numerous dining options along the boardwalk and the various hotels nearby, not to mention all of the eateries in Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Other parks are accessible by bus service located in front of Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Disney”
Reviews.Author: sass1020
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk is my favorite place to stay in Disney, due to the location. You can't beat the quick walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We had a Boardwalk view, and it was fun sitting out on the balcony and watching people play the Boardwalk games one night. The rooms are nice, the beds are comfortable, and the staff was very friendly. The pool area is nice, and the slide is fun. All in all, it's a great hotel with a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Enjoy Epcot”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Epcot Food and Wine festival, and had an absolutely wonderful time. We stayed at the Boardwalk Villas inm room 2008. While this room is one of the furthest rooms from the lobby, it had a view of the canal and was close to an exit door that put us on the walkway to Disney Studios. It is also close to the pool. The room was clean and quiet with a small fridge, microwave, toaster and coffemaker (full size). The hotel is perfectly situated for walking to Epcot or Disney Studios and we were able to walk to the parks more quickly than the boats would get us there. One night we watched Fantasmic at Disney Studios, and walked to Epcot in time to see Illuminations. There are sufficient dining options at the Boardwalk, but you are also within a few minutes walk of the Swan, Dolphin and the Yacht and beach clubs. I perfect place to travel with family or friends

Reviews.Title: “Greatest location!”
Reviews.Author: college11
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for easy access to Epcot and Hollywood Studios ( walk into both). We stayed here because our trip was centered around The Epcot Food and Wine Festival. It was perfect. The only complaint is that the hotel is very spread out, and our studio villa was on the farthest end of the hotel, so it was a pretty long walk just to get from our room to the Boardwalk area and lobby. Plus, no restaurants or places to get coffee right in the hotel itself, other than the in room coffee pot. Other than that, spotless, roomy and always above and beyond in service. And by the way- food and wine festival was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location...excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lala31864
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be close to Epcot due to the Food and Wine Festival....we made a great choice! The ease of walking to Epcot maybe about 5-10 minutes or Hollywood Studios a little bit longer, plenty of restaurants and things to do makes this a wonderful choice for any type of trip planned. We stayed in a preferred view studio for 5 nights, which was enough room for us for a short trip. The room was very clean & nicely decorated. This place is beautiful!!! The lobby is gorgeous, love the furniture! The hallways are a bit long, not a big deal for us. Staff was fantastic and we never waited more than 10 min tops for bus service to the Magic Kingdom. Maybe we were lucky. The pool is really cute, daughter loved it! I liked that they had enough tables with umbrellas and lounge chairs to relax on after a day at the parks. The pool area is a nice size, you could have full sun or be in a shaded area. I can't say enough great things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Food & Wine Festival”
Reviews.Author: laenie
Reviews.Content: Walt Disney's Boardwalk Villas 2 Adults, Deluxe Studio with pool view As we were attending the Food and Wine events, we elected to stay within walking distance to Epcot, so the Boardwalk Villas were a convient location for us. As we spent almost our entire 5 days in Epcot, it was a short walk for us and easy entry into the back of the park, small ticket booth, bag check and a few ticket machines make a quick and easy entrance. Our room was on the 2nd floor (close off the main lobby and very convenient to both the Boardwalk (a quick stairway down) or the front lobby where you can catch a bus to other parks. If the short walk to Epcot is too much for your tired feet, there is also a boat that makes the stop at the Boardwalk. Also at the same pier is another boat that will head past the Swan and Dolphin and drop you off at Hollywood Studios. There is also a winding path that will take you there on foot, but after spending your days walking the parks, it is nice to sit on the boat! The room itself is quite spacious, a small kitchen area with cube fridge, microwave, sink and coffee maker, disposable dishes/silverware and real coffee cups, also all the fixins for your morning java are included. A comfy queen bed with fluffly comforter and an assortment of pillows, day bed and sofa bed. A small table with two chairs, flat screen tv atop a large dresser, and a decent sized closet, double sink and separate tub/shower with commode. But our favorite was the private balcony overlooking the pool with it's round open window. Two semi-comfy chairs and small table let us sit outside each morning and enjoy our coffee. The maid service was daily but minimal, but enough for us as the towels were changed, the bed made and our soap/shampoo stock replenished. Our room overlooked the spacious pool and bar area where we could watch the games that went on and quiet music piped from the bar. Very enjoyable stay and worth the money to be close to all the action!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Food and Wine”
Reviews.Author: droraback
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk Villas are great. The location is especially wonderful if you are planning a number of days for the Food and Wine Festival at Epcot. If you want to avoid the extra expense of a rental car, Boardwalk is the place to stay with easy access to the parks. After staying at number of DVC locations on property, the Boardwalk has everything.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: dav4844
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the villas, room 1112, for 5 days at the end of September. My daughter, s-i-l and grandchildren stayed in a one bedroom suite, room 1116, which was much larger and had walk-in closets, whirlpool tub and a kitchen.We were situated on the ground floor across from the quiet pool a short distance from the larger pool and the Libation bar. Our room was very nice for the two of us with a queen size bed and sofa and a small kitchen area and refrigerator. It was very clean and I liked the access to the grounds being on the lower level. The one drawback for some people might be the distance to the elevator but the quietness made the room perfect for us. We used the on-line check in service and once at the hotel the whole process of getting our room, cards and information package took about 5 minutes. I felt the entire trip to WDW, service, attitude of the Disney cast members at the Boardwalk, location and rooms were exceptional and would recommend staying here. The other benefit for us was Epcot and Hollwood Studios were within a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyadic
Reviews.Content: Many stays here and am never disappointed! Favorite DVC resort, walk to epcot, hollywood studios, or just hang out on the boardwalk!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and magical”
Reviews.Author: NicolaC66
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members whose home resort is the Saratoga Springs, but we like to try out the other resorts, so we thought we'd give the Boardwalk a try. Talk about making the right decision. Don't take too much notice of the less than positive comments about how far you have to walk from the lifts etc.... Trust me, as someone who happily pays a lot of money to even get to Florida from the UK and for luxury hotels, this is one of the best places i have stayed. The staff were extremely helpful and polite at all times. The rooms were large and spacious enough for 2 adults and 2 teenagers without falling over each other, with large enough kitchenette area and fridge, even though we only had a studio on this occassion. The whole resort is beautifully presented and decorated and you really feel as if you have stepped back into the 1930's era as the atmosphere is so real. One of the highlights for me was each morning waking up to have the view of the Epcot ball and to sit on our balcony with a cup of tea and listen to the old style music being softly played around the boardwalk. Wonderful. The pool was also brilliant, particularly for young children. As ours are now teenagers we preferred to use the 2 quieter pools which were large and more peaceful. The boat service to Epcot and Studios was regular and never too crowded. However, Epcot is within 5 mins walking and this involves a lovely stroll around the lake. The only negative that i could say is that i don't think there are enough laundry facilities and people being people can be very inconsiderate when using these, i.e as soon as you turn your back, chucking your clothes out of machines and putting theirs in!! This practice caused a few heated words in the laundry room. This isn't an issue for people staying in the 1 bedroom apartments as they have their own washer/dryer and i wouldn't allow it to stop me from returning. We are already looking forward to our next visit and i would return to the Boardwalk without hesitation. Well done Disney. :)

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Mich5675
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-night stay. In the past weâ€™ve always stayed at Port Orleans French Quarter. Due to a 40% off special and the 2-room suites, we chose the Boardwalk Villas for this visit. This is a FANTASTIC hotel! We used the online check-in service at home. Once we got to the hotel, it took us literally one minute to have our welcome packet in hand. Our room was ready when we arrived around noon, which was nice after having an early morning flight so we could freshen up before hitting the parks. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, clean, bright, and spacious. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. Our one bedroom villa was spotless (#5091). The design of the pull-out sofa bed was really cool (and comfortable, according to our 9 year old son). Our king-size bed was surprisingly comfortable. Of course, we checked all the bedding and furniture for bedbugs (there were none). We did not make any special room requests in advance and had booked a standard room, but we received a room on the 5th (top) floor with a view of the quiet pool, river, and Hollywood Studios! We were thrilled! The room was very quiet. My son and I swam in the Luna Park pool one afternoon and spent time in the Community Hall, too. They have a ping pong table there, as well as foosball, a television, tons of board games, a free Ms. PacMan/Galaga game and movies you can rent (there are DVD players in the rooms). If you have some leisure time, I suggest you check out Community Hall and the other activities at the resort (pool games, crafts, nightly campfires, and movies by the pool). The washer/dryer in the room came in quite handy. We only used the whirlpool tub once. Being on the Boardwalk was awesome. There is plenty to do. You can walk to both Epcot and Hollywood Studios, but we always took the boats to save our feet. We did not experience long waits or any problems with bus service or boat service, either going to the parks or returning to the hotel. We canâ€™t wait to return to Disney and the Boardwalk Villas!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: mhpnp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have DVC members since the 90s and the Boardwalk is our "home". We have vacationed here since our three children were small and now we visit as a couple for long weekends and my daughter and I visit for a week or more each year. We have stayed at the Beach Club Villas, Boardway Inn (club level),Contemporary Hotel, Coronado Springs(for a conference), Grand Floridian, Saratoga Springs Villas, Wilderness Lodge(club level), and the Yacht Club as well as many times at the Boardwalk Villas, We all love the location of the Boardway - transporation is usually not a problem to the parks - sometimes difficult to get from hotel to hotel; we enjoy walking to Epcot (usually we skip) and walking back from Hollywood Studios along the waterway. My advice is to relaaaaax - take time to enjoy all the tiny nuances that make this experience so special! We will be returning next May and visiting the Contemporary (with magic kingdom view), Yacht Club (with epcot view), and then on to the Boardway - coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask for Better!!!”
Reviews.Author: DVCMembers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Disney's Boardwalk Villas and can't wait to go back! Online Check-in was quick and easy (we were met at the front entrance and taken directly to the Conceirge). We felt like royalty staying there. The transportation was wonderful, whether taking a boat or catching the bus to Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom, no more than a 5 minute wait!! The grounds are lovely and exciting. The Luna Swimming pool is amazing and the quiet pool is out of sight and extremely quiet and beautiful, The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. This was our first trip to Disney without our kids (20th anniversary), and I couldn't think of a nicer way to spend it! We had a studio, just the two of us, which suited us wonderfully. It was clean and comfortable. And the A/C worked fabulously, as it was very hot during our stay. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone if you are lucky enough to have the chance to stay here. I rate it 10 out of 10. PS.....walking to Epcot, how cool is that???

Reviews.Title: “My Wife's Favorite (WAY More Important Status Than Being My Favorite)”
Reviews.Author: Smoore1883
Reviews.Content: Boardwalk is just a wonderful hotel. The access to Epcot is great (maybe a 500 yard walk??) and the close proximity to Hollywood studios is also a plus. The pool is very nice and the theming of the resort is very good as well. Disney resorts have me spoiled and I have a difficult time staying anywhere else on vacation now (thanks). There is nothing I can say bad about this resort and I recommend it very highly! We will be back in April 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, rooms a little bland.”
Reviews.Author: Torsie24
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights of our Honeymoon at the Boardwalk Villas. Before arrival I'd requested a "village green" view, and upon check in the wonderful Cast Member on reception had made my day in announcing that's what we'd gotten. When we got to our room however I was a little dissappointed that we were on a low floor, so unfortunately our view wasn't the EPCOT view I was hoping for. In retrospect I should have gone back to reception and asked if perhaps we could have waited a while to see if another room would become available. So really it's not Disney's fault at my disappointment. We'd just checked out of a Castle View Club Level room at the Grand Floridian, so the decor of the room left something to be desired, but to be honest any room would have paled in comparison (and so it should as my 3 nights at the Floridian - including 1 free night - cost more than my 11 nights at the BW). The room was a good size, and the kitchen and bathroom areas were the best appointed of the 3 DVC resorts we have stayed in (the others being Animal Kingdon, Jambo House and Bay Lake Tower) The ability to walk to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios was really great, and we enjoyed our time spent at the quiet pool. We'd love to stay in the same area again, but would probably pay the extra to stay at the Boardwalk Inn or the Beach Club as opposed to staying in the Boardwalk Villas, we just like that extra bit of luxury in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Gets better everytime we stay”
Reviews.Author: maureendavies55
Reviews.Content: i,ve been a member of the disney vacation club since 1993 and i have stayed in the Boardwalkvillas many times.I have just returned from a 14 night stay in a 2 bedroom villa and again had a wonderful holiday ,the accomadation is outstanding and the location is fabulous.My husband and i took friends with us who had never visited america and they fell in love with the Boardwalk the location is excellant for first time visitors .The disney staff are so welcoming and helpfull you really do feel you are at home at this property .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but out-dated”
Reviews.Author: ASD_specialist
Reviews.Content: The location was very convenient to the parks. The pools, hot tubs, and water slide were all nice. Like any other Disney resort, the staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that our room seemed very outdated. The furniture was very worn down and the couch had a rip in it. We had a studio and 1 bedroom suite. We were later informed that this resort is due for renovations soon. However, at the moment, the furnishings do not seem "Disney Quality".

Reviews.Title: “Love Disney”
Reviews.Author: bblack3
Reviews.Content: We go to Disney every year and I have to say this is the first year I felt the Boardwalk looked a little worn. I did see signs that mention some remodeling, so maybe that's part of it. LOVE the location. Can walk to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios, or take the boats. Catch the Monorail in EPCOT to ride over to the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “"The greatest spot to stay at Disney"”
Reviews.Author: apieron
Reviews.Content: Just returned and can't say enough positive things....had a three year old and a four month old and Disney makes it so easy....definitely worth the villas since we needed a kitchen sink for the little one....also, loved walking into the park...really feels like home...

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JIMKChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: A disappointment on our latest trip to DISNEY. We reserved a one bedroom Villa and asked that it be close to my brother and his family. One member of our party arrived with my brother and asked to check in. One Villa was ready, the other would be ready at 4 PM as promised. We were told it was "next to the other one". At 4 PM we were told there was an engineering problem with the room, and directed to another room, on another floor, in another section of the hotel. Upon arriving we were mortified to find another family already in the room, the bellman apologized and we all backed out. The front desk then told us in rapid succession: Our original room was given away earlier to another family prior to 4 PM; Disney Boardwalk's policy is to double book rooms; Disney cannot promise to fulfill any requests made in the online reservation; there was still an engineering problem with the room. After some prodding the cast members stuck with the engineering story. When we suggested that we all take a walk to the room, knock on the door and see who answered - engineering staff or other visitors, a flurry of activity took place, and we received a promise of a room at 5. 5:15 arrived and a manager presented us with a key to a room in an area near our family's other room, an apology, and a partial refund to our payment for having missed a day at Disney while sorting this out. Up and out the next day, we got back to our room late to find it had not been made up. A call to housekeeping and a trip to the front desk to visit with managers resulted in the explanation that the cleaning staff had "just not been told to make up the room". We were given a fast pass to a ride of our choice at the Magic Kingdom the next day. An offer was made to make up the room right then, but the children were already asleep in the unmade beds so we took a pass. Disney offers lots of better options than Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: NurseW2Kiddies
