Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay here and finally got my chance!! This was a Christmas trip. We love to visit this time of the year to see all the decorations!! We rented DVC points from a member and booked a studio room. This includes a queen size bed, a double pull out couch and a fridge and microwave. Also had a small balcony. We were lucky enough to get a room that overlooked the pool and we LOVED it. My kids are teens and both good swimmers so I was fine letting them go down to swim themselves. They must have gone down the slide 100 times!! They also took advantage of the Community hall. I had to drag them out. The staff was very good with the kids. They had activities out by the pool that staff ran...did a great job! The only complaint that I had was that I though the room was a bit small. There were 2 adults and 2 kids/teens (12 and 15) and me (mom) and my mom (grandma). Had a great time at the resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “We have loved accomodations at this property in the past, but not at all this year.”
Reviews.Author: Marianne B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on Sunday, June 19th and were assigned a room furthest from the elevators, the "last room on the left" overlooking the canal on the far South side. My husband had recently had his knee totally replaced and I have severe COPD and asthma, as well as a knee replacement. We were told no other rooms were available and to come back the next day. We repeated this scenario the next 3 days. We are long-time members and we have never encountered the trouble we did on this trip. I called our Disney vacation guide, Kathy C. in IL , and she suggested we talk to the manager / supervisor of the Boardwalk front desk. We asked to speak to this person, but were never contacted by him/her. We finally gave up, but we are not happy DVC members right now. With all of the offers being given to potential vacationers for accomodations at 40% off and free dining,etc. it seems to us, as well as 3 other DVC members we traveled with on this trip, that DVC members pay our fees for less benefits every year. I sincerely hope my comments are passed on to the DVC member satisfaction team.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jjingles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the DVC Boardwalk villas during Thanksgiving of 2010. It was very nice. We try to stay at a different resort each time we come to Disney although Saratoga Springs is our home base. It is conveniently located next to Epcot and a short ride by boat to Disney Studios. There are plenty of places to eat and lots of stores and gift shops on the Boardwalk. We had a two-bedroom villa for 7 people and there was plenty of room. The staff was very nice. The only thing that was annoying was checking in. I had done the "pre check-in online" but that was useless. We arrived at 10:30 pm and were very tired and it took us 45 minutes to check in as there was only one person in the lobby at that time. By the time we got into a room and got our luggage from the Magical Express it was midnight. I had also done a grocery list months before and had expected to have that in the room when I got there (I told them we would be arriving late). When we checked in at the front desk, they said the store was closed and we would have to wait until morning. I had a copy of my grocery list and gave it to the front desk to have delivered the next morning but then when we got to the room the food was already delivered. So, it all worked out...just confusion among the staff. It is a great place to stay and I would love to go back! The bus service was not very good as we waited twice for over an hour. I realize this was a holiday, but when you have reservations to eat at a restaurant or resort, they don't hold your table for longer than 10 minutes past the reservation time. The problem was a bus broke down, and they did not replace it...we had to wait for the next scheduled time. All in all, it is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: NJFam123
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the villas. A short walk to Epcot and so much to do right outside the hotel. The DVC room was roomy. The Hotel services were on the ball from housekeeping to valet parking attendants. The shower had a mildew problem which was reported but a surprise for Disney's high standards. Family consisted of tweens and seniors and all enjoyed the stay at the Boardwalk Villas, would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: 27Kathy
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk is an excellent location for Disney visitors. It is located in the heart of Walt Disney World. You don`t need a car if you are planning to stay on property. You can walk or take a boat to Epcot and the Studios. If you want to visit The Magic Kingdom you can either walk through Epcot and get the monorail or get a bus. There are also buses to Animal Kingdom, Typhoon lagoon and Blizzard Beach. There are plenty of places to eat on the Boardwalk. also other hotels are within walking distance so you can go there to eat---Yacht and Beach club, Swan and Dolphin. There are hotel pools and tennis courts.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Epcot”
Reviews.Author: ttrinter
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this resort. You can walk to either EPCOT through the International Gateway or to Hollywood Studios via a walkway along the canal. It's a lovely resort and our family always enjoys it when we are lucky enough to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonder service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jatwell
Reviews.Content: We were attended to the minute we got out of our rental car. Welcome Home they all greeted us with. We were taken aback by it. Most timeshares lack friendly service like that. The rental had a one bedroom with full kitchen and a studio next to it that our boys used. They felt like they had their own place, but we had a door adjoining the two places. I loved the pool slide. It was just right for me. We could walk to Epcot, walk a little longer for Disney Studios, or take a Disney boat to either of them. The boats left frequently. WE could catch a Disney bus for the other parks.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite resorts period!”
Reviews.Author: captainhook1974
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Boardwalk Villas many times over the years. We usually rent the points from a Disney Vacation Club owner. We LOVE LOVE LOVE the location of the Boardwalk resort. You can take the boat to Epcot or Disney Studios (MGM). The buses to Animal Kingdom, Downtown and Magic Kingdom aren't too bad a wait. If you get a preferred view, you can see Illuminations at Epcot really well from your balcony. Great resort. A lot of money if you don't rent points though. Great job Disney!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great but...”
Reviews.Author: ILoveMickey654
Reviews.Content: The Villas are beautiful and fabulous! They feel like you are home with style, the kitchen was great for a quick an easy breakfast. We went with family but they stayed in a different room but Disney was so nice to put our rooms a hallway away. We got there and it started to rain but we know Disney canâ€™t control but I took my 6-year-old cousin to the boardwalk for fun and games but everything was closed and this went on all week since it broke the record for rain in the month of May! â˜¹ The walk to the room was nice and long, too! But worst of all were the buses! When we got on the buses with my family we were pushed up to the front with nothing to hold onto. The buses should only pick up from the Boardwalk and the Beach and Yacht Clubs, without the Swan and Dolphin. And after a long wet day in the parks we had to wait for about 20 minutes just for a bus, not a great way to end the day! We once got a taxi to get back to the Boardwalk well we took a bus to Coranado Spring's Resort and had to find our way through to get to the loby from the buses so we could take a taxi back and now we donâ€™t stay at the Epcot resorts because of the buses! But the service was amazing and very accommodating towards children. Very nice but just change your buses please!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, long hall ways...”
Reviews.Author: 1967foodie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom villa at the Boardwalk Villas for two nights. We stayed at Bay. The room was very spacious with a large kitchen, sitting area with sofa, separate master bedroom with a king size bed, incredibly large bathroom with separate shower and toilet area, and a master dressing area with jetted tub and walk-in closet. Everything was clean, fresh and in working order when we checked in. There were two balconies overlooking the waterway between the Boardwalk and the Swan hotel. The dÃ©cor was very inviting and well thought out with nautical themes. Hallways were clean and un cluttered. Were the room was among the best weâ€™ve stayed at there are a few issues with the Boardwalk. 1. Distance to room â€“ over 260 steps from elevator to our roomâ€™s door. 2. Parking â€“ if you have a car and self park you are forced to walk about 15 -20 minutes from your room to your vehicle. It was a pain!! 3. Restaurants â€“ only food was from the Boardwalk restaurants, nothing in the hotel. This is a great hotel if youâ€™re using the Disney transportation system and enjoy Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Canâ€™t beat its location. Did not use the pool area - Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip! Love the Boardwalk Villas”
Reviews.Author: Jewel21Dance
Reviews.Content: We had a great family trip at the Boardwalk Villas. We exchanged thru RCI and were able to get a 2 bedroom lockout, meaning my parents stayed at the adjacent studio room while we stayed at the one bedroom apartment. The apartement was HUGE. I stayed at the Beach Club Villas last year and the living room, bathroom and bedroom at the Boardwalk was much bigger than the Beach Club. The bathroom is a bit outdated but we didnt mind because of the extra space. There were many positives and just a couple of negatives. First positive: Villa, huge and spacious, coffee and all the kitchen amenitites were provided. You cannot beat the proximitely to the Boardwalk, just such a great place to hang in the morning and the evenings, close to the restaurants, we love the Flying Fish and Koussina. There were always different street entertainers which makes the Boardwalk experience quite unique. The pool was also very nice with the Clown slide. The negatives: No housekeeping, so when we called for extra towels, shampoo and soap since we had 5 people in the rooms for 7 nights they said they would do so complementary but we would need to pay next time. Really not a big deal but at the Beach club we had housekeeping replenish towels, shampoo daily, take out trash and clean once a week. So we ended up having to wash our towels and washclothes which was a bit of a hassle. I just wished I had known ahead of time. Other than that, great time at the Boardwalk .And make sure to get a room with a view of the Fantasmic fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings on this DVC resort”
Reviews.Author: disneygoof1966
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of this resort was less than impressed. The floor in the kitchen area was not cleaned before our arrival, the the walk from the front desk and elevator to the rooms seems to take forever which is horrible when carrying luggage. There are stairs closer to the parking entrance, but no elevator which doesn't help when carrying luggage or a sleeping child - bell service may be able to help with the luggage but they aren't going to carry the kid... Housekeeping did come take care of the floor quickly and once we were settled the long halls were just a minor addition to long days of walking in the parks. The room was well appointed, one bedroom with a comfortable king bed and a sofa bed in the living room that was better than some our child has slept on at Disney. The thermostat in our room was NOT electronic, so we were able to keep the room cool consistently - I hate the electronic thermostats that shut off during the night when there is no movement in the room! Bordwalk is convientent to both Hollywood Studios and Epcot as well as the restaurants on Disney's Boardwalk. There are also a couple nice restaurants at the Swan&Dolphin hotels next door. There are a couple of mini-golf courses within walking distance as well. Nice workout area and wonderful pool with poolside bar.

Reviews.Title: “The great experience we expected from Disney”
Reviews.Author: dapfunk187
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a 1-bedroom villa with my sister and brother-in-law. The villa was spacious enough for us for the most part but we do wish they had 2 full bathrooms. Instead they have 1 outdated bathroom with a shower, toilet and sink and another one connecting which has a jacuzzi tub, sink and closet that connects to the bedroom. This made it a bit challenging getting ready in the morning for 4 people but we made it work. My hubby and I slept on the pull out couch which was probably one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The furniture and carpet in the villa were a bit beat up but we expected that considering it's one of the older Disney resorts in the area. The kitchen is equipped with a dishwasher, stove and full size fridge. We really loved that we could have food delivered from Garden Grocer's before we even arrived and they held it at the Bell's desk. I would definitely recommend using them if you plan to stay for a while and want to say some money. Although the kitchen was fully equipped it was definitely only big enough for 1 person at a time. Once again, expected for an older resort. The grounds were very nice though with 2 pools - one more suited for kids with the slide and then a more private, "adult-like" pool which was nice for us since we weren't traveling with kids. Of course the service was great - to be expected at any Disney resort! The location is perfect being right on the boardwalk and just a bus ride or ferry trip away from everywhere else. I would definitely recommend this for adults and kids alike - there are plenty of fun options for those traveling without kids right on the boardwalk. We spent our days on the boardwalk, downtown Disney, Epcot, and CityWalk - so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Always the perfect place to stay for Disney--our 5th stay!”
Reviews.Author: BrWo
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th stay and we aqre very picky 5-star hotel people--so that tells you something! Boardwalk is beautiful, perfectly maintained and not too "over-themed". Having stayed at Grand Floridian and Yacht Club Conceirge I can tell you that Boardwalk is better. The rooms at the properties and just that-rooms. Standard in size ajd small bathrooms, At Boardwalk a one-bedroom villa is like a small apartment. ANd what you wnat with a family is space--especially with a 13-year old son! We love having our own separate bedroom, and the bathroom with spa tub and separet shower is perfectly laid out for ultimate privacy. Toilet, shower and sink in one space with doors, and a separate space with sinks and the spa tub. The washer and dryer aren't top of the line but are so handy--means we bring far less clothing. And the kitchen is modern and fully-equipped--we had breakfast evry day and was great for snacks when we got back to the room. The updating of the suites has been very well done with the addition of new furniture and flat screen tvs. What is ideal is the location--easy bus to Magic Kingdom, boat to Hollywoood studios and walk or boat to EPCOT--where we ended every night with dinner and fireworks. And I have to admit that the boardwalk at night is truly magical.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: holidayqueenEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends in March 2011 with the disney vacation club. We had a board walk view room, nice size room comfy big bed. The Boardwalk villas are in easy walking distance to Epcot or you can take the free boats which also go to Hollywood studios. The weather was fantastic, hired a car so ate out for evening meals - cracker barrell- sweet tomatoes, were my favourites.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outdated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Haynezey
Reviews.Content: A family member of mine owns a disney vacation club. We planned a family reunion when my cousin came back from Iraq and my DVC owing family member got us all rooms at Boardwalk. I LOVED the location of the villas. A short walk to Epcot and so much to do right outside the hotel. The rooms were big and the DVC rooms have great amenities however the Boardwalk is outdated. Things were broken in the room. It didn't ruin our stay it was just a surpise that Disney had let things go that much in a hotel like Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Within steps...”
Reviews.Author: Trekkenman
Reviews.Content: Staying at the boardwalk was on our list because the studios are some of the biggest for DVC. We stayed for two nights in June and were able to walk to Hollywood studios, which was faster than a boat ride. But parking was the worst of all the DVC properties. If you don't do valet, you will have to park quite far, which also means you'll probably need the bell hop for your luggage. Overall the resort was nice and we would stay again, especially if we don't have a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Always our favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mgilbert7
Reviews.Content: We visit Disney on an annual basis usually, and while we are not DVC members, we love to stay at the Boardwalk. The quick walk to Epcot and short boat ride (or nice longer walk) to Hollywood Studios is fantastic. The hotel is beautiful and we have never had a negative experience at the pool, check in, or our room. Our favorite restaurant, Flying Fish, is located right on the boardwalk outside the hotel. We will always continue to stay (and hopefully buy into) Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location...Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mattsaab
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat for those fond of Epcot or Hollywood Studios -- you can literally walk to both of the adjacent parks. The exterior architecture and theming is fantastic too! The rooms do not however match the exterior in detail, furniture or theming. A recent remodel looks like the looser of Design Star was put in charge--nothing goes together and the light fixtures are especially ugly and cheap. To make matters worse, the shower room is practically dark and the loud fan should be reserved for a motel outside the gates. But, the location is great and the pools varied and many. Just don't be fooled by the 5 star exterior and 3.5 star rooms. An upgraded in materials, decor and lighting could change it all.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk is FUN and can WALK to the parks!”
Reviews.Author: weechi
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ boardwalk villas from 4/29-5/3 and I was very happy with the choice I made. Stayed with the boyfriend so it was just the two of us. I have stayed @ AKL and French Quarter in the past and I liked this resort the best bc of its LOCATION!!! You can walk to Epcot in <5min and outwalk the boat to HWS. We are New Yorkers so we donâ€™t have time to wait and Boardwalk hotel really is in the center of it all. We had a studio back water view of the dolphin and swan hotels and could hear the ferry boats little horn but it was a nice touch. It didnt interupt our sleep. I think we were the only ones staying in our wing of the villas bc it was dead quiet until the last night we were there when we could hear kids thru the connecting door. But this is expected its Disney. Thankfully that was the night before we were checking out. I understand why people complain about the walk from the one bank of elevators quite a walk after walking all day but worth it. The room was nice had everything we needed coffee makes, fridge, microwave, a couch, flatscreen TV. Our balcony was odd there was only one chair and the door took up so much space to open that you have to maneuver around it so we didnâ€™t relax out there. Nice to have that divide between the toilet and sink area. Im girlie takes awhile to get ready. Bed was comfy and couch was good. Ordered room service for bfast one morning bfast potatoes were delish and service wonderful. I see why people donâ€™t like that there isnâ€™t a quick service style cafeteria right in the lobby or same building but you are going outside to the park anyway. We didnâ€™t have a problem grabbing something quick to eat or just having coffee in the room and then run to the parks. I guess that sort of cafeteria setting would ruin the DELUXE aspect. Didnâ€™t have food in any of the boardwalk restaurants but highly recommend beaches and cream (Beach Club hotel about 10min walk)! Awesome French dip, chili, onion rings! ICE CREAMMMM Look for the hidden mickey in the onion rings hehe Known for their ice cream we saw a group get a kitchen sink looked like an ice cream lover kids dream The bus to magic kingdom and AK came right when we walked up to the bus stop or we waited less than 15min for one. At night even when leaving for extra magic hours there was ALWAYS a bus to our hotel. Stops sometimes at Swan and Dolphin but what does that take like +5min!? no complaints with disneys transit system they have their ish together The ferry boat when leaving the parks if you can catch them without a monster line I recommend. So nice and romantic to ride back and take in the scenery Had a drink in the Bellevue lounge one day before heading to park for fireworks take your drink out onto the deck! wish i was there right now Bought sweets in the Candy Shop on the boardwalk for family back home but the parks have more of a variety buy in there Went to jellyrolls one night and that was the place to be. Boozed until 2am that was there closing time. $5 for a beer pretty good for Disney prices. Stroll around the boardwalk they have fun entertainment at night we saw a funny magician Didnâ€™t use our pool it looked nice with the clown coaster but the one over @ Beach and Yacht club looks way better. They have a lazy river. Going to swim there next time. Take the MAGIC EXPRESS and do the luggage to room service wish every destination was that organized. Take advantage of these things. Idk why you would want to wait for your luggage! Use the EXTRA MAGIC HOURS helllooo thatâ€™s why you spend so much to stay on the Disney property. I think like 75% of these people have no clue about them. Disney is the best money you can spend on a vacay IMO every minute of it was magical lol Compared to others ive stayed at stay here for the location and scenery !!! Room very nice !!! Worth the $ Remember you are paying the extra $ for the ambiance and location. If you got the deal or $ for it DO IT Trying wilderness lodge next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyJsy79
Reviews.Content: I am a Disney Vacation Club Member and this was my first stay at the Boardwalk Villas. My studio had recently been refurbished and was in good condition with a flat screen tv and a balcony (as standard in all DVC properties). The resort has all the facilities you could want, including a nice pool area and a gym. I really like the Boardwalk resort area with shops, restaurants and the fun Jellyrolls club with dueling pianos. Belle Vue Lounge was a very pleasant place to have a drink. As with most Disney hotels the Boardwalk theme was very well done. The resort is in an excellent location, within walking distance to EPCOT, Disney MGM Studios (as long as it is not too hot) the Beach and Yacht Club and the Swan and Dolphin hotels. I would stay at the Boardwalk again and would only note the following negative points: 1) Cold pools; 2) Long walk to my studio; and 3) Very expensive to stay here if you are not a DVC member

Reviews.Title: “excellent location a must stay at Disney world”
Reviews.Author: av3206
Reviews.Content: First time staying here and I must say it was almost perfect. Did the online check in and had room keys in a a few minutes upon arrival. The magical express had our bags with in 2 hours. We also miss tagged 1 bag and the bell service tracked it down and retrieved it they were extremely nice. Could walk to epcot and Hollywood studios a really nice perk. Only downside walls a tad thin you could catch sounds here and there from your neighbors. Other then that room was spotless everything was in working order can't wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “We love the Boardwalk! Best place to stay with kids.”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsnob1997
Reviews.Content: This is the second trip back to Disneyworld with our kids and we love the Boardwalk. We stayed here last time too and loved it just as much. The hotel is awesome,the rooms are awesome. We had a 1 bedroom villa with a full kitchen. We rented a car for a day to get groceries. The rental car place is just a short walk next door to the Dolphin. It was perfect to pick up and drop off. I went with my husband, 7 year old daughter and 5 1/2 year old son . On the Boardwalk at night there was always nightly entertainment. There was a magician and a sword swallower. We just love it, it's nice having the boardwalk there because when we were bored at night we didn't have to go far for entertainment. We also love the location!! We can walk over to Epcot, walk over to or take the boat to Hollywood Studios and it's only a short 10 minute bus ride to Magic Kingdom. Everyone I talk to I always reccommend the Boardwalk, it's such a great place for me and my family. From location, service, cleanliness and entertainment it's exceeds my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but great”
Reviews.Author: harrain
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Boardwalk Villas....really nice pools ....service was great...close to everything....

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk Villas: First experience with DVC...renting points”
Reviews.Author: joeytdog125
Reviews.Content: Hello All. We have stayed at the Boardwalk VIllas two times in the past four years. Each time we stayed in a preferred view one bedroom villa. Each time we rented points from a DVC member, which is a very economical way to save money versus going through Disney Direct. Anyways, I wont go into FULL details, but I will say this hotel is where we first fell in love with Disney. IT is an unbelivable value to have a kitchen and that much space for the kids plus a washer dryer. Usually people travel to Disney for more than just a few nights, so these extra convienences are really worth it JIMO. The one drawback to the room itself is that it can sometimes be a long walk from the room to the elevator. This is a notorious drawback to this particular hotel. The location - however - cannot be beat. You are a short walk to Epcot and a boat ride to Hollywood Studios. The buses take you everywhere else. However, a drawback is they share the buses and boats with other hotels so it is more than a 5 minute ride (probably 20-30 total). There are plenty of restuarants on the boardwalk - both Disney- Flyisng FIsh, Cape May, Spoodles (which has been recently replaced) and non disney - ESPN, etc The best part of the hotel is the boardwalk area itself, which has nightly free entertainment. There are performers, magicians, jugglers pianos, surrey bikes, all of which engage children and adults alike. There are also carnival games, snacks, etc for a price If you are looking for a great stay at the happiest place on earth, I highly reccomend a one bedroom or bigger room at the Boardwalk villas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: tescoqueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights after our Disney cruise in Jan 2011. Lovely hotel, feels very relaxed after the frentic parks. Lovely boardwalk area is great for strolling and eating an ice cream or a treat from the bakery there. The only reason Ive mrked it down to 4 not 5 is the wait at check in and at concierge, which was 20 minutes. The furniture and beds very good quality, the rooms spacious (we had a one bedroom apt), the whole ambience very good. The pool area is lovely too, nice big confy sunbeds and chairs. Comfort, elegance, relaxed, everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation spot in Disney”
Reviews.Author: endicottnewyork
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Orlando for the past 16 years and find a different place each year for a new experience. I prefer spend a bit more for the comforts of a quality stay. We were able to purchase Disney Vacation timeshare points for a beautiful 2 bedroom lockout unit at the boardwalk villas. It was the best vacation ever! The room was beautiful, overlooking the pool. We received all the perks of a club member without having to pay for it! The average cost is 2995.00 for a week. This was a splurge but worth every penny. It was beautiful. The grounds, stores and the magic of Disney. I can't wait to go Back!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MaxEntrophy
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at Boardwalk and it's nice to see that the folks at Disney are starting to up grade the rooms since they were starting to become a pretty run down. The rooms and beds are fine but the best feature of the Boardwalk is its location; it's about a 10 minute walk to Epcot and a 15 minute boat ride to Disney Studios. Moreover, there are nice restaurants within walking distance: Flying Fish, Blue Zoo, Il Mulino (although the California Grill remains our favorite). After dinner, we typically walk along the Boardwalk to watch the buskers and then wander over to Epcot to watch the fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “worst disney hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: BUSTER71195
Reviews.Content: We travel to Disney once per year and usually stay on Disney property. We finally splurged to stay at one of the nicer hotels and that turned out to be waste. WHEN WE ARRIVED, THE FLOOR WAS FILTHY!!!! Our microwave did not work (and it took someone days to get us a replacement), house-keeping was non-existent, the pool slide was out-of-commission (without notice), and my husband was hit in the eye with metal while walking past the pool - yes workers were shaving metal at 10am steps from where we were allowed to swim!!!!! When the bell hop took our luggage to be checked (on the day we were leaving) they lost a piece of luggage as well. When we pulled out the couch-bed for our children, we were unable to locate ANY extra pillows or blankets. While the view and location were great, the room is crammed and the walls are PAPER-THIN - we heard our neighbors all week long! I would have to say, however, the WORST part of our vacation was when my 6-year-old daughter got smacked in the head when the big METAL furnace/AC utility cover fell off the wall (screws were missing) - and when we called to have someone re-attach it, no one EVER showed up!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.....”
Reviews.Author: JaneMonee_IL
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my first trip to Disney World. The Boardwalk Hotel is the perfect place to stay. Beautiful place and our one bedroom villa was spacious and clean and beautifully decorated, comfy furniture and bed. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat, you can walk to Hollywood Studios and Epcot. The boardwalk runs along the water and there is a boat to take you to Hollywood Studios also. Restaurants, pizza, bakery, sweet shop and a couple bars are on the boardwalk. Festive fun place at night. Food at the Big River Grill was very good. Georgous grounds, tons of flowers. Since we had a full size refrigeratior I pre-ordered from the Garden Grocer and my food was delivered and waiting when I got there and bell service brought it to our room. They will keep the food cold or frozen if needed. Only downer, you have to pay $10 a day for internet. When we go again, I will stay here for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: agador
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in must of the DVC resorts. This one is no Beach Club, but the room we had was great, rm 4123. It had a balcony round one end of the building, we could sit and watch the Studios and Epcot fireworks from the balcony each night. It did seem like a long walk from the lobby, but with a stair case opposite the room, we could walk right down to the pool/car park and the walk way to the Studios, which was about a 10 minute walk. Al the shops are right under the hotel on the Board walk itself. The room was very clean, all the staff where helpful. Boat from the hotel to Epcot or Studios. The only issue was that the bus from Downtown went via 5 hotel to get back to the Board Walk, it took over 1.5 hours to do the trip. All in all a very good location, would stay again

Reviews.Title: “So much fun! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: disney27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BoardWalk Villas last week with my boyfriend. This hotel made the trip my best DIsney vacation yet. Check in and check out were extremely smooth, and the Disney's Magical Express service, which takes care of your luggage and transport to and from the airport, is phenomenal. We stayed in a studio villa. Our room was immaculate, the bed was comfortable, and we had a bit more space to spread out than you would get in a regular hotel room. There was a mini-kitchen with a sink, refrigerator, microwave, and toaster, and the hotel provided plates, cups, etc. We didn't use it much, but I can see how it would be a great money saver if you want to pick up some cereal or cold cuts for sandwiches and eat in the room instead of at the parks. Since the BoardWalk is walking distance from 2 Disney parks (about 10 minutes from Hollywood Studios and literally next door to Epcot), it's totally possible to eat in your room. Hollywood Studios and Epcot are also accessible by boat, and you can take the bus to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom. I've heard a few bad reviews of the bus system, but we really didn't have a problem with it. One of my favorite things about this hotel is that there's tons of stuff to do even if you're not in the parks. The boardwalk itself has a few restaurants (including Cat Cora's Kouzzina- which was fabulous), a candy shop that serves ice cream, a bakery (delicious sandwiches and pastries), an arcade, and a few stores, one of which sold grocery items. There were a bunch of performers throughout the day, such as clowns, magicians, etc., and the Beach Club resort (less than 5 minutes away across the lake) had outdoor movie screenings every night. The pool also has a water slide which looked like fun. All of these things are great if you want some rest from walking around the parks but still want your kids to have something to do. I would most definitely stay here again, as the room itself was great, there's tons to do, and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation Club amenities - Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: baddogsboy
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk Villas are just wonderful. We arrived on the 18th and left on the 27th of January. The service was impeccable, except for when we arrived. We had a cast member that was obviously not happy to do his job. But the rest of the stay was just amazing. We had an awesome view of the pool. I rented a 2 bedroom villa so my partner and my parents were there with me. It had all the amenities of a home. So we rented a car, went to Whole Foods and bought everything we needed for breakfast and for munchies. It was really nice to be together in the morning and make our breakfast, just the way we like it. It made the connections with the family just that extra special! We found everything really clean, and the mousekeeping forgot to replenish on the dishwashing detergent for the dishwasher one day. I called and within 8 minutes they were there! As you may know, you can walk to EPCOT (5 minutes) or to Hollywood Studios (15 minutes), or you can take the friendship boat. When we took the boat from the Studios, we stopped at the Swan & Dolphin, it was much quicker to then walk than than to stay in the boat, as the boat also goes to the Beach & Yacht Club before the Boardwalk. All and all I would recommend this resort big time. The convenience of being right next to those parks, the beauty of the Boardwalk and the amenities makes it a winner in my heart. Just a small drawback: the corridors. They are endless! Be prepared after a big day of walking to walk another 4-5 minutes just to get to your room from the elevator. Also Internet lovers beware: while it is free internet for Disney Vacation Club, it is NOT for other guests (which costs 10 dollars a day).

Reviews.Title: “Great location at Disney World”
Reviews.Author: streetcar
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This resort is walking distance to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We had a one bedroom suite. It worked very well for the 3 of us. We were on top floor far from the elevator. That was the only downside. It was aboutt a block from the elevator to our suite. When we were tired and had blistered feet, it made us carefully consider extra excursions from the room. But the upside was that our room was quiet, and with the great mattress, we slept very well. Even the sleep sofa had a very good mattress. The suite has two sinks in bathrooms, but only one toilet. Whirlpool tub was wonderful. Shower was excellent. There are plenty of restaurants around this resort. We highly recommend Kouzzina. And if you have food allergies, Disney is extremely accommodating. They responded to our vegetarian and gluten free dietary needs.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Stay”
Reviews.Author: k0202
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in a one bedroom villa for three nights. Two adults and our two-year-old son. The rooms are starting to show their age. Floors, furniture, and bedding are looking worn. It was also hard to control the temperature in the room. Either very humid or very cold. The location can't be beat. Easy walk to both Hollywood Studios and Epcot Center. Lots of dining options on the Boardwalk. My biggest suggestion would be to upgrade the bedding to be on par with other hotels in this price range (down comforter, etc). Also when staying in a villa, the rooms are not cleaned daily which takes away some of the comforts of staying in a hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if the location appeals to you. If you want something more updated I would suggest other villa options, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs better service”
Reviews.Author: elawson
Reviews.Content: First of all, its a great location...your proximity to Epcot is awesome. Since Epcot is our favorite park, its perfect for us. We had a 1 bedroom villa for our family of 5 (boys ages 7, 5, 2). We had plenty of room and our kids loved the pool. Our room was always spotless when we came back and we did use the kitchen, etc. We ran the dishwasher ourselves but everything looked perfect when we came back. So no problems with housekeeping. Also, the gardeners, housekeepers and bell boy (well, bell man) were all helpful and efficient. We got lost once and they got us back quickly. We aren't Disney Club members so our room was on the top floor down 4 hallways. It was a hike! Especially at the end of a long day with 3 little children in Disney. (And I'm 8 months pregnant so that walk seemed endless!) The rooms aren't as garish as they appear on Disney's website either. The bad - we arrived at 8:30 at night and it took a half hour to check in. With 3 little kids, this was enough to tear your hair out. The man was a trainee but a half hour seemed outrageous. Also, we brought a car and the valet was rather snotty that we didn't want valet service. It's impossible to bring up your own luggage so you have to check in (already mentioned), then give the bellhop your card so they can bring up everything. Since we bought some groceries, I was afraid to leave the room until the luggage appeared to make sure things got into the fridge. I would recommend this hotel but be prepared for some delays!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very elegent!”
Reviews.Author: WeDVC2009
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at Boardwalk in a standard view but cannot wait to spend many vacations there. The lobby was amazing. You really feel like you are in a deluxe resort. The bathrooms off the lobby had real individual towels to use after washing your hands! The service was wonderful. Had a few little issues, i didn't get a parking pass when i check in, but was taking care of right away. The rooms were spacious and clean. The pull out couch was not a comfortable as OKW according to my friend who was with us, but she said it was still nice. The location is what really sells the place. Being so close to EPCOT was great! After Illuminations, we just walked back and didn't have to wait for the bus. We also ate at Kuzzina and did some shopping. We wish we had more time to check out all the things Boardwalk has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “1 Bedroom villa awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: gemmybear83
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at 1 bedroom villa four our wedding through disney usa using a 45% passholder discount, and we loved the villa. It was beautiful so airey and pretty as was the rest of the hotel. We had our room cleaned daily as we booked through disney and not through dvc and this made a big difference to our stay - I would not cleaning all that space mysewlf while on holiday! We were very lucky that our room was next to the elevator so we did not have a big walk that I have read complaints about. I would stay here again in a heartbeat we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Disney Style”
Reviews.Author: luvdsny
Reviews.Content: This was a winning trip for us. We own a timeshare and traded into the Boardwalk Villas. We are huge Disney fans and had always wanted to see Disney at Christmas. What a magical trip and it all started with the hotel. What a great location! To be able to walk to Epcot and MGM, was great. There is boat to get you to the parks as well but with many stops at neighbor hotels. So on with our review... We stayed in a studio villa and we had plenty of room for the three of us. There is a small kitchenette that included a mini-fridge, microwave and small sink. Glasses and mugs are provided along with paper goods (plates, utensils,etc). The room had a queen size bed and a pull out sofa. We all slept well with very little noise from neighboring villas. The room had a small balcony and the weather was great for sitting outdoors. We did use the main pool with clown slide as pools were heated. There are a few quiet pools on property as well. We did not use the kids club but did walk through the area and looked cute. The Boardwalk came alive at night - with street performances and lots of bustling activity. Plenty of eating areas too. This was a great location and place to rest. We gave it 5 stars and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: gman42
Reviews.Content: after staying at the caribbean beach and visiting the boardwalk last december this year we stayed in a 1 br villa.this has a nice location for epcot and mgm nearby restauraunts are worth the trip alone, especially flying fish.pools are nice but weather got down to 27 at night so we had in room jacuzzi to bail us out.had 2 in br 2 on queen size couch that was pretty comfy.the one thing that disney doesnt do is put pools indoors..lots of off site inexpensive hotels have indoor pools but we have been stranded at parks by outside transportation companys .disney isnt perfect but with all the things that can go wrong they do get it done.i also took us to wilderness lodge dinner at WISPERING CANYONFOR KETCHUP!!!also very nice 2of us were newbees they enjoyed everything keep up the standard

Reviews.Title: “Odd room layout and no double queens in second bedroom...balanced by location”
Reviews.Author: LYeary
Reviews.Content: When I first checked into the boardwalk, i was dismayed to find out that their version of a two bedroom villas was a dedicated one bedroom with a "linked" studio. The Studio had one queen and a pull out sofa queen...then in our connecting room we had a pull out queen and a king in our bedroom. All other resort two bedrooms that I have rented had two full queens, it ended up being ok as the mattresses on the sofa beds were higher quality. At our king bedroom, there was no door to close to the connecting jacuzzi room, so i could not wake up early and bath and not wake up husband as in other villas. That being said..the location to Epcot, the pools, and adult pools and jacuzzis were very relaxing, nice, and the food choices at the boardwalk, especially the big river brewery which was easy to walk into and get ribeyes, pizzas and sirloin and seafood was amazing, no reservation needed....i would say the resort grew on me when i could stroll into epcot in 8 minutes or less........I think i would stay at beach and yatch club in the future, for the amazing pool system there, that's like a water park. Boardwalk? B- in my book, or C+, and i've stayed at many disney hotels. Proximity makes up for odd rooms and smaller jacuzzis. You won't have a bad time here, worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Villa is very small and not much bigger than a regular hotelroom, sleeps 4 is very crowded if not impossible”
Reviews.Author: adina80
Reviews.Content: We booked a Boardwalk Villa to go on our family trip with two teenagers. After a long trip we finally arrived at the Boardwalk Villas, the Check in was very helpful and nice, when we reached the room we were quite shocked to see the villa in size of a regular hotelroom. a queen bad which had hardly enough space for 2, a sleepers couch and another bench sleeper. if we had stayed int he room, which was basically impossible with teenagers I would have felt like in a youth hostel as student. Luckily the front desk manager agreed to rebook us at same good rate we received through internet into saratoga springs resort, whch was one bedroom villa with kitchen, 2 bathrooms and enough space for all of us. So Boardwalk Hotel is fine, just make sure to book the villa only if you are with really small children and willing to be crowded!

Reviews.Title: “Magic sheer Magic”
Reviews.Author: jilli54
Reviews.Content: I felt this room was expensive but well worth the money. As we weren't vacation club members we didn't know what to expect and we had the meal plan. We found this difficult to understand at first but soon got to grips with it. Probably wouldn't go with this again as we ended up eating far too much and not using the excellent facilities in the room. The view was over the pool which was unfortunately closed for refurbishment. Disney being disney laid on transport to another pool all day however the weather wasn't good and not many people used this facility. there were also 2 quite pools very close by which I used on the ONE fine day we had. Don't know if the room would have been noisy if the pool had been open but we loved the whole place. What we particularly liked was the location perfect to walk to both Disney studios and Epcot the whole experience was amazing

Reviews.Title: “Lovely renovated villas and GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: bodenfarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a Studio for the Epcot Food & Wine Festival. It takes 6 minutes to walk to Epcot from Boardwalk Villas! The location cannot be beat. All of the villas have been recently renovated, and ours was scrupulously clean. The housekeeping staff was friendly and helpful. The community pool ("quiet" pool) was beautifully maintained, and so peaceful and relaxing! Of course, we went at a time when most kids are in school, so that may be part of the reason for the peaceful atmosphere. This resort is best for a more adult crowd IMO, it's less of a "kids" destination than most Disney resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Trip”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler36580
Reviews.Content: Disney does it so well. This was my first rip here since I was a kid. My wife and I went here (we are in our mid 30's and no kids) and had a marvelous time. October a great time to visit as weather is great, parks less crowded, lots of deals, and Epcot food and Wine Festival is going on. We are not Disney Vacation Club members but decided to go with a 1 bedroom villa as we were staying 8 nights and wanted the space. Wise decision. Well appointed rooms, with washer and dryer, full kitchen and whirlpool tub. Hotel service is great. Lots of cool activities on the Boardwalk. EPCOT and Hollywood Studios within walking distance as are Yacht an Beach club and Swan and Dolphin for a plethora of eating options. Convenient buses for Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, Downtown Disney and water parks. If you are flying and don't plan to do anything but Disney, don't bother with a car rental. Do the Magical Express! Free round trip transport and luggage handling to the airport (keep the vouchers they send you in the mail handy, though, don't lose them). Our trip was fun, romantic and memorable. Disney magic applies to all ages. Our hotel was so nice you could have had a great trip and never went to a park. Check out the free activities at the Community Hall!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: ellone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boardwalk 9/23-9/30 with my husband, mother and daughter. I used online check-in before we arrived and everything went smoothly upon arrival. We had a 1 bedroom villa. Room was spacious. One downside was that it was a long walk to the elevator. We could walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Buses to Magic Kingdom came often, but we had to wait a long time for one to Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Still Talking about Best Vacation Yet”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Mom02
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1bedroom reserved with our RCI Exchange points. What a wonderful time we had! The room layout was perfect for our little family of 3 (including our 8 year-old autistic son). Our son enjoyed sleeping on the pullout bed (which you wouldn't even notice was a sofa bed, except for the railings on the side, it was so comfortable). We loved taking the boats to HS and EP and never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus for the other parks. We go twice a year to Disney and have stayed at 2 Values, Polynesian, Beach Club, WL and WLV. It's a tossup between WL(V) and Boardwalk for our favourite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing location and excellent disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: boilerbunny
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as part of my disney vacation club.its like timeshare but done by disney.we arrived by the disney magical express,being picked up at orlando international by our disney coach.the entrance and foyer is amazing with large sofas and large windows looking out over a bay,quite typically disney.we checked easily and went to our room on the 4th floor.we weren't too far from the lifts just down a couple of corridors.the room was lovely,queen size bed and sofa bed,plenty if room for the pair of us.you can tell it's one of the older disney properties but it is still better than most others i've stayed in.we could either walk or take boat or bus to both epcot and hollywood studios.epcot was a 5 min walk away!ideal location for these 2 parks.we had a car and car parks where about a 5 min walk away,not too far if you don't have lots of shopping!the boardwalk around the hotel was lovely,you could stroll round it on a night and watch the entertainers,get something to eat or drink.the spa and pools where great.we went to the spa every morning to relaz before the chaos of the parks or shopping.which is amazing too.we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will be going back.it is typically disney and has everything you would expect from a disney property.wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for Families and Kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skinsfan76
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bed room and really enjoyed every moment there. A 2 bed room is a 1 bed room and a studio with the door open between the rooms. The 1 bed room is what really makes the room. It is enourmous with a full kitchen, two balconies, jet bath, and great bed room. The resort itself is great. The main pool is nice, with a great slide. The bar is good for drinks, but light on food service. The work out room is terrific. Plenty of equipment and was never busy. Included a sauna and steam room. Arcade was decent for kids. Community room was nice and offered services for kids. Boardwalk was nice and had plenty of entertainment at night. Great place to watch EPCOT fireworks. Would definately stay again and is one of our favorite resorts at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay - Great Resort - Especially for Epcot/Hollywood Studios Fans”
Reviews.Author: mtbmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Boardwalk View Studio and loved our room. We loved being able to watch the happenings on the boardwalk right from our balcony. Our view of the lake and Epcot in the distance was dreamy. The kitchen area was perfect for making our own simple breakfast (frozen waffles, pop-tarts, cereal, etc.). It had a mini-fridge (which held quite a lot of drinks), toaster, microwave and paper plates and plasticware. The bathroom was functional, but very small. Sink was located outside of the toilet area so one could use the sink while someone was in the bathroom. Mousekeeping did a great job, we had one day of housekeeping and one day of trash towel removal, replacement. The queen bed and pullout couch were very comfortable. In fact my back felt better in the queen bed than it does on my bed at home. I also fell asleep in the sofa bed one night and found that to be very comfortable for a pullout. I know many people complain about only one set of elevators in a very large resort. So I will mention it... Our room was far from the elevators (3 minute walk) but the walk was cool and dry. It did not bother us at all. However, our daughter is 9 so she can walk on her own. We only walked to the elevators when that was the direction we were going in. There are many many stairwells located throughout the resort. My only complaint (and I am a very light sleeper) was the noise from the Boardwalk. We were right near the hoop game and I could hear the dinging. I could also hear voices. Once I closed the heavy drapes though it was sufficiently quiet so I could sleep. Of course sleeping at night is difficult for me since I work nightshift. My husband and daughter did not hear a thing. We loved the pool and the clown slide was like a waterpark slide. Really whips you around fast. We had no difficulty finding lounge chair as they were ample. May be a bit difficult in a busier time though. The staff were amazing, always bending over backwards for us (in usual Disney form). We are already planning our next trip and will DEFINITELY be staying at the Boardwalk again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome visit”
Reviews.Author: lilcraft
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 bedroom villa for 6 nights and enjoyed our stay. The room was clean, bed was fresh and all the cast members we encountered were friendly and helpful. The resort is very close to Epcot and the Studios parks via a walkway to each. This is an ideal place to stay if you enjoy spending the evening at Epcot for touring the countries and watching Illuminations. Stay here and enjoy all the resort has to offer, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “So Nice Reality vanishes”
Reviews.Author: bartman113
Reviews.Content: 3rd time & its always perfect.high end beautiful spotless great friendly staff..the theme and opportunitiies to have fun here are endless & only a short walk (its best) to Epcot & Hollywood Studios

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort.. Disney Transport Buses from/to resort stink.”
Reviews.Author: mobrien278
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 BR Villa with a pre-teen and five year old. The Villa was spacious with a great view of the quiet pool and Tower of Terror at Hollywood Studios. Restaurants were great. Especially the Flying Fish! We met the Executive Chef who provided my five year old son a personalized tour of the kitchen, gave him an autographed chef's hat and took a nice picture together. Had to mention that because Chef Keating is a perfect Disney fit! Parks were busy but expectedly so. The only downside we encountered were the Disney Transports, We sat at the bus stop way more than we wanted to! Thirty five to forty minutes for MK! We ended up using a taxi twice rather than wait for the Downtown Disney Bus! PLUS, the same bus that serviced Boardwalk also traveled to Swan, Dolphin, Beach and Yacht Resorts! FIVE resorts before it went to the park! Ridiculous! One night, when we were returning from DD, the bus driver, named after change and it wasn't nickel or dime or quarter refused to open up the back bus door to let me out. Normally, I wouldn't think too much of it but I had my large Graco stroller folded up and the bus was packed. People were standing in the aisle and it was a mess. Well, I attempted to navigate the aisle but bonked two people. It's obvious that Disney is aware of the bus issue as I noticed a Disney Cast Member who appeared to be tracking the bus arrivals. Funny thing though, even with the cast member present doing his thing, the bus issue didnt change for my 11 day stay! Thank god you can walk to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. Other than the definitive need to fix the bus problem and, maybe one of the driver's, the vacation was a great success!

Reviews.Title: “WDW a Great Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bugsy_62
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members at the Boardwalk and come back every year. Although our children are grown now, we still enjoy the "Majic". Each year there is more to see and do, you never get tired of Disney. The staff and the rooms are incredible. The room we were in this year at the Boardwalk was updated with new appliances and furniture. It truly was like being at home. My husband and I like the Boardwalk because there is so much to do in the evening if you don't want to venture to Downtown Disney. The only down side this year was the charge for valet parking, and to use a computer downstairs, there was a fee. We have no problem with paying for valet parking but thought that the $12.00 charge was a little steep. Hopefully, Disney will give that a second thought, especially for DVC members.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Stay Yet”
Reviews.Author: t61travel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Disney. We picked the Boardwalk Villas solely on location and we were not disappointed. The room was great, clean and well laid out, everything was in great condition, just as you would expect. The staff was great, the atmosphere was great, but the real bonus was being within easy walking distance of Epcot. We found a GREAT place to watch IllumiNations (thanks to a cast member) and were able to walk leisurely back to the air conditioned comfort of our room (outside temp was still in the 90's even after dark) in under 10 minutes. The best bonus was the proximity to the Boardwalk Bakery. Also, the pizza from the Boardwalk was easily the most cost effective family meal in the area. We would just walk down, grab a nice fresh pizza and take it back to our room and eat with the kids. Our family has stayed at Coronado Springs and the All Star Music before and in our opinion the location and the reduction in travel time from park to park makes the Boardwalk worth the extra money. When we go back to Disney, we will stay at the Boardwalk Villas again.

Reviews.Title: “One of best properties at WDW”
Reviews.Author: rbdiaz
Reviews.Content: We are Dvc members at BWV, so we may be biased in favor of this location. Have stayed about ten times over the past several years and it is always a consistently good experience. Crowded and popular with families, but hotel has plenty of space to allow both private and crowd scenes. Great food and service - expensive, but worth it if you are looking for a high quality family experience where it is easy to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Can't rate this place highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: MrsControlFreak
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience in a 1BR apartment, everything was fantastic, from the lobby and corridors to the apartment itself. Very clean and really well equipped. We had a view over the pool. Location fantastic. So many lovely touches. Using disney transport, we never had to wait more than 2 mins for a bus. Using your own transport, it was close to the I4 and 192 when you wanted to go elsewhere. Staff welcoming and helpful at all times, but not too 'in your face' - just right! I Literally have no complaints - that doesn't happen very often...

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for Tween boy and 9 yr old...Best DVC Experience by far”
Reviews.Author: LuvinMy369Hero
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members at Saratoga Springs. My parents are original Old Key West members, so I have often visited BW but never stayed. After my husband and I had our first stay at Saratoga springs for our Honeymoon xmas of 08, we decided we would try to stay at different DVC resorts b/c we feel Saratoga is a bit boring for kids. Or first choice was BW, as I knew the kids could enjoy themselves. And what a great choice it was! Despite years of my parent talking about how much bigger OKW is, we fond the room to be a great size. I like having the pullout couches. We opted to stay in the studio as we were on dining plan and wanted to stay 10 days. The studio had plenty of room for our needs, although I can see it getting more difficult to stay in as the boys get older. Service was great with the exception of the slow checkin. Our room opened right up to boardwalk/front courtyard so it was a bit noisy at times. But the kids loved seeing the fireworks and playing around on the boards, reminded them of Wildwood. We had a FANTASTIC date night at Jelly Rollls....what a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Location and amenities trumps some mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: PoliticoJ
Reviews.Content: Love the pool, the location, the vibe, the view, the ease of so many things that being on property can bring. The front desk service was not keyed-in at all. Slow check-in, though we were the only ones there at the time. There were a couple of minor housekeeping issues, including a cobweb-covered light fixture. The front desk staff seemed oddly unconcerned. But friendly. Friendly service does not equate to perceptive service. Bartenders at Belle Vue lounge were awesome. So many nice places to eat nearby, especially Beaches and Cream and Cape May Cafe. No good coffee though -- went over to Dolphin hotel for that. Beds are okay, but the bedding is out-dated, heavy, and uncomfortable. We own DVC here, and so we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “The Mouse Needs Manners”
Reviews.Author: AVANARIA
Reviews.Content: I had the worst stay at Disney's BoardWalk Villa. 1st off we were pool side on the first floor, this you would think was a good thing. The problem was that the water bugs from outside would come into the room. When Housekeeping was advised of the problem they said they would take care of it. We never saw them but they stated that they were there. It seemed that know one was there since the bugs did not leave. I feel that if they had sprayed it would abate the problem slightly, but this did not work. The rug in our room was soaking wet from a broken AC unit. The Maintenance workers fixed the problem but wanted "US" to leave a wet vac on and to turn it off when it filled up. Yes, This did not happen. The Hotel Manager who resembeled the Host of Fantasy Island was "Know" host to me and my Family. He was rude and it was extremely odd for a Disney property to have such ill behaved and "Unhappy" employees. I think it was the Island of Misfit Disney Workers. I am sure things have improved but to me it was my worst trip to a Disney Property. This was my tenth trip to Disney in the last ten years and I have never experienced such harsh treatment. I have not been back to Disney since but will give them one more shot, based on past vists. They usually bend over backwards to help there guests......Mickey really needs a sit down at the BoardWalk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wonderful staff, nice rooms, huge resort”
Reviews.Author: qualtyk9
Reviews.Content: we had a one bedroom room next to the pool with the waterslide. Our room was on the first floor and our deck faced the toddler pool area. We loved our experience at this hotel. The staff was friendly, concierge helpful, the boardwalk was a fun way to spend the evenings and the pool was great for the kids. The only challenge I had is that I kept getting lost (unusual for me). But I could never seem to get to where I was going in this hotel-laugh. But while lost with my children we did see bunnies, passed quiet pools and beautiful landscaping. We felt strangely safe while lost. Our amazing end- I lost my cell phone while there and the Disney resorts shipped it home to me. We loved this hotel and plan to book a similar room again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Visit...DVC member w/9 family members”
Reviews.Author: seahawkfan1765
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Boardwalk Villas in 8 months. We had a 2 bedroom villa and a 1 bedroom villa. Check in was handled quickly and with little fuss. We purchased the dining plan and used multiple credit cards and the front desk lady was very pleasant. The one bedroom was available so we had all the bags moved to that room. Since it was Mother's Day, we had reservations at Cape May for brunch and didn't have a lot of time to get from place to place. (We spent our first night at Shades of Green.) As discussed in many reviews, our rooms were a long walk from the elevators, but it is Disney and you are going to be walking a lot. Our rooms were clean and with the exception of a non-functioning iron, everything was in order.We used the pool and found the life guards attentive and professional. We used the boats to EPOCT and to Hollywood Studios. We also used the buses on several different occasions. We never waited longer than 10 minutes. We had dinnner at Kouzzina's and it was fantastic. We had the best table in the house with a great view of the kitchen. One evening part of our group even made smores on the beach in front of Beach Club. The whole area around Boardwalk always seems to have something going on....and your visit is different everytime. All in all our visit was what I have come to expect from Boardwalk. My roommate owns here, but I own at Bay Lake Towers. That will be our choice for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed in Boardwalk Villas”
Reviews.Author: clkuz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are DVC members and this was our first time staying at Boardwalk Villas. We had such high expectations before staying there and were so excited, until we got there. The room was a far walk, but we don't walking since it is Disney and you have to walk everywhere. As soon as we opened the room door, we were greeted by a disgusting musty smell. It was almost like someone smoked in the room prior to us and then never put the air on. YUCK! We put the fan/air on, but the smell stayed. The decor was quite strange - nothing matched. I just thought it was weird since every DVC resort that we have stayed at is themed quite well. The couch was like a rock, literally! We had just came from a stay at AKL and the couch was so comfortable - it was a very "homey" place. You could not even sit on the couch to watch TV. Even though the room seemed to have new rugs and a new TV, it was still very old looking. There was still hair in our tub from the last guests - ewww! Also, when we checked in our room wasn't ready. No problem, we went to the parks and they said that they'd send a text when it was. At 5 PM we didn't receive any texts - the desk said that they didn't know what happened. As DVC members, they usually leave a message on your phone the first night to welcome you and give you a number to call if you need anything. For the 1st time as DVC members, this did not happen. Again, not a huge deal at all, but it made me realize how just how much of a special touch it is. We had a studio and our fridge leaked inside all night. All you heard was drip, drip, drip, drip while you were trying to sleep. We didn't have a need to use the fridge, but it was kind of annoying. The pool was very old and not very clean compared to all of the other resorts I stayed at. I truly felt like was at a crappy motel at Wildwood, NJ. This is the first disappointing experience I have EVER had at Disney in the last 20 years. I won't go back there nor would I recommend it to anyone. Finally, there is no real quick service on property. I didn't think that would matter, but it did when we were looking for a quick lunch. If you are a DVC member, proceed with caution when booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, problematic building”
Reviews.Author: anotherboomer
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in a one-bedroom Boardwalk villa for the first time on a family vacation to Disneyworld. I love the friendliness and charm of the Epcot resort area. But I found the Boardwalk building itself too large and bewildering. As the other reviewers have noted, there is only one bank of three elevators to service the entire building. This means either walking through endless corridors or like us, using the drab utility stairs. It's no wonder there are complaints about the housekeeping. Simply getting to the rooms in time to clean them is a struggle, especially if you're dragging one of those heavy utility carts. I have great sympathy for the cleaning staff (and we left a generous tip). We had a pleasant room overlooking the walkway to Hollywood Studios. The one-bedroom suite was nice, but nothing special. It had an extra sink and a jacuzzi off the master bedroom, but there was no door on it. And the door in the stall shower didn't have an inside handle, so it couldn't be closed from the inside. Although i found the hotel physically deficient, I appreciated the friendliness and skill of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at a gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: SMCMichigan
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Boardwalk Villas and we absolutely loved it. This has become our new favorite resort at Walt Disney World. We stayed in a studio villa. It was on the top floor overlooking the feature pool. We were very near the elevators so we had none of the issues with distance that we'd heard about. My only complaint was that the pool area would get quite loud in the afternoon with all the activities and games going on -- that made for difficult napping. In the future, I think we'll ask to not overlook the pool area. You cannot beat the location -- walk to Hollywood Studios and Epcot. We spent nine nights at this resort in April of 2010 and cannot wait to go back. The staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. We did not encounter one staff member who didn't have a pleasant comment. Kudos to the management on having such a terrific staff. Our housekeepers were very good and kept our room in wonderful shape for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: We regularly stay at Boardwalk as Disney Vacation Club members but always look forward to going back and we're never disappointed. We had a great studio room on the ground floor just a minute away from the Villa pool and community hall. Huge and comfortable room - plenty big ebough for the 3 of us. Busy time of year but everything still seemed to run smoothly. We stayed 10 nights but were so sorry to leave - looking forward to going back in October. Overall a great place to stay - cant fault anything - a true Disney gem

Reviews.Title: “Nice to go back to Boardwalk Villas”
Reviews.Author: palmharbormichelle
Reviews.Content: I am a member of the Disney Vacation Club and hadn't stayed at the Boardwalk Villas in about 8 years. Stayed in a 1 bedroom and the room looked to have been recently repainted/spruced up. The pull-out couch was fairly new and comfortable according to my son. The room was clean and the balcony was large. Kitchen stocked and clean. Flat screen TV's also. This is a big resort and the rooms are very spread out. My advice is to use the side/back doors as much as possible. There are doors that open along the path that goes around the resort and this is much easier than going to the lobby to get out every time depending on where your room is located. The path can take you to the pools and to the Boardwalk area. The main pool area is very entertaining for children as there is a large water slide and a bar for mom and dad. I would stay here more often if there were ever any rooms available, but I own at the Beach Club and haven't been there in 6 years either. Usually stay at Key West or Saratoga because of size, availability, and parking but Boardwalk was a really nice change. Had a lot of fun walking around the Boardwalk on a Sat. night.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love!”
Reviews.Author: JennyM822
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are major Disney lovers and chose the Boardwalk Villas for our honeymoon. We LOVED it! From the minute we walked in, I said "IThis is the Disney hotel I want to stay at!!" (I'm sure the others are great too, though). The kitchenette was perfect for a quick breakfast in the morning, the hotel was clean, and of course we were treated like the only people there. When we weren't at the parks or downtown Disney, we enjoyed the clean boardwalk area and all the restaurants and shops. It was a quick walk to the Yacht and Beach club resorts which were fun too. The best was the walking distance to Epcot and Hollywood studios and not having to wait to board any busses or Ferrys to get there. It may not be in our budget to stay for our next trip, but we are going to hang out there anyway! Also, it was very quiet inside the hotel and easy to fall asleep.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Disney”
Reviews.Author: ahndz1
Reviews.Content: On our quest to stay at as many different Disney resorts as possible, we decided to try the BW villas on this trip. Our feeling is that you can't beat the EPCOT resorts in terms of location. The room seemed worn, but it IS a hotel room and there are LOTS of people passing through. But still clean and comfortable and to Disney standards. The kids loved the boardwalk, loved walking over to EPCOT and even walked back from HS when the boats were packed. The only downside to this resort is the fact that there is no in hotel restaurant. You have to go out to the boardwalk to get anything to eat or drink. There is some way to order pizza to the room but it is from one of the restaurants on the walk. We never tried it, but heard or read that you could do it. Tried out the pool one day too and it was perfect for the kids and the pool bar was perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: “Turn of the century elegance with 21st century ameneties”
Reviews.Author: Katrinakaren
Reviews.Content: The boardwalk hotel offers many of the conviences one could associate with their own homes. The villas offer a complete kitchen with full size fridge icemaker and stove. Working laundry service in the unites, whirlpool tub in the master bath. Massive swimming pool with kid-friendly slide and a private adults only pool. Spacious cortyards abound with quiet out of the way places to have a stroll or speak sweet nothings to your sweetie. 5 restaurants and a dance club can be found on the boardwalk. Walking distance to Epcot and disney's hollywood studios.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected....”
Reviews.Author: VernonCT
Reviews.Content: I read some great reviews of this property and we have stayed at many Disney properties including Beach Club, Saratoga, Old Key West, Contemporary and now this one. There are pros and cons - The cons are the property is HUGE - meaning that we had to park in the boondocks ( since the parking lot is not close to any of the rooms ) and haul our luggage in ( in the rain none the less ) - then I asked for a room close to an elevator ( and for reference there are about 2 of them in the entire villa side ) and it was about a 10 minute walk just to our room! We had an issue where the toilet overflowed - my daughter had used it and put in about one square of paper and it backed up all over the floor - leaving me to wonder if it was cleaned before we arrived as if the cleaning crew flushed it it woudl have overflowed then..... hmmm. The hot water side of the sick was broken ( it did not turn ). When we went to the fitness center at 5am * the 24 hour fitness center mind you - the door was deadbolted. 3 different people had to go upstairs to find someone to help before it got opened about 1/2 an hour later.... We liked the location since there were a lot of cute shops on the Boardwalk but the hotel is simply too big to be comfortable. The walk to the pool could take 5 to 10 minutes easily. The hotel is just "okay" - I have stayed in other much nicer more convenient places for a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “It was like staying at a motel..You've been warned.”
Reviews.Author: Alongcamesunshine
Reviews.Content: I know it sounds convenient to stay on a boardwalk next to restaurants and such... but it's the opposite. There is no ferry to downtown disney and parking sucks. t's also a very old and dirty hotel, with bad customer service. I have bed bugs all over my arm and neck from my stay there.. if you have the time and want to know the truth read my story: Naturally, after a long trip I was so excited to get to our Disney Resort. However I was sorely disappointed. We arrived at the front entrance and was told by the Bell boy that we either had to pay 12 dollars to have our car valet parked or park it ourselves a good half a mile or so from the entrance. We didn't want to pay, so we started to take the luggage out of the car. We went to grab one of the luggage carts and the bell boy stopped us and asked if he could help. We said no, and he then continued to tell us that it was Disney policy that we weren't allowed to use the luggage carts. With no other choice, we allowed him to unpack our car. Which he then gave us a ticket and said our luggage would be up shortly. Checking in was just as confusing as parking. We did the online check in, so we walked up to the appropriate desk to check in. The receptionist didn't say anything to us and just handed us our keys. I had to ask her for a map of the hotel, which she then handed us a DVC member folder and told me all the info was in there. Finding our room was a nightmare. There was only one elevator (according to the hotel map) and the elevator was extremely far away from our room. Hallways later, we found our room and THAT was an even BIGGER nightmare. It was the nastiest room I have ever seen. The bathroom looked like a public restroom at a gas station... dirty, grimy, hair all over the place. It looked like all the cleaning lady did was fold the toilet paper into a nice little triangle... but forgot to actually clean the urine off the toilet seat. Disgusted, I called the front desk to request for another room. They acted like I was really inconveniencing them. The male receptionist made a sarcastic comment about how there must be a dead person in our room if it's that dirty. We finally received another room, which was even further away from the elevator than the last one. Not to mention, the bell boy had already dropped off our luggage at the old room and they don't offer luggage help if youâ€™re leaving your room. So we had to drag our luggage all the way to the new room without a cart. Unfortunately, the new room was just as bad... if not worse. I had to clean the toilet off with a disinfecting wipe..I couldn't take a shower without the bath filling all the way up. THEN the worst part ever!
