I pulled the sheets back when I went to bed and I pulled out a very long brown hair ... I have short hair. The manager was unavailable to talk, they wouldn't switch my room again.. I ended up leaving a day early. And to make matters worse, I have bed bug bites all over my arm and neck. Stay at Disney's Saratoga Springs if you can... much much better

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk Villas 2010”
Reviews.Author: Dar948
Reviews.Content: This was a typical Disney vacation for us. Disney takes care of the small details like no one else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel & great service”
Reviews.Author: ajwnal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Villias last summer for six days & then off on the Disney Wonder for a cruise. I cannot say one thing bad about this condo/hotel. We rented a two bedroom suite with two baths. The m/ain living area had a modern kitchen, nice living room & a nice pool overlooking the pool & waterslide. The add room was off of the main living room with its own bath & kitchen area, but not a full kitchen. Even though we were pool side on 5th floor, it was very quiet & never heard any noise. I fully recommend this property to anyone. It has something to offer to just about anyone. Does not have a bar or restaurant, but has a full kitchen which all dishes are washed daily & cleaning service daily should you request it. We had a better time at Boardwalk Villas than we would have staying at The Swann or Douphin hotels. I would love to own a unit. Another good thing is the actual boardwalk is only 10 feet from hotel, & there are countless restaurants, shops, etc. We will be going back to Boardwalk Villas in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: MommyAngela
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 3 1/2-year-old son to Disney World January 4 through January 11, 2010. My husband ran the Disney Marathon on the 10th, so we were there in the frigid week before. I know that many of the things we loved about the hotel probably would be problems had we gone during a warmer/busier time. So take it for what it's worth. We never had any noise from the pool, even though we faced the pool, but it was 35 degrees. I can imagine that if it had been warmer, noise during naptime (and bedtime) would have been annoying at best. If we stay here again, we will most likely request a room that does not face the pool or the Boardwalk, for noise sake. Also, because there were hardly any crowds, the buses and boats would get us to the parks in 20-25 minutes, unlike the hour that others complained about. Still, I have no idea why anyone would take a boat to Epcot when it is only an 8-10 minute walk. If a six-month pregnant lady, pushing a preschooler in a stroller in near-freezing temperatures can do it, so can you. Hollywood Studios was a bit farther of a walk--probably 15-20 minutes. Not bad if conditions are right, but it was so cold and I was feeling the pregnancy, so we took the boat. The buses to MK and AK ran on time and never took more than 18 to 25 minutes to get us from our hotel to the front gates. We had read the reviews about the long walk to the elevator, so we requested a room by the elevator. When we arrived at 3:30 for our 4:00 check-in, we had to wait until about 4:20 before a room was ready. Then we saw where the room was and it was not at all near the elevators. So they moved us (quickly) to a room that was supposedly closer. In actuality, it wasn't all that close. But when you're at Disney, all you do is walk, so it wasn't too bad. But definitely try to get as close to the elevator as you can, as there is only one in the entire villa. Twice for quick-service meals (we did the dining plan and HIGHLY recommend it), we drove to the All-Star Music resort and ate in their food court. It was a short drive and a wonderful place to eat. I only wish they had some sort of food court near the Boardwalk Villas. It was hard to find food (especially on the dining plan) that was quick and easy if we retired early to our room. We got a one-bedroom suite so that we could put our son to bed in the king bed and close the door, while we stayed in the living room, planning for the next day. Then when we went to bed, we'd simply move him to the pull-out queen sleeper sofa and go to bed in the king. The best part, though, of the one-bedroom suite was the washer/dryer. There was also a full kitchen w/a full-size fridge, oven/stove, and microwave. And because these are time-share rooms (even though we are not DVC members), they are stocked w/dishes, silverware, paper towels, dish detergent, etc. Really all we needed. As far as housekeeping, we could have gotten our rooms cleaned/beds made, etc, every day, but we chose to only do it a few times because we didn't really feel that it was needed. Two out of the three times that we purposefully left the privacy notice up (so as to not receive housekeeping), we received a phone call just being sure we didn't need anything. When our rooms were cleaned, they were cleaned very well. The staff even arranged my son's Disney stuffed animals on his bed. :) The concierge service was available 24-hours a day to answer our questions about how to get to certain places, etc., though they didn't always give the same information, especially about marathon transportation. One thing that was kind of annoying was that in order to use a luggage cart, you had to utilize their bellhop services. I suppose this makes sense and is probably standard in higher-class hotels, but we are too cheap to pay someone to carry our bags, so we had to do it all ourselves. All three trips. But that is just a preference on our part. I know many people have no problem tipping bellhops to help them, but we're perfectly capable of doing it ourselves. It just would have been nice to have a luggage cart to use. Even in a very low-traffic time (10 pm), they would not allow us to use one to load our car. Also, I think it is cheap and irritating that there is no free high-speed internet service, and that (non-wifi) internet is $9.95 a day. We did find an unsecured network in our room the first four days and that was great, but then it disappeared. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay. I will never come to Disney and stay outside the parks. The convenience, the resort transportation, and the dining plan are all worth the extra money. While the MK is our favorite park, the resorts that are within walking distance of that park are considerably more expensive, so this was a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: singlemom53
Reviews.Content: Stayed the last week of 2009 in a Studio. Good things - ceiling fan, flat Screen TV, sizeable closet with sufficient hangers, relatively new sofa and bed in excellent condition, microwave, coffee pot, iron/board, hairdryer, balcony, and excellent heat and we did need it on the very cold nights. Great pool/water slide. Magical Express Transportation to/from airport is great as well as the airline check-in and baggage check. I have stayed on Disney property at 13 different venues for a total of 268 nights since 1997 so I know what to expect from the Disney Experience. The things that I did not like at the Boarkwalk Villa venue was: Room next to vending machines, no electrical outlets on walls near table, had to run a laptop cord over the sofa, TV and chair to have power at the table. hardware hanging from the bathroom door handle, extremely small bathroom, no self service for refillable mugs that were purchased. Bus service shared with Swan/Dolphin which is a non-Disney property and Yacht/Beach Club making a trip to anywhere almost an hour especially when Swan/Dolphin resort has a single bus lane. Buses in line have to wait for the first one to load and unload and can be lengthy with wheelchair loads. Boat transportation is also shared with the non-Disney Swan/Dolphin, boats often fill up there and Disney Resort guests are left waiting. Just 3 small drawers available in the lower portion of the TV stand so be prepared to live out of a suit case. Wall safe is half the size of the ones at Value Resort Pop Century. The table is small, does not match chairs or other furniture, cannot fit a pizza box and two people at the table all at the same time. Maintenance staff required before inroom internet service could be used. Couldn't believe Wi-Fi was not available. This was out 5th Christmas/New Years stay at Walt Disney World so I cannot attribute the poor service at this venue to the time of year. Never experienced a transportation issue at this time of year at the Pop Century. Accessibility to quick service food is non-existent, the Bakery is to small,understaffed and limited menu for the volume of resort guests. Very dissappointed and am not likey to return to this resort since we had similar experience at this resort in 2004.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: zlast1
Reviews.Content: Split our stay between Boardwalk and Animal Kingdom, we loved this resort. Animal Kingdom was nice, but this was the best resort we have ever stayed at. Everyone was so nice and the decor was just fun. We have stayed at many Disney resorts, but we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST resort at WDW! LOVED our stay!”
Reviews.Author: misslolly21
Reviews.Content: This was our 8th time to Disney and 4th time staying in one of the WDW resorts. The Boardwalk Villas is by far the best one we've stayed at. Our room was the studio and it was quite spacious and comfortable. The room has a small kitchen and Queen pull out sofa, plus a balcony. Tips: Vending machine near hotel bar, since shops close by 11. 10 Min walk to EPCOT gates, in lieu of boat. We'll stay here again! Enjoy :) L. Toronto, Ontario

Reviews.Title: “...a bit of a disappointment compared with other villas on property”
Reviews.Author: NHYankees
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Disney Vacation Club members and decided to try the Boardwalk Villas. We had heard about the long walks to rooms and that is certainly true and if coming and going several times a day, exhausting! The walls are surprisingly thin and on our last night, new "neighbors" moved in and slammed every door at least twice checking things out, and we could actually hear them talking... Studio rooms are attractive and convenient with small kitchenette but the bed was a huge pillowtop and it felt as if you would slide right off it. Proximity to Epcot is excellent and the prime reason we chose this location. We will choose other villa accomodations in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing & elegant”
Reviews.Author: Shortperson2002
Reviews.Content: I loved every moment of being there, from the resturants to the scenery it all was just wonderful!"

Reviews.Title: “Love Boardwalk Villas”
Reviews.Author: beckyfromtennessee
Reviews.Content: We love the Boardwalk Villas. It is right in the middle of a lot of our favorite Disney things. You can walk to Epcot and the studios or take a boat to both. The Boardwalk has entertainment most nights. There are also several great restaurants. The theme is fun yet elegant throughout the resort. There is a main pool which can be crazy busy and two quiet pools which are very relaxing. Our third floor villa overlooked the entrance. We could see Illuminations at Epcot the nights we were in our room. There were stairs nearby with an exit for a shortcut to the bus stop and parking lot. I would request this area again. The villa was in great condition and set up very efficiently. We stayed 11 nights and were able to store everything easily. The beds were very comfy and everything was clean. You do not get daily maid service in the villas. They schedule a mini clean on your fourth day and a full clean on your 8th. They did come in on the wrong days each time. This was not a huge deal, but I am one of those who "picks up before the maids come" ( getting personal items off beds, floors, and counters to make their job easier) and had not done so either time. I would highly recommend this fun resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing--won't be returning.”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Mom
Reviews.Content: First of all, Disney is hurting bigtime due to the financial mess everyone is in--and it shows. THe resort was mostly empty--but they insist on telling you that they are full to capacity. Any request is denied because they are fully booked, supposedly. Anyway, we have stayed at the resort over the years and this time will be our last. First of all, it seems like all of a sudden there are rules about everything. I was in the pool w/ my two kids and the lifeguards hassled me about the swim ring one had, they hassled us if we were --no exaggeration--standing two feet from the pool w/ a drink in our hands; we had to be four feet away. This was CONSTANT. I felt like a 5 yr old being scolded for ridiculous things. We met up with our relatives that were also staying there w/ their kids and they felt the same way. We would go to the quiet pool for some peace from the constant whistle blowing at everyone enjoying the pool. It was irritating. The rooms weren't cleaned very well and a member of our party got ringworm from the linens. Gross. When I made the reservation, I specifically asked if we could use the pool at the Beach Club and I was told that we could; simply present the room card. We shlep over there w/ all the kids--one wearing an "IT's MY BIRTHDAY" pin--only to be denied entry to the pool. I argued that we were told we could use that pool and they left us standing there for 30 minutes in 90 degree weather while a manager spoke to someone on the phone about it. We were given the "booked to capacity" excuse even though 90% of the lounge chairs were empty. Finally, we were allowed to use the pool. Major hassle, though. The magic has died for the super expensive Disney resorts. You can stay at similar, larger and better resorts for half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: courtney106
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members and stay here all the time. We love the location, usually get the room area that we request. The TV's are the big downside. They are small and old. We are going again in Nov and my husband is already talking about watching his football on such a small TV. We always get a studio which is perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Resort for kids”
Reviews.Author: houseof3boys
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Boardwalk Villas. We stayed in a one bedroom with two kids (4 and 6) so it was wonderful to have the space and the kitchen. Our location was right near a secondary pool and the activity center. We loved the activity center and made use of it everyday of our trip. The kids played air hockey, ping pong and played with the toys and colored with the various coloring pages they gave out. It was never crowded and a great place to do a relaxed activity. They also had many video games for older kids that looked great! The boardwalk itself is a great place to walk around at night and the view of the water and Epcot is great for watching fireworks. Loved the new Cat Cora restaurant, Kouzinna, that is right there on the boardwalk. The location is great for taking the boat over to Epcot, walking to the Beach Club resort as well as the Swan and Dolphin to get to the mini-golf. The room itself was very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Sweet”
Reviews.Author: sjoyce24
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boardwalk for weekend to visit family for special occasion. Being a DVC member, Boardwalk is always our first choice. Location, Location, Location. Other family was staying at the Swan and we could easily meet up. Room was great, although there was construction going on right outside our window. Teens love this place - if you are not visiting a park, there is stuff to keep busy on the Boardwalk. Could use a bit of an upgrade to the activites, but at teast it is something. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: wilmark
Reviews.Content: I found my experience at this highly rated Timeshare dissapointing. DVC locations are in very high demand for timeshare exchange so i grabbed this up when i came my way and i was going orlando. My experience was a dissapointment and my advice is to stay away from all the hype about DVC locations. The ONLY thing this timeshare has going for it is its Location. The busses operating to and from the hotel are a negative - you loose alot of time sometimes up to an hour each way - our average wait was about 20 min. Then you have to wait another 1/2 hr with stops to reach the parks. They say you get extra hours in the parks with this option both in the morning and evening. I dont know how - the attractions still close at the same time for everyone. the day before we arrived i called and asked for a room on a high floor near the elevator and when we arrived we were given the furthest room on the ground floor (about 5-10 min walk from the front desk) with no view of and the longest walk. The rooms are drab and dismal although this may be intentional to imitate the early 1900's or so. Service appeared non existent and nonchalant. Parking is very far unless you choose valet parking where you will have to tip the guy every time you drop off/pu your car. On the whole not worth it. There was nothing abnormal about my trip - this is just the norm. The pool area is better than average if you have children. But too far from my room. Be prepared to pay for everything except local calls. They charge you 95$ for the bus service for the week per room

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable and fun place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastOlliePhant
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the boardwalk villas, and once again a satisfying experience overall. If you want to be close to Epcot and Hollywood studios, this is a great location - walking distance to both parks, unless you prefer a short boat ride. When you are not in the parks, there is the boardwalk with shops, restaurants, bars, boat rentals, free entertainment, and night life. The hotel itself has a large, lively pool (luna park) with a major water slide and activities for children. For those who prefer a less noisy pool, there are smaller, quieter pools in other areas of the hotel. At night we enjoyed jellyrolls, a piano bar near the boardwalk villa - duelling pianos, where you get to request your favorite song. All the performers are very talented and seem to have an endless repertoir of songs. The performer who is older and overweight and looks a bit like Santa can be grumpy and might try to insult your if you are having too much, you jst have to ignore him. Then, after hours of having fun at jellyrolls, signing, dancing and people watching, we would always return to the hotel pool and relax on one of those friendly pool elephants, that are just begging to be mounted. If we have any requests or suggestions at all, it would be to add some towel hooks in the bathroom (we had a studio and there were none....kind of annoying - so until that happens you might want to bring your own (towel hook). But I am sure Disney will get to it shortly. Our friends stayed at a three bedroom grand villa, which is incredibly roomy as one would expect, and had a great view over the boardwalk and the lake. If you have a large group of people and can afford it, go for it !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Average to below average in room space”
Reviews.Author: grahamcrackerz5
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the week 8/16-8/23/09 and received a great package plus free dining which is a great deal but reserve months in advance for sit-downs or you're stuck with the lower tier of counter service, etc. If you're able to get a nice package The Boardwalk is a nice place to stay as it is accessable to Hollywood Studios & Epcott on foot. It's a 1st class facilty however the room space was a big disappointment esp. if you're getting a Villa Studio. The interior needs minor updating esp. given Boardwalk is a top tier Disney Resort. The staff (TJ) really pulled through for us during difficult times when to our suprise and disappointment were handed a handicap room with 2 children. Had we purchase this during peak season we'd be very unsatisfied at $450 plus per night!! Our other family members were staying @ All Star's and at half the price had an extra room and were more than satisfied. When you're out at the parks much of the day like at Disney the hotels & resorts seem trivial but the longer your stay the more you're going to want to hang around the resort. If you have a sizable party and little ones the pool is awesome but the rooms itself were small. Would recommend this to newlyweds or couples unless you're fortunate to score a great deal/package.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: smeak13
Reviews.Content: The biggest advantage we found while staying at the Boardwalk Villas was it's location near Epcot and Hollywood Studios. There is a ferry from the Boardwalk to both Epcot and Hollywood Sudios, but we found it was quicker to walk (5 minutes to Epcot, 15 minutes to Hollywood Studios). If it rains in the afternoon or if it is too hot, you can always walk back to your hotel room to relax and head back out in the evening. Buses are available to take you to The Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, the water parks, or Downtown Disney. If you'd rather have easy access to the Magic Kingdom, the resorts on the monorail may be a better choice. There are some restaurants and shops along the Boardwalk, but it was relatively quite while we were there. The main pool has a slide for kids and is fairly large, but the hot tub was small. We stayed in a two-bedroom villa that easily slept 6 adults. We had groceries delivered to the room so that we could eat some meals and snacks in the room rather than going out for every meal. We also took advantage of the Extra Magic Hours when certain parks are open late or early for Disney Resort guests.

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY”
Reviews.Author: ctalmeida
Reviews.Content: Me, wife, one 11 year old, 1 14 year old. Got here Saturday, room not ready, wait for the room, call them on the special number to find if room was ready, when ready got our bags and went to the room, room was - bed not done, dirth bathroom, used towels on the floor, garbage still on the cans, used soap.... call them (SORRY SIR THAT DOES NOT HAPPEN), they gave us other room, walk all the way to the another room with all bags got there, soap used, towels on the floor, garabage can used.....Finally move to a decent clean room, about 2 hours later. Sunday went to sleep 3AM, today 8AM, hammer noises on the top floor, all kind of working noises, We cannot sleep. Manager asks if that is a problem????!!!!!!!??!?!?!?!!? Service is terrible, worst nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Room in an Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Couscous4
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location: We are huge fans of Disney Hollywood Studios and Epcot, and we enjoyed the short walk between the Villas and these parks. (We would rather walk than deal with parking, or wait for a bus at the end of a long day. ) We liked being close to the restaurants and atmosphere of the Boardwalk as well. The room: My husband and 9 year old son stayed in a studio, and though not huge, we found it large enough for a family of 3. It was very clean and well tended. The pool: I'm not crazy about clowns, so I thought I might hate the pool area. However, the giant clown head didn't bother me. The staff at the pool was fun, and my son and I rode on the slide several times. The vibe: It somehow felt homey but elegant. The Disney magic was ever present.

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, terrible service, horrible management.”
Reviews.Author: MissMouse1928
Reviews.Content: First, the pros: It's beautiful, it's just a short walk to Epcot from here. That's it. I booked a 3 night stay at the Florida resident rate directly through Disney which gave me a 36% discount off the regular rate. The villas are so costly that this was still an expensive stay even with the discount. I was at the hotel for a total of 7 hours before getting angry enough to check out at 11:30 PM and go to another hotel. First, the parking....the hotel parking lot was designed for one purpose only...to get you to pay an extra $!0 per day on top of the expensive room rate so you don't have to walk quite a distance to the hotel's front entrance. Even the handicapped parking is far from the front entrance. Upon arrival, I pulled up to the valet area where I was ignored so I asked if I could leave my car there until I checked in. A valet took my keys and told me I could do that. At the check-in desk I encounter Cast Member - Raymond who although he's been working at this hotel for a while (as told to me by another Cast Member) knew very little information about it. I asked if I could upgrade to a room with a kitchenette because I hadn't realized until the night before my arrival, that the room I booked onilne only had a microwave and small refrigerator. I was unable to change my reservation online at that point. He told me that they did have a 1 bedroom villa with kitchenette available and after much fuss on the phone to see what the extra fee would be to upgrade, he told me it would be an extra $115 per night. In the few seconds that I was contemplating this, he received a phone call, and then told me he was sorry but he told me the wrong price and that it would be $238 per night to upgrade because they couldn't give me the FL resident discount rate at the hotel. (WHAT??!!) I started to get annoyed at this point and in the few seconds that I was contemplating what to do, another Cast Member came out from behind a closed door, looked at me and said "I'm really sorry but we just sold the only 1 bedroom that was available while you were deciding what to do. NOW I was angry. I said "this is ridiculous, what is going on here? For medical reasons, I need the kitchenette to prepare my own food, I've been here less than an hour and I'm already very aggravated, perhaps I shouldn't stay here at all." A manager that was nearby heard the conversation and whispered something to the Cast Member that came out to tell me the bad news. SUDDENLY....a one bedroom villa with kitchen became available and at the Florida resident discount rate. How about that!!?? Unfortunately this wasn't the end of my misery. I check in and return to the valet area to see about having my luggage taken to my room. A Cast member at the valet booth tells me to "talk to that guy over there" so I do and he walks over to my car with me when I realize I don't have my keys. I go back to the valet booth and they don't know where my keys are. They find them but by then the bellman that was going to help me had walked away from my car. Someone directs me to the bell stand just inside the entrance and I get help with my luggage. I tell the bellman that I'm going to park my car and meet him at my room. This hotel is so large and built in such an odd way that it's difficult to navigate. Raymond gave me the wrong directions on how to get to my room and I quickly became very lost and unable to figure out how to get to where I was supposed to be so I called the front desk from my cell phone. Two cast members came to assist me and they said "this happens all the time here." Hmmmm.....if it happens all the time, don't you think they should do something about that?! Finally both my luggage and I are in the room. I'm exhausted, it took over an hour to complete check in, park my car and find my room. The room is beautiful and very spacious but that's all it is. There is advertising everywhere you look to join the Disney Vacation Club, including on the TV. And I do mean everywhere! The kitchen table had large stickers all over it with these ads and you see them throughout the hotel. I had difficulty finding a TV channel that was NOT advertising something Disney. I went out for a while and when I returned to my room and attempted to use my laptop, I found a sign on the kitchen table that said to look for an ethernet cable in the closet (there was no cable) and that there was a $10 per 24 hours fee to use the service. I was enraged. This was the most expensive hotel I've ever stayed at and they were going to charge me to use the Internet? No they weren't as far as I was concerned. I called the front desk, reported that there was no ethernet cable and that I wished to have the fee for the Internet waived. I was told they "COULDN'T" do that so I asked to be connected to someone who could. I was told that the manager would call me back. About a half hour later, the manager called. He asked me: 1. "Why do you think the Internet should be free?" 2. After explaining that I've stayed at many lesser priced hotels that all had free Internet, usually WiFi, he said "Well if you stay at a Motel 6, they give you free Internet to get you to stay there." I've never stayed at a Motel 6 that was his assumption. After arguing with him for a while and telling him that if he doesn't wave what would amount to $30 for Internet use during my stay, I was checking out immediately and never coming back. His reply was "well, I hate to put you out at 11:30 at night, is there anything else I can do for you? I replied "yes, you can let me use the Internet without charging me. His response was "I'm not WILLING to do that." I quickly found a very lovely Holiday Inn Express on Palm Pkwy. in Lake Buena Vista for $85 per night offering free WiFi, free breakfast, very lovely, clean rooms and helpful management. A few days later while investigating who at Disney I can report my horrible experience to, I found that the Boardwalk Hotel has free WiFi in the lobby and they have a business center. At NO TIME did anyone tell me that.

Reviews.Title: “Studio Room”
Reviews.Author: ScubaCF
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Boardwalk Villas in June 2009. We booked a standard studio room. When we arrived it was raining so we just did the valet parking. Check in was fast and our room was ready. We were on a high floor facing the Luna Park Pool. The pool was open to midnight, so it was a bit noisy until midnight. We also had a view of Hollywood Studios. Our room was in the building with the Boardwalk Villas side and the walk from the elevator was long. The room itself was nice. It could sleep two adults and two small children. The only problem is that we had a connecting door to the one-bedroom condo (I think) and when they came in at 2 a.m. they woke us the first night. They supply paper plates and bowls along with plastic silverware. Small refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker dish towel and dish soap. We were only eating breakfast in the room and going out to dinner so we did not need to cook. Nice big vanity area, bathroom was kind of on the small side. Little foyer in the entrance (which was great for leaving your keys and such), closet next to the vanity, long but narrow. The room is starting to show its age a little, but that is okay because we like the convenience of staying at one of the Disney Resorts. No DVD player in the studios and the TV was old. Bed was comfortable and so was the sofa to sit and read on or watch TV. Cute little balcony, we watched the people below while were enjoying a couple of glasses of wine. There was a list of prices for extra things and I was a little confused about it, maybe it was for people that are DVC owners or people staying longer, but there were some extra charges such as extra cleaning, towels and such. We had our room cleaned during our stay and new towels (which we did not ask for) and no extra charge. Internet is extra for non DVC members (which we are not). Now to the resort! We took the shuttle boat over to Hollywood Studios and enjoyed the ride (we have stayed at the Dolphin and Swan and love the boat ride to Epcot and HS). Transportation to the other parks was by bus, which we did not do so I can not comment on them. We ate at Spoodles and Flying Fish CafÃ©; I highly recommend both of them (make sure to make your reservations). There is a small general store on the boardwalk where you can purchase things for the villa. We stopped into the Belle Vue Lounge for drinks before dinner one night, cute little bar. Since we were staying at the Boardwalk Villas for the first time, we decided to go spend the night at Jellyrolls and Atlantic Dance. Jellyrolls have a cover, but Atlantic Dance is free. We had a blast at both places. As for the pool, we never got to use it because by the time we got back from HS it was raining, but it looks like fun. There is a quiet pool around the corner from the activity center. Next time we are going to rent bikes. We just really enjoyed the old Atlantic City feeling of the boardwalk with games, yummy desserts and nightly entertainment. Donâ€™t forget that the ESPN zone is there for watching your sports (we did that during the playoffs in January, but get there early for football games so you can get a table around the bar area). We also did the character breakfast dining at the Cape May which was great. Minnie, Donald and Goofy were dressed in old fashion bathing suits.

Reviews.Title: “Just so cool...”
Reviews.Author: RotherRiz
Reviews.Content: We all loved the Boardwalk Villas, we had a room overlooking the main themed pool area which was very lively but adds to the excitement of being in the middle of all sorts. We ate at all the food establishments along the Boardwalk, none were below par neither was the mini golf which was just a five minute walk away. We got to see the fireworks from Epcot every night and enjoyed a few chill out and watch the world go by seesions on the beach on the opposite side of the lake. My kids particularly enjoyed the nightly entertainment on the Boardwalk, which encouraged them to go out on an evening rather than staying in the pool which they loved! Overall a great place (not too quiet) but exciting enough for young children with comfy clean rooms and a good chioce of eating venues. My 10 year old andI really loved the chicken tenders from the kiosk on the boardwalk and oh what would I give for a Key Lime Pie from the bakery right now...yummeeeee!

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed....”
Reviews.Author: 88Love2Travel
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 1-BR suite through Interval. All Disney resorts charge a $95 fee for guest services - transportation to/from airport, meal reservation, etc. Would be a good deal just for the bus and baggage service to/from airport to hotel. Unfortunately, this service is only available on the days you check in and out of the resort which didn't work for us since we were visiting relatives out of town, a day before and after our stay, and if you call at least 3 days in advance for them to mail your tags. We arrived at the hotel close to noon and made it to our room after 2 hours wait. The bedroom (with walk-in closet) was average size, kitchen tight and bathroom was pretty spacious (but dated). We walked through the restaurants around the Boardwalk but found them uninteresting and overpriced. We settled in the nearby Westin's Swan Hotel $31 seafood buffet (they had crab legs which was well worth it and service was great!). Maid service came in mid-week to remove trash and nothing else. Found this location to be convenient with more travel options to Disney parks. Considering this was our first Disney resort visit, I would say that this resort is overrated. (Also had family staying at Old Key West Resort and have the same opinion.)

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MYreview_9
Reviews.Content: It was the best trip we have ever done.I had sooo much fun,we were in a three bedroom, with a huge bathtub, tons of space, and the pool was awesome.I've never had more fun!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Vacation Club: First use and nice stay”
Reviews.Author: drbryguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed over 3 day weekend Feb 27 through Mar 1st, 2009 with a 4 year old and spouse. First use of Disney Vacation Club, so unknown hotel cost, but we compared price value versus point usage and this was the second-best value (best value was full). We stayed on the main floor but never heard any foot traffic and had balcony view of the pool; Studio sized room. We were very busy with the parks and didn't spend all that much time with the room. The room seemed a little bit old fashioned but the only problem that we noticed was that the main sink didn't drain very fast. The shower, bathroom, hair dryer, fridge, alarm clock and TV worked fine. The room was decently lit, and was clean. They had a small grocery store on site so we didn't have to worry about getting non-restaurant type food. The resort buses were timely (we had heard of problems on web sites but didn't see any) to the parks. It got too cold for use to use the pool. Note the pool opens at 10:00 am and check out is 11:00 am with no extensions. We went to Spoodles (on site restaurant) for dinner one night and breakfast one morning and it was enjoyable. All of the staff were very very pleasant. The only staff shortage that we noticed was when we were the first one in line for the concierge desk one morning and a long line started behind us, and we only saw one person to help all of these people. The hotel is nice in that it is in walking distance (5 minutes) to the back entrance to Epcot and we were able to make use of a morning magic hour and an evening of magic hours. We also walked across to the Yacht and Beach Club for breakfast with Goofy, Donald and Minnie (we had to book this many weeks in advance though) one morning (also a 5 minute walk). Regarding the Disney World park itself: I cannot imagine anybody staying here without planning on going to one of the Disney World Parks and not take advantage of their (especially morning) magic hours; this place as well as the other Disney hotels aren't good stand-alone places due to the overall cost of things here (which are high). We were very surprised how busy it was at Disney World this late Feb weekend; apparently it was an ESPN weekend but compared to other weekends at this time of year (when we have been here) it was very busy. No evidence of a recession here!

Reviews.Title: “Service Not Consistent with Price”
Reviews.Author: gregoryd38
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom villa, and primarily chose this property because of its location. The rack rate for our room was approximately $600 per night, though we actually paid less by using points rented from a DVC member. At those prices, we expected the room to be spacious, clean, and comfortable, the amenities to be plenty, and the service to be top-notch. Unfortunately, only some of these expectations were met. First the positive: The property itself was quite nice, with the boardwalk being even more entertaining that we expected. The location was ideal, a very short walk from Epcot, and a short boat ride from Hollywood Studios. Boats seemed to be available quite frequently, and we never waited more than 5 minutes for a vessel to arrive. The room was spacious and quite comfortable, and the amenities provided in the room were as advertised. Now the not so positive: Overall, the service at the hotel was awful, and it was't until we decided to stop relying on hotel staff for any support that we began to truly enjoy our visit. Some examples: upon arrival, we pulled into the valet area to unload luggage and check-in. Though there were several bellmen available, none seemed interested in providing any assistance, despite our numerous attempts to request some help. After approximately 10 minutes, one finally offered to assist, but only after we had fully unloaded our belongings onto the curb. Check-in was quick and easy, but when we arrived in our room (at approximately 4:30 PM, well after the designated check-in time), we discovered that it had not been cleaned. The prior guests' food, soiled linens, and other trash littered the room. We immediately contacted the front desk to inform them of the problem. Astonishingly, the response was that no other rooms were available, and that housekeeping would get to it when they could. After approximately 30 minutes, someone from housekeeping arrived, armed only with a document noting that the problem was not the fault of the housekeeping staff, but of a front-desk error. That person then left without cleaning the room. A few minutes later, a bellman arrived with our bags, and thankfully he too was appalled by the condition of the room, unloaded our bags into a closet so that they would be out of the way, and immediately contacted housekeeping to rectify the problem. Approximately one hour after being notified of the problem, housekeeping staff finally arrived to clean the room. Later that same evening, we asked the concierge for directions to the nearest grocery store. The concierge was initially unable to provide any directions at all. A second staff member attempted to provide directions downloaded from Google, and handed me a printout directing me to a grocery store more than 20 miles away in downtown Orlando. Ultimately, another guest was kind enough to provide directions to a grocery store only 3 miles from the hotel. But hotel staff never did provide any helpful assistance. Upon returning from the grocery store, we again pulled into the valet area to unload groceries, seeking assistance from the bell staff. Unfortunately, we we unable to locate anyone to help. After parking in the guest lot and carrying the groceries into the hotel, we noted that no fewer than 4 bellmen were socializing near the fireplace, with none outside to provide assistance to guests. At that point, we made the decision not to rely on hotel staff for anything further. And the remainder of the trip was quite enjoyable. Because of the location, we would probably stay here again, but the level of service provided by this hotel is woefully inadequate, particularly when considering the fact that the rack rate for our room was $600 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Loacation - Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: faarias
Reviews.Content: When staying at Disney you ar epaying for the location and name; I would neevr stay here if not traveling with family and small children. Very convenient location to Epcot and Disney Studios. We had a two bedroom suite as well as another stuido room and it was very comfortable and mconvenient. Room decor does need a little bit o updating, especillay for the exhorbitant prices you pay at Disney. Would prefer not to return but probably will becasue of family. We did the Deluxe Dining Package and it was great, lots of great food and very easy and convenient to use. Parking is terrible and had t use valet all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFlorida40
Reviews.Content: Walked into the first room and it smelled so bad we had to walk out and request another room. Front Desk was very helpful. Second room was OK but started smelling after the night was over, had to open the french doors to get some air inside, some of the wallpaper was peeling off in the bathroom and there was mold growing behind the wallpaper. Cleanliness of room left a lot to be desired, hair in the shower, trash left in the trash can. Coffee spilled over the desk and not wiped up, huge damp coffee stain on the carpet. Got a 3rd room that was OK for our final night. Sent letters to Hotel notifying them of the problems but no response !!

Reviews.Title: “Great View! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover429
Reviews.Content: Got a one bedroom villa during 12/15/07-12/22/07. Walking distance to Epcot or you could take the boat ride. Could look from bacolny every night and watch the fireworks without having to sit and wait and then try to fight the crowds back to the hotel. Great entertainment with street preformers. Great restruants right there. Spoodles for dinner and the Boardwalk bakery for lunch or breakfast! They have a great candy shop and gift shops as well. Got a great massage at Muscles and Buscles. Nice size room, and big master bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, average service”
Reviews.Author: nyc1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom for three nights in January. The room was clean and spacious. The beds were firm and comfortable, even the sofa bed was much better than your average household sofa bed. However, the staff weren't as helpful as we had expected. The front desk staff we talked too were cold and robotic; they answered our questions as if they were reciting passages from a textbook. Most importantly, when asked about transpotation to and from the different parks, they failed to tell us that we may have limited options if we leave the parks around 9pm, which is the standard closing time for Epcot. The bus instructions at Epcot directed us to take the bus to Universal Studio and then switch to a ferry boat to get back to Boardwalk Villa. However, when we got to Universal Studio, the whole place was dead and the boat had stopped running long ago (Universal Studio closes an hour earlier, at 8pm). Thankfully we talked to the bus driver before we got off the bus at Universal Studio and the bus driver offered to take us to Boardwalk. If we had got off the bus without asking, we would be left at an empty parking lot in the middle of the night. I would expect that the staff at a Disney property would warn the guests about these things.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: julitita
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members and stayed in a two bedroom for Thanksgiving. What a treat for myself, hubby, teenager and tweenager. Loved the pool, the ability to walk to Hollywood Studios and Epcot. The service and rooms were great. Miguel at the Concierge desk was so helpful. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beachgirls77
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members and recently stayed at the Boardwalk Villas for the second time. We have 3 daughters ages 12, 8 and 3. Though we own at the Beach Club and Saratoga, the Beach Club wasn't available and we wanted to be in walking distance to plenty of things as we weren't renting a car for the first time. We chose the Boardwalk because of its close proximity to EPCOT and MGM. We like to be able to walk to MGM and EPCOT. The Boardwalk is just a short stroll from these parks, or there is a boat and of course, the bus. We also like the entertainment on the Boardwalk at night. We are not early-to-bedders, so we enjoy doing something after catching the fireworks shows or Fantasmic, etc. The Boardwalk always has something going on - a magician, jugglers, a man playing the piano - not to mention the bicycle rentals or carnival type games. It is always nice to grab an ice cream cone and sit and people watch. There are several restaurants on the Boardwalk. We have tried Spoodles (even the pizza window is great) and the ESPN Zone. The candy shoppe is great for the kids and the bakery has quick breakfast items. We have heard that the toehr restaurants are great. We stayed in a 1 bedroom villa. It was spacious and clean. It may soon be time to begin to remodel a bit, but really, the rooms are beautiful, comfortable and have all the amenities of a "home away from home." The only problem we encountered is a problem with the toilet ... apparently, the family before us must have left something in the toilet and flushed it down so on our first day there, we had to call maintenance to come fix it. We had left to go out but when we came back, it was fixed. I have to say, the housekeeping staff is awesome. We stayed at the Boardwalk Villas for 2 nights, left for the Disney Cruise and then came back to the Boardwalk for 3 nights. During the first stay, our daughter left a stuffed dog in the room. I called lost and found from the Disney Cruise and they told me they had found it and would leave it for us to pick up when we returned. Sure enough, it was waiting for us. The property, like any other Disney property, is well maintained, clean and beautiful. The desk personnel were extremely nice and knowledgeable. The bell service men are prompt and courteous. What can I say ... we will, of course, return again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Bruvofetc
Reviews.Content: We had a studio room overlooking the Boardwalk. This gave us a great view of the Boardwalk and also the fireworks at EPCOT and the Magic Kingdom. Wonderfully comfortable beds and a balcony big enough to party on! However, there were a couple of "downers" on our visit. Firstly, it was a long walk to get a drink for your re-fillable mug. This had to be done at the bar, by a barman who was obviously "miffed" at having to fill up the mugs. This sort of knocked the normal relaxed feeling of filling your mugs as and when you wanted to. More importantly, although the beds were very comfortable, we had a very interrupted night with the noise from the Boardwalk. People leaving the clubs in the early hours of the morning, talking , shouting and yelping to each other. The rooms didn't appear to have much noise insulation to to outside world. Maybe we should have chosen a view overlooking the back of the hotel but this would have defeated the object of us wanting a preferred view of the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk was a hit”
Reviews.Author: gigibug
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at WDW. Our group spent half of our stay at the Pop Century and half at the Boardwalk Villas. We liked having a variety and Disney made the transition between resorts very smooth and easy. We just dropped bags off at the Pop luggage desk in the morning and they were waiting for us at the Boardwalk Villas later in the afternoon when we returned from the parks. We booked the Boardwalk Villa rooms through a Disney Vacation Club owner, which saved us a ton of money (cost less than half of booking directly with Disney). For more info on how to do this, check the DVC forums. Overall, our experience at the Boardwalk Villas was very positive. The grounds and lobby were beautiful. Service at the check-in desk and bell services was outstanding. I would highly recommend requesting a room on the upper floors as close as possible to the elevators to reduce noise and walking. Those hallways are long! Our room was very nice and clean. We had a studio with a queen bed and a pullout sofa, which was fine for out two young kids. Being able to walk or take a boat to Epcot and Hollywood Studios was a huge plus and basically our main reason for choosing the Boardwalk. The boat ride is nice and relaxing vs. taking a bus. One downside I should mention was that after staying at the Pop Century, which had a food court, we found the food selections at the Boardwalk to be inconvenient and overpriced. I didn't think this would be such an issue, but it was. In hindsight, I wished we would have stayed at the Beach Club Villas across the lake for this reason alone as it has a food court. We don't like to have to make dining reservations or plan our days around eating, so the convenience of a food court was something we missed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Nostalgic”
Reviews.Author: mexico15
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in October 2008 at the Boardwalk Villas. Having stayed previously at the Beach Club Villas, Saratoga Springs Resort and a number of other Disney properties , I can say that we were again pleased with Disney service. The accomodations, while not the newest of the Disney Vacation Club properties, were clean and pristine. We stayed in a studio unit which was more than enough for 2 adults and one child. The proximity to the Boardwalk for night time strolls and the parks for daytime fun was ideal. There are numerous restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, though only a lounge inside the hotel. This was not a problem as the one night of bad rains prompted an order from room service. The delivery was prompt and the food delicious. The kid's pool was a big hit and the adult pool with the roller coaster waterslide was outstanding. We have no complaints and cannot wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “not very clean”
Reviews.Author: WeezeBreeze
Reviews.Content: We were terribly dissappointed in the Boardwalk Villas. The rooms we had were good and very well thought out; but the outer halls to get to them were horribly dirty. There were live and dead bugs, food(smashed cookies) and garbage out there! Nothing was picked up or vacumed until the fourth day of our stay. Even though we called the front desk to report this mess and asked for an exterminator, no one ever showed up. It truly took away from the fun of being at Disney World because we had to see this every single day we were going back and forth to our rooms. Eventually we received help from two employees at the front desk named Mike and Ryan. They were very kind,considerate, and knew their jobs well. There was also an employee in one of the shops named Inger, who went out of her way to help us with various questions we had, since there was no information guide in our room. These 3 employees were exceptional and helped us enjoy the rest of our stay. Our hot tub was fantastic and the pool area with the slide was wonderful. We never found the other two pools that were advertised on your website, although we looked ! We feel that $349.00 per night was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Boardwalk Villas”
Reviews.Author: EastTexan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a third floor 1-bedroom at Boardwalk Villas right after the school year started back up. The room was very nice, plenty large, extremely clean and well-kept, had a large bathroom with oversized shower plus a separate room with vanity and hot tub. There was also a wall safe (very small), a washer-dryer, large closet, nice kitchen area, living area, and a patio balcony with entrances to the bedroom and livingroom. The view of the pool was nice, and sitting on the balcony was peaceful, but I would suggest a view of the boardwalk instead. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Service was excellent. On the downside, self-parking is quite a ways from the hotel. They should provide close temp parking for checkin. We got lost trying to find our way back to the lobby (the hotel winds all directions and hallways are long and not very well marked). There are very good restaurants on the boardwalk, but none exist inside the actual hotel, although you can get room service or fix your own food in your kitchen. My only complaint was that the Disney customer service line balked at giving us the hotel lobby phone number; it would be wise to get it when you check in. My most positive comment on this hotel is location. There is a riverboat to Hollywood Studios (or a long walk), a bus to Disneyworld, the monorail between parks, and the boardwalk, outside, so we never had to drive anywhere. (although they need to post a schedule of how often and how late these transports run.) Overall, we had a great stay and will stay here again if we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk Villa Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: colfax74
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying 7 nights at the Boardwalk Villa. I was there with my wife and two sons, 3 years old and 10 months. My parents also came. Basically it was two joining rooms. 1 room was larger than the other. The larger room had a whirlpool, washer dryer, king size bed, full kitchen and livingroom with a pullout sofa bed. The other room had a queen bed, with a sofa bed and a small refrigerator and an area to wash dishes. A huge savings was to have food delivered to the hotel prior to our arrival. We did not do any cooking, however just to have snacks for the kids, muffins, donuts, PBJ, yogurt, cheerios, etc.. was great. Since we had to play things by ear due to naps it was great to have nosh in the room. Plus we also ordered bottled water, canned soda, milk, etc.. We also packed snacks, PBJ in a backpack for the parks. You will really be suprised how much $ you can save on just eating out once per day vs. three times. My wife and I ended up under budget on our stay because of this. They delivered the food to the hotel prior to me checking in. I placed the order online about 4 days prior to leaving for Disney. They recommend you do it ASAP. I ordered from gardengrocer.com. Bell services received the food and kept it in a refigerator until we checked in, that was a GREAT service. To know we had a stocked kitchen when checking in was awesome. We were able to check in early too which was nice. The check-in was painless, your room key also held your entry to the parks. You can also charge things using your room key if you set that up at check in with a credit card. The pool at the Boardwalk was okay. My 3 year old could not go on the slide as the slide warns that its for advanced swimmers. The Yacht Club looked like it had a nicer pool. The leaping horse libations /cabana located next to the pool was nice. For under $5 you can get a PBJ sandwich, carrots, and apple sauce. The location of the hotel was great. 7 min walk to Epcot or 1 stop on the ferry. Disney's Hollywood Studios (formerly MGM) is about a 20 min ferry ride. Animal Kingdom, Magic Kingdom and Downtown Disney all about 20-25 min bus ride. Bus pick up is in front of the hotel. Walking path to Epcot and/or Hollywood Studios is in the back of the hotel off the boardwalk. The boardwalk itself was very nice. There were a lot of street performers at night, and it was really lit up a night, very festive. I ate at ESPN CLUB which had the most moderately priced menu. Average entree was anywhere $13-$16. Also ate at the Big River which was a little more expensive than ESPN. Food was okay, nice beer selection as it makes all its own beer. Spoodles and Flying Fish Cafe required reservations. However after 9pm you might be able to get in. Flying Fish had a very expensive menu. Jelly Rolls which is a dueling piano bar has a $10 cover and has drinks only. The dance hall which is a music club has no cover but I did not go there. If your planning to eat anywhere at Epcot or if you plan any character meals make your reservations ASAP. I called the dining hotline and just about . every restaurant and character dinner was booked. I was able to get on a waiting list for Germany. One of the best services that the Boardwalk offers is the airline/luggage check in. That was fantastic. We didn't have to worry about bags or anything. The magical express bus picked us up, we went right to security once at Orlando airport. The staff were frendly, the rooms were spacious, clean, and the staff were very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: AldoPignotti
Reviews.Content: We're in the Disney Vacation Club and have stayed at the Boardwalk eight times now. We get a 2 bedroom suite and we love everything about it. We like to cook our own breakfasts and having a washer dryer is great. You can really travel light. The suite itself is very large, clean and comfortable. The biggest problem we've had in eight stays is that once the carpet was still damp from being steamed cleaned right before we got there. We've ordered groceries through Disney and they have always been delivered right on time. The location is perfect, you can walk to the MGM Studios and Epcot or take a boat. Ask for a water view facing Epcot. When my kids we're younger, we would watch the fireworks from Epcot from our balcony. There's a very nice pool with a water slide and a little wading pool for toddlers. The boardwalk is pleasantly busy but we've never had any trouble with noise. A perfect place to stay at the Happiest Place on Earth!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Boardwalk Villas!”
Reviews.Author: badgerfan07
Reviews.Content: We are Disney Vacation Club members. We have been going to Disney's Boardwalk Villas for the past 4 years. We go every year and continue to love this resort and location. The pool is great. Our daughter (8), LOVES the slide. Yes - the clown theme is scary - but the slide is great. :) The villa rooms are always clean and nice. We book 11 months out so we can get a Boardwalk View studio room. We LOVE the view. However, I will admit, at 2am - there can be some noise from the bars letting out - so if you are a light sleeper - that may not be great. Evening entertainment on the boardwalk is always fun. Check in at the villas is usually slow. Not sure why... staff is usually nice. Restaurants in this area are great - but counter service can be limited. Morning coffee is hard to find before 6:30am. Super convenient to both Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios. Can walk to both - but there is also a nice boat ride. Bus service to the other parks can be slow - with several stops at Beach Club, Yacht Club, Swan and Dolphin - but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rvstauff
Reviews.Content: We exchanged our timeshare to get into BoardWalk Villas. Never thought it could happen. Only hitch was we have a 2 bedroom and had to down grade to a 1 bedroom. We have 10 and 7 year olds. They did just fine on the Queen size pull out couch in living room. The bedroom was large and the bathroom was huge and well set-up for a family. Balcony was very nice with entry off living room and bedroom. Staff was nice and friendly. Kids loved the pool. Boardwalk area is fun. Easy walk to Epcot or you can take a boat and boat ride to Hollywood Studios is nice. All other areas are via bus, so allow at least 30 min. for each stop you will need to make. Location was great. We used alot of transportation at Swan and Dolphin due to where our room was and the routes the buses took. Would love to stay here, again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Boardwalk Villas”
Reviews.Author: casey34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Villas over the July 4th weekend. I can't think of anything negative to say about the villas. We were on the 4th floor facing the "quiet pool" which was very nice. The pool on the other side has a 200 foot waterslide where you come out of the clown's mouth and is a big hit with the kids as well as adults. Our room was a little far from the elevator but not too bad the elevators always ran smooth and usually never a long wait. The rooms were the cleanest I have ever stayed in. We had a washer/dryer, kitchen which furnished all appliances and dishes, utensils, dishsoap, papertowels. The beds were awesome - the kids loved the fold out sleeper in the living area. If you stay 7 or less nights you get maid service on the 3rd day of your stay but that only consist of trash removal, clean towels, and replenishing soap, coffee etc... You can always ask for more towels or whatever you need and they gladly give them to you. Also you can request your room to have a full cleaning but they charge for it. Staff was always friendly and ready to assist you with your needs. They have a community center for the kids next to the quiet pool which is a big hit especially on rainy days. The boardwalk always has a lot going on - a lot of fun. The ESPN restaurant was great - compares with cost of an Applebee's or Fridays. Going to Disney we knew it wouldn't be cheap and it wasn't. Some value places we found to eat were right on the boardwalk with the little stands set up. Chicken fingers and chicken sandwich meals were $7.00 and the kids loved it. Also if you go to the General Store things are a lot higher than a Krogers - we bought our pop, juice, and beer at a gas station in walking distance called Hess and they have the same prices as we pay at home. Also another plus was you could take your own drinks down to the pool area. The parks are nice but expect the long lines and hot humid days during summer. The fast pass is great -you put your ticket in a machine and it tells you when to come back without having to wait in the long line, but you can't use it again until you ride that ride. We had a great time and when we ever do make it back we will stay at the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk Villas were okay.”
Reviews.Author: angiemarie1978
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Boardwalk Inn for our honeymoon in 2004 we decided to try the Boardwalk Villas. Last year we used points from a Disney Vacation Club Member and stayed at the Beach Club (which we loved). The location is wonderful and Disney staff is pleasant, as always. The only thing I can say that is a negative is that the rooms need to be updated. We had a one bedroom suite for the first couple of nights as that was the only room available (even though we booked 5 months in advance). The bathroom was not as nice as I had hoped. The tile in the shower was actually kindof gross. I just didn't feel that the rooms were really clean and wouldn't walk around barefoot. The utensils in the kitchen were not thoroughly cleaned - there was food stuck to the forks. Good thing I bought plastic utensils for our trip. After the first two nights we checked into a studio. It seemed cleaner but the toilet was wobbly, wallpaper was coming off and the light in the bathroom was very dim. I had stayed at the Contemporary back in April for a girls' weekend and actually felt it was very clean compared to the BWV. I don't think I would stay at the BWVs again until they update. However, when my husband and I stayed at the Boardwalk Inn we really liked it and felt that it was clean. But that could be because at the Inn there is housekeeping on a daily basis where the Villas see many families with little kids and only get maid service on the 4th and 8th day of their stay. Otherwise, our stay was great. The pool is a lot of fun. It's an easy walk to Epcot where we like to eat dinner most nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort & Location!”
Reviews.Author: seanrColorado
Reviews.Content: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our Disney Vacation (June 1 - 8) at Disney's Boardwalk Villas. 1) The location of the Boardwalk Villas can't be beat! It is literally a 5 - 7 minute walk to Epcot. It's close proximatey to many quality resturants including Spoodles, Flying Fish and the Boardwalk Bakery (for Quick service meals) is very convenient. 2) The pool was a big hit with our daughters! It has a "roller coaster" like slide where you slide out a clown's mouth. It is fast and fun for kids and adults alike. 3) The rooms are in pretty good shape. You can tell that they are a little worn. It would be nice if Disney replaced the carpets and put flat screens in the room. 4) We used Disney transportation including the Magical Express (to and from the airport) and were very impressed! I am not sure why anyone would want to rent a car or pay $100+ tip for a town car service when Disney's Magical Express is free. You are paying more than enough for a Disney Vacation. When Disney provides a complimentary service I think you should take advantage of it. 5) My family and I were on the Basic Disney Dining Plan and we enjoyed it very much. After totaling up the cost of what we would have paid (if we were not on the Disney Dining Plan) we saved more than $400 for the week. It is a good value even though the tip is not included in the plan as it was in 2007. The Basic Plan is more than enough food. I do not understand how any family could possibly eat the food on the Deluxe Dining Plan (unless your only goal of going to Disney was to eat). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: JF4
Reviews.Content: A studio at the Boardwalk Villas was the only room left when my procrastinator husband decided to make reservations a week before spring break. This would not have been our first choice otherwise. This review is intended for those seeking to compare a Boardwalk Villa studio to other properties, either on or off WDW grounds. Studios do not have full kitchens (but do have a kitchenette), DVD players (I'd missed that detail, so I'd brought DVD's for my son but had nothing to watch them on), nor washer/dryers (although there is a free laundry room on the first floor, which I'd discovered on our last day - you only pay for the detergent). I believe all the above are included in 1-bedroom and larger units (we wanted a 1-bedroom, but none were available). Our room overlooked the Luna Pool. At first I thought this would be too noisy, but it turned out okay. It's only noisy during the day when you're up anyway. It's quiet at night when nobody's in the pool. We were able to see the fireworks our first night. This was our first time staying on a Disney property, so I cannot compare it to other DVC resorts. My first impression upon arrival was how lovely the resort is. The lobby area is nice, and the whole boardwalk area has a great vibe. However, when I entered the room, all I could think about was how dated and worn it was. Although the paint seemed fairly fresh, and the carpet was newly cleaned, the drapes and old-fashioned bedspread (germ factory) need updating. The bathroom is poorly lit, and has that irritating fan that goes on automatically when the light is turned on (so you can't leave the light on all night as a nightlight due to the noise). The person who cleaned our room never wiped down the bathroom sink properly as the faucet had toothpaste spray from the last guest (I had to wipe it down), and the little whiskers my husband shook out of his razor from his morning shave remained there the duration of our stay. That left me to wonder what else in the room hadn't been cleaned. As we are not DVC members, our room was "cleaned" each day, with fresh towels, bed made, and coffee and cups replaced. We called engineering about two maintenance problems (broken cabinet door, plugged up bathroom sink), which were both fixed in a timely manner. What I liked: -Location. Easy walk to Epcot. We also walked to Hollywood Studios, which was very pleasant. We took the boat back from Hollywood Studios, which made several stops first (Swan, Dolphin, Yacht and Beach Clubs), so keep that in mind if you're in a hurry. Boardwalk is great. -Pool. Theme parks? What theme parks? My son was content to go down that spiral slide all day long. -Towels. Nice and fluffy, unlike the worn sheets. -Fold out couch. Actually more comfortable than the bed. Amazing. -The convenience of staying on-site, such as the Extra Magic Hours and the free parking (we drove to Animal Kingdom). -Disney-style service and friendliness (other than our housekeeper who couldn't clean a sink). What I didn't like: -The aforementioned datedness of decor. -The aforementioned iffiness on the cleanliness. -The morning bus to the Magic Kingdom made several stops before getting there, and was standing room only. When you're trying to take advantage of Morning Extra Magic Hours, maybe they could run the shuttles more efficiently. -Not sure if it's worth it. We paid rack rate which is a LOT. Maybe it's worth it if you're on points, or if it's not high season. The rooms at the Boardwalk are "just okay". If you're not paying much, the location might make them worth it. But if you're paying full price, you would expect a higher level of luxury and cleanliness than you get here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: melmabelle
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our vacation to the Boardwalk Villas. I have to say the best thing about the Boardwalk was the location! It is a great area to be in, near the Yacht and Beach Club hotel, as well as walking distance or a short boat ride to both MGM and Epcot. We walked into Epcot just for a lunch a couple times because it was so close! I was a little disappointed with our room as I didn't think the beds were that comfortable or made up well and there were a few spots that could have used a repainting. For the amount of money they charge, I expected to be in a cushy bed with a nice comforter and to not have anything be messy with the room. But overall, it was a good size room and had a nice balcony with a nice view.

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love The Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: MOJOSETI
Reviews.Content: My husband & I lived in Florida for several years & started to make Disney our annual trip. We stayed at the Boardwalk for 2 wedding anniversaries in 2004 & 2005. My husband mentioned when we booked the room that we were staying at the hotel for our anniversary & the Disney staff went out of their way to make us feel special. We were greeted in our room by balloons & a card wishing us a happy anniversary. We loved it! The hotel is gorgeous & truly makes you feel like you are at the boardwalk. There are many restaurants, stores, & clubs lining the boardwalk. We would head down to the boardwalk in the morning to eat breakfast either at Spoodles (great breakfast) or we would just grab a fresh pastry at the bakery. My favorite part about the location is that you can walk to Epcot in about 5 minutes and you can even watch "illuminations" from the bridge without even entering the park. I love going through this entrance because only hotel guests on that side seem to use it so it's like having your own private entrance to the park. I highly recommend this hotel for those who are looking to have a nice vacation at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay with Kids”
Reviews.Author: criancadodeus
Reviews.Content: A terrific place to stay with kids. We have been there several times over the years. In fact, when my sons went to college that was the first trip they took. DisneyWorld. It has to be their favorite spot on earth for them. The park is clean and the hotels are too. The hardest part is to find food, so make reservations a day in advance if you want to go at a normal family time. I have stayed in most of the Disney World hotels and the Boardwalk is one of the most fun. Great restaurants near by, magic shows at night. and best of all, you can get around very, easily.

Reviews.Title: “DVC villas are amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Maslowski
Reviews.Content: We became Disney Vacation Club members in 2005 after staying at the Old Key West Resort. We have now stayed in all WDW DVC resorts except for Animal Kingdom Villas. By far our favorite is the Boardwalk Villas Resort. The atmosphere can't be beat and the rooms are always clean and comfortable. The boardwalk itself is alive with turn - of - the - century- type performers when night falls, from jugglers to magicians to a piano plying trike rider. Great places to eat and so close to Epcot. This is a great experience that must be enjoyed at least once during a visit to the Magic Kingdom. It feel's like Walt designed it himself!

Reviews.Title: “Good Time - One Problem”
Reviews.Author: Jeorgieboy
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in a one bedroom unit the second week of January. There was one sanitary problem in the bathroom which was taken care of after 2 phone calls. I would have rather had it taken care of the first time I called, but there seemed to be a computer problem and the housekeeper did not get the message. Disney reimbursed us for our trouble. Would have preferred not having the problem. We love the Boardwalk Villas. So close to Epcot and lots of places to visit close by. We had a boardwalk view room which was noisy until late evening (or should I say early morning) with conventioneers post club hopping. Could be a problem with young children. We prefer the quieter clown pool view. The villa was neat and clean (except for the bathroom floor). Plenty of room for four adults. My adult daughter slept on the sofa bed and thought it was pretty comfortable. TV is limited, not many choices to pick from. The weather was colder than we thought it would be, but Florida winter is better than NY winter any day. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too Much Fun at BoardWalk Villas!!!”
Reviews.Author: Longmeadow
Reviews.Content: We rented points from a DVC member - best "budget" tip I ever learned! For 5 fabulous nights we stayed in a 1-bedroom standard view suite. We overlooked the front entrance (opposite side of the boardwalk) but heard very little noise. We were ~5 rooms away from the fastest elevators - longest wait was 15 seconds - no kidding! Other reviews I read described the floral decor as dated and although it was not my taste it wasn't annoying. The kitchen was equipped with everything - stove, microwave, fridge with freezer, dishwasher, toaster and the all imporant coffee maker. Dishes, mugs, silverware is also included right down to dish soap and fresh sponge. But remember to bring basket type (not cone) filters unless you want to use a paper towel. We had groceries delivered from Garden Grocer (excellent selection and service!) which made for easy breakfasts in the room. There is also a loud washer and dryer in the room. The pull-out sofa was cleverly designed with the attached cushions stashed under the very comfy queen-sized bed - no complaints from our well-rested kids. A TV with DVD/VCR player, table, breakfast nook, 4 dining chairs & 1 reading chair completed the room. The master bedroom had a wonderful king-sized bed, reading chair and TV in armoire/dresser combo. Each room had its own balcony with 2 chairs and table. The bathroom was split into 2 spaces with a sink in each. The master bath had a wirlpool tub while the other had a steam shower and toilet. We had plenty of fluffy towels (the good ones!) and did not mind that we only had towel and trash service on the 4th day of our stay. The lobby is decorated beautifuly with lots of whimsical touches. A large round banquette topped with a carousel and the flying horses chandelier were my favorites. Check-in was quick with no wait. The staff could not have been nicer - especially bell services. Every area was clean and sparkling - kudos to housekeeping. The pool was being renovated and we had the option of using the Beach/Yatch clubs' pool but it was too cold for swimming during our stay. Activities on the boardwalk are numerous and we were disappointed we did not have more time to enjoy them - especially the night-time street performers who drew large crowds despite cool weather. We did rent a surrey bike and had a blast pedaling our kids around. The ESPN club was packed on Sunday and looked like a great place to watch a game. Our son loved the arcade attached to the club as well as the arcade next to the fantastic gym - muscles and bustles. Don't miss out on the fantastic bakery - worth the extra time on the stairmaster! I am still savoring their cheesecake brownie - beyond delicious. The shops were nice with very pleasant clerks. We wished we had time to try the Big River Grill & Brew Works. The BoardWalk is located between Epcot and Disney Hollywood Studios (still MGM to me!) Both are an easy 10-15 minute walk - note there is no bus service from the BoardWalk to these parks. There is a boat that runs between the parks but it also stops at the Swan and Beach/Yatch Clubs. So unless the boat is at the dock it is usually faster to walk to and from MGM (or get off at the Swan and walk over the bridge which joins the Swan & Dolphin to the boardwalk area.) The boat goes directly to & from BoardWalk and Epcot but again it is faster to walk unless the boat is at the dock. The buses from Downtown Disney, Animal and Magic Kingdoms also make numerous stops and we found it faster to get off at the Swan (usually the 1st stop) and then walk over the bridge. Despite the chilly nights January is a wonderful time to visit WDW - low crowds meant very few lines and easy navigation through the parks. We found the Unofficial Guide to be a great resource and their crowd level calendar ([-]) was right on. Definitely buy the book for more information you will ever need and for the touring plans - big time savers. Although we just returned yesterday we are already planning our next trip back to the BoardWalk - 6 days was not enough!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Boardwalk Villas!”
Reviews.Author: trirae
