Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Boardwalk Villas. We rented points from a DVC member, which made the stay a great bargain. I can't think of a single real complaint about our stay. We traveled with 4 adults and 2 children and stayed in a 2 bdr villa. Both bedroosm were very spatious. The kitchen area was more than adequate for our needs. We didn't do a lot of cooking as we wanted to enjoy the Disney food. The living are was okay, not terribly large, and the decor left something to be desired, but I knew from pictures what to expect. We had a room that overlooked the main pool with the waterslide, and we were able to see the Fantasmic fireworks from our room. The location wasn't too far from the elevator. We didn't have any noise problems while we were there. The BEST part of the hotel is its location. We walked to Epcot on more than one occasion and enjoyed the boat ride also to Disney Studios. We spent time on the Boardwalk, eating ice cream and fudge. We also walked over to the Beach Club. We were able to take advantage of the close proximity to the Swan/Dolphin when it came to bus transportation as well. I highly recommend the Epcot area for a stay and the Boardwalk villas are fabulous. If I had paid rack rate, I might expect a little more from the furnishing, but for the price, I was completely satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at the Boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: cb300blue
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first trip to Disney World with my wife and four year old son. We stayed at the BoardWalk Villas from December 5th - 11th. The weather was fantastic with sunny skies and temps ranging in the mid-70's to low 80's for our entire stay! We really enjoyed our 1 bedroom villa (#5026) and highly recommend the villas if your budget can allow it. Our room was a corner unit at the end of the hall overlooking the pool and canal to MGM. I read a lot of reviews about the elevator being far away, and if you consider a 3-4 minute walk to the elevator "far" then yes it's far. We were at the corner of this property and never felt that the walk to the elevator was daunting. We used the stairs a lot just for the convenience factor but I understand that if you have a stroller this is not an option. Here are some specific observations: *The Magical Express bus service from and to the airport was great! *Room was clean and the daily maid service was nice. You don't get daily service if you're a vacation club member. *Having the extra bedroom was great as it allowed our four year old to sleep in comfort without us having to worry about waking him up. Whirlpool tub as well as the washer and dryer were also nice options. *The pool was fun, though my son spent most of his time in the smaller kiddie pool. He was intimidated by the clown slide, but not because of the clown but rather the height and speed. Pool was heated though the heater was down one day we swam. *Internet access is $9.95 per 24 hours of service. They did supply an ethernet cable in the room if needed. *Holiday decorations were up and everything looked very festive. *Staff was overall very friendly. I will tell you that if you stay anywhere for a week you're bound to run into an employee that isn't having a good day. Don't let this ruin your stay, just move on. During our stay I saw several instances throughout Disney where families were up in arms about very trivial things. It seems like a waste of time and energy to me. *Walk to Epcot was about 10 minutes or less. If the boat isn't sitting at the dock, it's much quicker to just walk. If you're planning on taking the monorail at the front of Epcot, you're going to be looking at a 20-30 minute walk from the Boardwalk to the loading point. *Boat ride to MGM is about 15-20 minutes from the Villas once you get on the boat. You can also walk to MGM if you like, which may be quicker than waiting for a boat. I was told there was no bus service to MGM from the Boardwalk. *Bus service between WDW theme parks was overall very nice and seem to run about every 20-30 minutes. Keep in mind that if there is a wheelchair or scooters on the bus that it does take time to off load and load these so this can increase wait times. Be patient and if you REALLY need to be somewhere on time, don't push your luck and go early. *I read a post that you can get "protective" rubber sheets or padded sheets from housekeeping at all WDW Resorts to protect the mattress from potential bedwetters. All I can say is that the Boardwalk Villas didn't have this and it would be wise to call ahead to your resort to confirm this if you think you'll need it. I asked the maid for this and she came up with a nice solution and provided me with what looked like the inner liner of a shower curtain. While my son is 99% potty trained, we felt it best to do what we could to protect the pullout mattress. Being at Disney we knew he would be extra tired and this can certainly be a contributor for bedwetting accidents. *If you're a family with young children and plan to spend most of your time at Magic Kingdom, you may want to stay somewhere closer. Location can't be beat if you're going to spend a lot of time at Epcot and MGM. *We ordered groceries online from GardenGrocer that were delivered to our hotel and left with the Bell Hop. Highly recommend this if you need to order a larger quantity of food. The grocery store on the boardwalk does have a few items but the selection is limited and it is pricey. *Entertainment on the boardwalk is fun, though we were pretty beat at the end of the day so we didn't see too much. *We ate at the Boma restaurant at Animal Kingdom Lodge one night and since there was no direct bus back to the Boardwalk Villas we took a van taxi. For 4 adults and 3 children in our group, it was only $13. We thought it was money well spent as the kids were getting tired. The other option was to take a bus back to one of the theme parks (Animal Kingdom) and then catch another bus back to the Villas, which could take some time. *We were on the Disney Dining Plan and we thought it was well worth it! Be aware you do get a lot of food and finicky eaters will be harder to please. Overall, we had an excellent trip and can't wait to return, though we'll probably try another resort to mix things up. I highly recommend going during the non-peak periods as the it was crowded enough as it was. Also, be sure to go when the parks first open as the first 3 hours had very minimal waiting times for rides. Also utilize the Fastpass system and this will keep you on schedule to see what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Housefrau1
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Boardwalk Villas. We have stayed at several other Disney deluxe resorts within the last few years. We have 2 children under the age of six and wanted a resort location that was close to the parks. The exterior and lobby of this resort is very nice. We stayed in a 1bd. villa and when we entered the room we were quite surprised at how small the room sizes were. The kitchen needs updating and was so small. The living room sofa was very uncomfortable. We had to call housekeeping to come back to "clean" the unit again because there was hair (curtains & carpet) from the previous guests all over the place . Popcorn was spilled inside the cabinets. Crumbs on the kitchen floor & tables. Serious mold problem in the shower. The hot water faucet in the bath wouldn't turn. The dryer had a horrible high pitched squeek. It was just disgusting. I will never stay at this resort again. The front desk clerk was very rude. The bellhops were so slow that we had to call to find out where our bags were that were suppose to be brought up immediately after waiting over 30 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: wizoz01
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Boardwalk Villas for our Honeymoon. As soon as we walked into the main lobby I knew we had made the right choice. This place is awesome! Our room was very clean. Even though the rooms for the villas were not supposed to be cleand but once during our stay they actually were cleaned every morning while we were at the parks. I was very happy with our stay. We had a one bedroom villa over-looking the "Quiet pool" with the world Swan in the background. The room was very spacious and the jacuzzi tub was great. The ambiance of the Boardwalk is captivating.

Reviews.Title: “"Welcome Home"”
Reviews.Author: lumkim
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th time staying at the BWV (using our Disney Vacation Club points). Our family loves this place. We have two boys, ages 2 and 7. Both enjoy the resort tremendously. The pool is very refreshing and a must do in the warmer weather. The community center is a fun reprive from the parks as well. You can walk to both Epcot or MGM (although you could also take the ferry). Either way there is no need to fold up the stroller and hop an overcrowded bus after the fireworks. We love the restaurant Flying Fish on the boarwalk, and also enjoy the access to the many dining choices that Epcot provides. We did have some billing errors with the front desk, so double check. All in all, it is our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Boardwalk. Villas are awesome.”
Reviews.Author: DallasTraveler06
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Boardwalk, the first visit being on the Inn side, rather than the Villas which we selected this time. We stayed in a 1-bedroom villa, so we had a separate master bedroom, with a king-size bed, large soaking tub and separate sink area, which joined with the common bathroom (shower, toilet, sink). Then there was separate living area (couch and TV), eating area with table and chairs, and a generously sized kitchen. Though we have stayed at many Disney hotels and have come to Disney World at least 15 times, this was our first stay in accommodations which have a kitchen and living area. I must say it was really great. This trip was rather short for us, so we didn't have the chance to make much use of the kitchen (which was well stocked with nice dishes, glasses and silverware), but we could see how it could really increase your comfort level while at Disney World, especially for longer stays. There is so much to see and do while at the theme parks and other attractions, that it is really nice to be able to retreat into your room, have snacks available there, and know that when you wake up in the morning, you can make coffee, toast, or whatever you might like, and not have to drag yourselves out to a restaurant for breakfast or to get a cold drink. Disney World tends to tire you out severely (or that is our experience because we go and go) and it is really great to have a "room" that is more of a home base than just a bed and a bathroom. Of course, it does come with a price - we paid $540 per night (including tax) for the one-bedroom villa. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept on and it was very appreciated. The large counter space in the master portion of the shared bath was really nice. This accommodation is set up so that you can truly unpack (large closet, bathroom drawers, kitchen cabinets) and feel like it's your little home for while you are there. I will say that perhaps the maintenance/upkeep seems a little more lax on the Villas (timeshare) side than on the Inn side. We experienced moldy areas in the shower, loose doorknobs, drawers with missing drawer pulls, etc..If you remain aware of how much you're paying per night, this can actually start to be irritating, but it's important to remember that a large part of the amount you are paying each night is to be so close to Epcot and MGM - plus you have the draw of the Boardwalk. In our opinion, the Boardwalk is the best place to stay on the whole Disney property (all 47 square miles). I think next time, we will stay longer, and pay the additional amount per night for a preferred view IF that means that your room opens up to the Boardwalk - that would be really nice. We ate at 3 restaurants on the Boardwalk this trip: The Big River Grille, the ESPN restaurant and Spoodles. Our meal at the Big River Grille was only average at best, and we quickly racked up a $100 bill. The food was disappointing, certainly, but it was nice to sit outside on the Boardwalk. The ESPN restaurant was far less expensive - I believe our bill was under $30, but we only had nachos, iced tea and a chicken sandwich. I would only eat here again, though, if there were no other options, as it didn't stand out. We do love Spoodles, though, and breakfast there is always a hit. They have great coffee, good food, decent prices, and the atmosphere is a wonderful mix of Mediterranean decor. Finally the Boardwalk does have a cute little bar not far off from the lobby, which we have enjoyed before because it was quiet and relaxing, but we found that on a Saturday night after the fireworks, it was crowded and understaffed. They do stock a nice selection of liquors which cannot go unmentioned. We definitely recommend the Boardwalk Villas to anyone who is able to pay the high rates - if you are able to manage it, it will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again and again!”
Reviews.Author: TwinMomPA
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk is such a lovely place, and you can't beat the convenience. We stayed in a 1BR villa overlooking the clown pool. We paid extra for the "preferred location" room - it was worth it! We requested a room close to the elevator, and we got one just around the corner from it. Also, it was a 2nd floor room which is on the same level as the lobby, so we only used the elevator when heading out to the Boardwalk, the pool, Epcot and MGM. We have 2 yr old twins, and we loved having so much within walking distance. Also, when we returned to the hotel for afternoon naps, one of the adults could wander around the Boardwalk and Epcot. Having all of the Epcot restaurants nearby was great - we took advantage of that. Also loved having the kitchen and washer/dryer. I ordered groceries from Gardengrocer before we left, and they were at the concierge when we arrived - I highly recommend it. The bedroom easily fit two Disney-supplied cribs for our toddlers, and that saved lots of headaches. Transportation on the buses was very good. Not much else to say except that I am a huge Boardwalk fan and can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: sk8mommy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 9 nights at the Boardwalk Villas, and once again, this was a wonderful Disney vacation and excellent family hotel. This was our 4th time staying at the Boardwalk, in a One Bedroom Villa. The room and entire hotel are clean, and the staff is friendly and accomodating. We love the convenience of the full kitchen and laundry room in the room. We chose the "boardwalk view" room, which overlooked the Boardwalk (great to be able to watch the juggler, magician, etc from our balcony), Epcot, and the surrounding hotels. We had great views of the Epcot and Magic Kingdom Fireworks, too! The pool at the Boardwalk is excellent--clean, plenty of lifeguards, plenty of lounge chairs- and my two children (9&7) loved the waterslide. We has one slight issue with another child at the slide, however, we did not complain. But, the lifeguard overheard the child (he was rude etc.. to several children waiting on line for slide), and the management asked the boy's family to leave the pool. I have stayed at several of the Disney hotels, most on multiple occassions, and the Boardwalk is definately the nicest.

Reviews.Title: “An Ok Stay”
Reviews.Author: thewearytravelers
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk Villas are great! The rooms are spacious and the balony is an added plus. The elevators are FAR from the rooms making it a tiresome journey to go down to get a cup of coffee or icecream! That was one of our only problems! It is a long walk to the boardwalk to get food,drinks, or anything else! There are elevators,stairs, and walkways involved in that process. The gift shop is nice. Has a lot of things like milk,cereal,etc so you can save money and eat in your villa instead of going out. I would not recommend a refillable mug at the Boardwalk because there are no fill it yourself stations! You have to wait in line at the sometimes very long bakery line and then they have to take it back and fill it up for! It is a pain and hassle! I would say bring your own drinks. Check-in was quick and we had a great view from our balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mavwu
Reviews.Content: We got this Villa through someone who with Disney Vacation Club. We stayed there for one week and it worked out fantastic for us! We had a 1 Bedroom and it was perfect for us. We decided that we had one of the best views in the whole place. Our balcony overlooked the boardwalk and we could see the fireworks from Epcot every night. We were within walking distance to Epcot, which worked out very nicely for us, since we were on the Disney Dining Plan. We did not think it was too noisy at all. Our room was right above a restaurant and it really wasn't that bad. We traveled with our 2 1/2 year old and he never woke up from it. Our son slept in the pullout and it worked out perfectly. The hotel provided us with bed rails and he thought it was great. One of his favorite things was eating breakfast every morning on the balcony. We did love going to the Boardwalk Bakery every morning for a cup of coffee before heading out for the day. The location was so convenient for us. We would do the park hard all morning, return back to our hotel for the nap and then head back out. One of my sons favorite things about the boardwalk is the nightly entertainment, or as he called them "the silly men". they are just people who are walking around the boardwalk and juggling, doing magic tricks or a combination of both. He was mesmerized by them! Our rooms were clean and very nice. The decor isn't my taste, but it was clean and nice and that is all that matters to me. Since this is part of the Disney Vacation Club, there is no housekeeping, they do take out the trash and gave us new towels once while we were there . The pool was nice, but it was not something my son got into. He was too small to use the water slide, and frankly the giant clown is kinda freaky. The pool at Saratoga Springs is our favorite! The elevators are far away and it was a bit of a hike to get to them. The first day it seems the longest, but after that, you get kinda used to it. But since we did stroller my son it made it much easier and faster to get him to the elevator. The elevator thing would not be something to deter us from coming back. Customer Service by each cast member was friendly and prompt. When we arrived the bedrails were not there like we asked. We simply called down and within minutes they were at our door. Overall we will definitly plan to stay here again. Everything worked out great and we would recommend this place in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mommyrn
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Boardwalk Villas and can not say enough great things about our stay there. Everyone was terrific! Check in time is 4pm and because of travel arrangements we arrived about 45 minutes early. Not really a problem as the Boardwalk has plenty to keep you busy, problem was we had two toddlers with us and they were not easily entertained. We waited until a few minutes after 4 to inquire about our room, only to be told that it was not ready yet. As we walked away from the desk, the manager happened by and asked if everything was OK, well after spending an hour chasing 2 little ones we told him that we were ready to go to our room but apparently it was not ready yet. His response was courteous and prompt. In less than 3 minutes he had us changed to another room and we were on our way, in fact he took our room number and had our luggage delivered immediately!!! The pool area is fantastic and was a comfortable temperature for February. We had the 1 bedroom suite and I slept on the pullout couch with one of the toddlers. It was very comfortable, definitely not your typical pullout couch. We called the desk to ask if they had bedrails for the toddlers and we were told that they could bring them up, the girl answering the phone said "We are in the middle of shift change so it might be an extra few minutes, is that ok?" We told her that yes we would be in our room for a while, well in less than 10 minutes we had the bedrails and an apology that it "took so long". We were truly amazed. The kids loved the hotel and when we had to leave they begged to go back again. This hotel is typical Disney...they leave you wondering how they do it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Families”
Reviews.Author: Stenna
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 11 nights in a two bedroom suite (which is a one bedroom suite connecting to a studio). The one bedroom suite side is excellent - good size kitchen and living area, separate bedroom and two bathrooms (one with toilet and shower, one with a jucuzzi bath). Studio is pretty much a standard size hotel room with a wet bar shoehorned into the entrance hall. Bathroom very small. Didn't worry us at all as we had the suite as well but I would caution those looking for a luxury holiday that the studio will possibly not meet expectations. Location, as others have noted, is excellent. We found the walk to MGM a little to long with children but the ferry service was frequent enough that this did not matter. Transport to other parks and downtown disney was very efficient. Service was also very very good - I don't know what it is but Disney sure motivates their staff. Only poor service the whole holiday was at Spoodles restaurant (which I thought was overrated in any event). On that note, the Disney dining plan offers excellent valueand I recommend it. We bought some groceries at Goodings supermarket and ate in the room twice which gave us enough credits to eat at some of the high end restaurants - great value. I would recommend this hotel particularly to those with children, due to its proximity to two theme parks, the excellent swimming pools and recreation activities on the boardwalk and the size of the one bedroom suites. Not cheap though . . . .

Reviews.Title: “Always a wonderful stay at the Boardwalk Villas”
Reviews.Author: mdigirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Disney's Boardwalk Villas for our honeymoon. We had a one bedroom suite up on the 5th floor in the DVC section, overlooking the Swan Hotel & waterway below. It was great having a small kitchen to make breakfast in the morning and little snacks later in the day and it saved us on always spending money on dining out. One of the best parts about our room was the jacuzzi tub...after a long day of walking around the parks, it really helped soaking our feet. We used the Boardwalk's fitness room on a daily basis. It was a little crowded in the early morning, but almost deserted in the afternoon. One of the best things about staying at the Boardwalk is the short walk over to Epcot's World Showcase (less than 5 minutes) and to MGM (about 10 minutes). We always spend every evening at Epcot, so it makes it very convenient going back to the Boardwalk after Illuminations. Hands down, we would definitely go back to the Boardwalk for a future stay...I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Just Returned Great Time”
Reviews.Author: tigger8899
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the BoardWalk Jan 17th till the 22nd. Had a great time.. Stayed in a 1 Bedroom Vacation Home just mysel and wife. Thje pools were great location is great and within walking distance of MGM and Epcot. Jan 19th a watermain broke on the 3rd floor they were there within 10mins to fix and repair the problem. After all the water went everywhere it was cleaned up and repainted within 12 hours. As always BW is a great place we have stayed at BW over 10 times with no problems

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't have to pay the Disney rate!”
Reviews.Author: travelingcheap
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights at Disney's Boardwalk Villas in a Studio accomodation. Sadly, I was quite disappointed. The room seemed only slightly larger than your standard hotel room at a Disney Deluxe, but was missing those extra touches. Negatives: 1) the bathroom door was dinged up with paint chips and a sizable chunk was missing from the side (probably quarter sized). There was also visible rust on the inside door frame in the bathroom. 2) the microwave worked properly, but would randomly start entering "4s" on it's own. This actually woke me up one night during our stay - quick fix was to just unplug it. 3) Sink was not granite like most of the deluxe rooms at Disney and the mirror actually had paint runs on it from the last time the wall had been painted. Positives: Location, Location, Location Also, the hotel in general was suburb - even if the room was a disappointment. Paid less than I would have booking a moderate direct thru Disney - Otherwise, I would have rated at three stars. Overall: I would not recommend this hotel at the Disney rate. If you're going to pay at or above $200/night - check out rooms at Disney's Beach Club (just across the water from Boardwalk). Also, if location is not at issue, check out Wildnerness Lodge or Animal Kingdom. I would rate all three higher than the Boardwalk for overall theme and feel. However, only the Beach Club offers similar location amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dirty room”
Reviews.Author: FLMad_Dog
Reviews.Content: Stayed between Christmas and New Year's for 3 nights with kids. You can't beat the location, as you can walk to Epcot and MGM. Staff was pleasant, but the room was not as clean as you'd expect, especially for $600/night. I dropped something behind the bedside table, and while trying to retrieve it found an old sock, various food wrappers, dirt and crumbs, etc. The hallway carpet was worn and looked dirty also. Cleanliness aside, there's a lot to do for kids, with multiple pools, bikes and games for checkout, and the Boardwalk. Grounds are beautiful. If they would just clean the rooms better, and replace the hallway carpet, it would be a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: GradyKenney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villas (one bed, family room with kitchen and one bath) from January 13-20, 2007. This hotel is in a great location. You take a boat to MGM and Epcot. You take a bus to all other attractions. The boardwalk always has something going on including the ESPN Club. If we could do it again we would stay across the lake at the Yacht and Beach Club which has a kid friendly pool and nicer accomodations. The room which you are not in much due to the attractions is average, but having a kitchen is a huge plus. I would recommend this hotel but if I had my choice I would stay across the lake.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Boardwalk villas need a extreme renovation”
Reviews.Author: ttenil
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Disney's Boardwalk villas. We went during Christmas week 2006. Needless to say we spent a small fortune to stay on what Disney classifies as a "Deluxe" hotel. This place is by no means a deluxe hotel!!! The front desk service was absolutely horrible! No one cared about your problems or were knowledgeable enough to help you. Everyone seemed extremely incapable. The place seems worn and not kept in Disney's usual top notch condition. Our room had an ant problem, and no one seemed to care. The grounds did not seem to be in top condition as well as the pool area. We stopped by the Wilderness lodge and this was a beautiful hotel as well as the Grand Floridian hotels. These hotels seem like a Deluxe category. Our room seemed like we could have gone to the Ramada hotel for $80 a night. It's absurd what I spent for one night stay at this hotel. The only good thing about this hotel is it's proximity to Epcot and MGM. But even knowing this one good poilnt, I would not stay at the Disney's Boardwalk villas ever again unless it unerwent a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: RaceHorseLady
Reviews.Content: We are members of the Disney Vacation Club...one of the best decisions we ever made. My husband allowed me to purchase sight unseen (by him). The Boardwalk is our "home" property...we could utilize our points around the world but my husband loves the Boardwalk so much that we always end up staying there. One of the best things about the Boardwalk is it's location...just a short walk to Epcot and a boat ride to MGM...this makes a big difference when trying to plan your strategy to see all the parks. The other thing we like so much are all the restaurants and stores beneath your "apartment". We have so many good memories of our stay there...just a note though...if you are looking for peace and quiet....I would recommend the Key West resort at WDW. Boardwalk has a peppy, upbeat feel and is not especially restful.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: LauraRN
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk Villas are top notch. I have stayed at the Grand Floridian a few times and the Polynesian. Boardwalk Villas are more spacious and of course newer. Lots of things for little ones to see and do. Very easy to get around. Would HIGHLY recommend. 5 star all the way!

Reviews.Title: “when did disney stop being fun”
Reviews.Author: etivnan
Reviews.Content: the boardwalk villas were beautiful by no means. but beauty is not all you need when you are on a vacation like disney world. when did they start building the resorts so big that you can't get around easily. have small kids and have your villa a half a mile away from any elevator. not bad in the mornings but spend all day at the parks and then have that long walk to get to your room. when did disney become all about money and not about fun and convenience. forfeit a villa and throw in an elevator make your guests have an effortless stay isn't that what vacations are all about relaxing and having fun. we've never worked so hard for a vacation in our lives. the villas had many problems---no running hot water for showers, hairdryers that didn't work, tv remotes that didn't work and passes that don't work when you are trying to get into a park. those things can be expected sometimes but not when you are spending thousands of dollars to stay there. and have the service people argue with you that nothing is wrong. we found the front desk people to be very rude and ignorant. we were very disappointed with our stay at the boardwalk and will let our travel agent know and will let everyone we know know not to stay there. we thought disney was about family and fun the disney way well those days seem to be gone. disney isn't special anymore it's like any old vacation now.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dougbetsy
Reviews.Content: We are Disney Vacation Club members. The Boardwalk Villas are our home resort. This was our first stay there. We loved it. Our group included myself, husband, son (14), daughter (12), my mom and step dad, my sister, brother in law, and nieces (16 & 13). We had 3 one-bedroom units overlooking the boardwalk. Everything was spotless and in perfect working order. The Disney "magic" was every where. Pool was fun and exciting, yet very comfortable. Our room was at the VERY end of the hall, right next to Jellyrolls. This was no problem for us. There was no late-night noise as the bar closed. The nearby stairs made it a breeze to exit the building for the BW or MGM. The kids became evening regulars at the Community Hall. They played a few games briefly then checked out a free DVD for the night. If I was forced to give one negative about the resort, I'd say it's the absence of waiters/waitresses at the pool. It would have been nice to have someone bring us our drinks. But, no biggie. We simply took turns shuttling back and forth to the bar.

Reviews.Title: “The unsafe and very averge experience”
Reviews.Author: Bacibutch
Reviews.Content: We went on line to Waltdisney and searched DELUXE hotels and found there were serveral. We then probed further becuase we wanted two rooms, be it a one bedroom suite or two separate rooms as we have a 2 1/2 year old and a 1 year old. So we were convinced by reservation agents after looking at the kids suite at the Loews that we needed to book a villa at Disney. There are only three resorts that have villas, the Beach Club, Saratoga Springs and the Broadwalk Inn. A Villa consists of one master bed room with a living room and kitchen that has a sofa bed. Which was prefect for what we needed. Based on that we booked a Villa at The BroadWalk. Our first night my 21/2 year old touched a wood blind which fell on him and cut his hand. We called the manager which offered to call his engineer and we asked for bandaids. Bandaids never came, the enigineer went back and brought them. Our room was dirty when we first checked in. Bed was uncomfortable. Housekeeping decided not to show up on the 3rd day. The manager said it was because we booked a time share room, which no one had explained we would be treated different and no one explained that it was time share. Overall hotel was very average and we paid for a deluxe resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort. Disregard the elevator issue”
Reviews.Author: grozgroz
Reviews.Content: This was a great resort. i've heard so much about the elevators being too far from the rooms. This may be true, but be sure to ask for a room facing the pool area with the slide and you won't have a problem. During the first two days, the pool was very cold. We voiced our complaints and within two days the water was warm and we all enjoyed the pool. The staff was always friendly and accommodating. I recommend a room facing the main pool with the slide. The boardwalk rooms could invade your privacy. A successful trip depends on your ability to get a room near the elevators. For those flying, take advantage of the hotels ability to chekc your luggage at the hotel so you don;t have to carry it to the airport. This service was great. I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: lds307
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Boardwalk Villas (a part of the vacation club) in a one bedroom suite. The room was extremely large with a wonderful bathroom and kitchen facilities. The staff was great. We truly had no complaints. The pool was a hit with both kids (ages 5 & 2)--especially the slide. If I had to say one thing-it would be that they could use more chairs and tables at the pool although we did not run into a problem. The boardwalk was a lot of fun-especially with the entertainment and the surrey bike rentals. Spoodles restaraunt was outstanding with great service and food and the Bakery was pretty good for pastries in the morning. We had no problem with catching the bus (with a stroller) and arriving at our destinations in a fair amount of time. It did get quite crowded coming back from Downtown Disney late, late at night and my husband had to stand the whole way. We had such a pleasant time that we ended up staying an extra night in order to use the pool again for the day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay w/ 2 kids under 6. !!”
Reviews.Author: lichtfamily
Reviews.Content: Recent stay in 1Bd villa over Memorial Day (4 days). Nicely appointed pool view room with easy elevator access. Also they offer frequent shuttles to Epcot and MGM Studios via boat (each park separately). It is also a quick walk to Epcot (5 minutes) with a short express entry point between France & England areas of Epcot. Same is true for the Beach Club Villas. We enjoyed the boardwalk area with restaurants and bike rentals, nice in the evening and not crowded like Downtown Disney (avoid - parking is difficult & usually full at night). Try the ESPN restaurant. Traveling with tots tip: there is a small playground adjacent to the "baby" pool. Nice to have it so close. Room service was excellent too. Surpasses the newest DVC resort (SS) when comparing similar stays.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: ASMyer
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from a five night stay at the Boardwalk Villas. It was a great trip and the Boardwalk is so convenient to MGM and Epcot. We loved being so close to those parks and the Magic Kingdom was just a bus ride away. It was great to take a walk on the Boardwalk when the kids got rammy and also there are a couple of nightclubs on the Boardwalk if you want to grab a drink. We were fortunate to have my in-laws with us so my husband and I went to ESPN Sports restaurant one night. We had twp adjoining rooms. I guess you would call them a 1 bedroom (1 bedroom, full kitchen, living room) and a studio (queen size bed, fold out sofa, and kitchenette that included microwave and fridge). They were great. We were able to have dinner 2 nights at the villa and for very little cost. We also had breakfast most mornings. We arranged for our car service to stop at Publix before we arrived so we bought basic groceries and whatever we had left we told the housekeeping staf that they could help themselves and they were appreciative considering we left a lot of unopened things. Anyway it was a fabulous vacation and we are planning on going again when our youngest is a little older so he can enjoy more of the rides. Feel free to e-mail if you have any questions!!
